Reviews.Author: J. Mcnair
Reviews.Content: I recently invested in this product as the regular security systems had way to much cost with installation and monthly fees. I could not be happier with my decision. The items arrived fast and were incredibly easy to set up. I had the alarm system up and running in less then 20 minutes. The ability to add on other items as needed is a great asset as is the fact that you can take it with you when you leave your home. This product really is a steal and I have recommended it to many other people. Do not hesitate to purchase this over ADT or some other high monthly fee security system.

Reviews.Title: A good alternative to those who want a monitored system without a landline.
Reviews.Author: Big G
Reviews.Content: Pretty easy to install.  I didn't trust the adhesive in my very hot climate.  I have had bad experience with the glues letting go after a time with other self adhering  products.  Not a big issue since they also include small screws to supplement the installation.  The glue helps with the placement and holding of the wireless magnets and sensors while you are mounting the sensors with the screws.  The instructions are pretty clear and the only problems I had was with the size of the screws being very small and not easily handled as well as removing the covers to find the screw mounting holes.  Both not a big issue.  i purchased extra sensors and had to go thru one more step so the base station would recognize the sensors.  Again not a big issue the instructions are good.  For those of you that want a system that isn't monitored.  The only issue I ran into in the beginning is that before I signed up for monitoring the base station blinked and an error showed that there was no monitoring.  I read the instructions and found no way to turn that off.  The alarm still worked as far as I know but you would have to call to find out if the error could be turned off.  The web site says that you don't need to sign up for monitoring so I would guess there is a way to turn it off.

Reviews.Title: It saved our construction site
Reviews.Author: scfromsc
Reviews.Content: My brother and I were restoring an old house. On Tuesday we had the copper water pipe delivered and stored inside at the job site. I had found the Simplisafe Alarm on Amazon and had it installed on a Wednesday at about 4pm. The next morning at 4:30 am we had a break in. Thanks to Simplisafe the thieves left the site without stealing any of the extremely expensive pipe. The system worked well in that the siren went off and scared the burglars away. The sensors work well and can be removed easily when the job is done. The phone support staff were excellent to work with.During the first 30 seconds of triggering the alarm, no signal is sent.Once the siren goes off the alert has been sent. If the alarm is unplugged or destroyed during that 30 second time period no alarm is sent.Our burglars destroyed the base station 1 minute after the siren went off. What we did after the break in was to place the alarm base station in a hard to get to spot (must be in sight of a window)that would take more than 30 seconds to get to. You can also set the system on instant mode and there will be no delay. Also, during the first three days that the system is up and running it is in a test period and the company won't call anyone if the alarm goes off. After the break in, we had the company switch us to active mode from test mode. We were lucky that the thieves couldn't know this. I really like the website. It gives you lots of options and a full record of all activity with your system. We only need the system for about 4 months so we didn't want a contract. It more than paid for itself in the one time that we needed it.

Reviews.Title: Easy install, lowest monitoring fee
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: Installed this myself six months ago, no problems with sensors falling off,  vinyl windows, two steel doors wirh wood frames. Waited a month for us to get used to it before activating the monitoring.  No false alarms, monthly self checks always good.  Can turn on and off the monitoring if you want.  Cell reception isn't an issue in our location.  Spanaway WA .  Monthly monitoring only $15.00.  I recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great System
Reviews.Author: fbw
Reviews.Content: I have had 3 different alarm systems in 6 years. All were JUNK and expensive. I have had a Simpli-Safe system for 10 months. This is a very reliable system. If you do have a problem, Simpli-Safe customer service is the best I have ever dealt with in my 65 years. TOP-NOTCH. I have since bought a second system and installed it in my daughters house in another state. And, no contracts, what a deal. I test the dispatch service from time to time and the phone call comes within 2 minutes. Love the i-phone app and the Simpli-Safe website. Thanks Simpli-Safe.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't do its job!
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: I purchased ~$400 kit from SimpliSafe directly since their site had more kits than Amazon. I bought it for my house which was completely empty at the time but I wanted to make sure nothing was happening until I moved in. Within a day one of the motion sensors tripped around midnight - in a completely empty house. It must be real right?! We rushed 15 miles there to find literally nothing. Since we were in "training mode" not a single call was made to us.After we moved in, a cat triggered a different motion sensor – something we were told was not supposed to happen. I wasn't able to get the call but my wife cell was also on the account. She wasn't a primary contact so they sent the police... Thing is, I could not set up a second primary contact online, only by calling. The cat tripping the sensor happened one more time before I removed all their batteries and put them in a box.Now, I had the system set to "Home" basically just entry sensor mode and my wife opened the door. Nothing happened!!! It should have triggered, freaked out, alarmed. Something. I go over to the base station and the light is out. Outlet has power but the normal blue light is missing. I unplugged it and the alarm triggers as it regains power or whatever.Its really disconcerting that something that is supposed to make you feel safe actually does literally nothing but cause you stress and will probably not work in the case of a real break in. I saw so many reviews on Amazon and YouTube to convince me this was a good buy, but at ~$400 + $15/mo I might as well just pay a reputable local company to do it. That way I could actually get tech support, have a real person on the ground come fix the bugged system.

Reviews.Title: A bat triggered our alarm!
Reviews.Author: LotusElan
Reviews.Content: Shortly after installing our new Simplisafe system we left on a multi-week trip during which we had limited cell phone service. Our system tripped inexplicably and since Simplisafe could not reach us, they sent the police to our house. The police found no evidence of break-in. The next day we received word of this through relatives on our Simplisafe call list who took the emergency call from Simplisafe in the middle of the night. Since we had no clue what could have triggered the alarm, we then called Simplisafe and had them disable the call-police feature until we could get home and sort things out. Of course, this defeated the purpose of buying the security system in the first place, but we feared multiple false alarm calls to the police, which come with increasingly expensive fines in our city.Simplisafe could not explain the false alarm, but one of the possibilities they mentioned was a mouse. This came as a surprise since a mouse is far lighter than a 30-pound pet, and their website says an animal under 30 pounds won't trip the system. But apparently a mouse, if close enough to the motion detector, looks big and can set off the alarm. We knew that a mouse was not the problem since our motion detectors are four feet above the floor. The mystery continued.After a month back at home, with no further alarm incidents, we re-enabled the call-police feature with Simplisafe. I know it's really gross, but just this morning I have found a dead bat in a ceiling light fixture in the room adjacent to the motion detector. I am now convinced that the bat was our culprit all along! I don't know which is more unnerving, the fact that we had a bat or the fact that the Simplisafe system is so easily triggered.

Reviews.Title: Good technology, average monitoring service
Reviews.Author: O. Solomon
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this system and it was very excited to get it installed.  I have to say this system is so easy to set up, anyone that isn't blind should have no trouble with it.  The instructions are simple, clear, and I love the "peel-and-stick" process.I had my system up and running in about 10 minutes.  I haven't screwed in any of the sensors because I think the 3M tape should hold it fine.  Their smoke detector, however, only uses screws and no tape is provided for it.Disclaimer:  I didn't buy this from Amazon, but directly from SimpliSafe's website.  And that's only because Amazon didn't have all the sensors in the package I wanted.  So my setup includes:- Panic Button- Extra 105DB siren- Second motion sensor- Second key remoteI hope Amazon matches the packages on their website, since I prefer to buy from Amazon whenever I can.  But here are things I like about the system:1. It's extremely simple to use and install2. Cellular connectivity so there are no wires to install anywhere3. Monitoring service (should you use it) is relatively cheap4. The ability to create additional key codes for baby sitters, guests, etc.5. The ability to remotely configure and change your sensor set up (requires the premier monitoring service)6. Mobile app for certain phones (requires the premier monitoring service).  But the ability to arm/disarm when you're away is really nice.Now on to the some complaints about this system:1. The monitoring service left me irritated the first time I had to use them.  I was celebrating Christmas with family 7 hours away when I got the call from the monitoring center, saying my motion sensor had triggered an alarm!  I was initially upset, but realized I accidentally left one motion sensor on the kitchen counter (d'oh!).  My cats go up there all the time, so they tripped the alarm.  Yes, the motion sensors are pet friendly, but only IF you place it on a wall a few feet off the ground.  In any case, they told me they had already dispatched the police.  When I asked if they could cancel the police dispatch, they said it wasn't possible.  So here I was, 7 hours away from home, wondering if the cops were going to break down my door.  The monitoring service didn't give me any helpful information.  They said they would call me back when the cops showed up to the house, but never heard back.  Uggh.  Maybe this is the way all of them work?  I just wasn't particularly impressed.  I'm hoping the next time it works out better.2. That brings me onto my second issue. If you think there's no upsell to get you to buy their higher priced monitoring service, you haven't done your homework.  There's always an upsell!  If you want to remotely disable a sensor, you have to get the premium monitoring package.  If you want the mobile app, you have to get the premium monitoring package. etc. etc.  I still think it's cheaper than ADT and Comcast, but don't assume that there's no monthly cost.  That said, if all you want are the sensors and no monitoring, then you should be good to go.3. I really wished they had options to replace certain sensors with other ones.  Or a "build your own bundle" option.  I say that because the entry sensors are somewhat useless.  I doubt a burglar is going to try an open your door/window unless you leave it open.  Most often, they'll break the glass to get in, in which case the entry sensors don't do anything for you.  I wish I could trade in an entry sensor for a glass-break sensor, or a secondary keypad.  I live in Chicago where the houses are typically narrow and long, so it's nice to have a keypad for the front and rear door.  This is just a minor gripe.4. The cap for the USB key remote falls off easily.  I wish they had a better, more secure cap for this.  This is also a minor issue.Overall, I highly recommend this system.  It's simple, effective, and gets the job done.  I'm deducting one star for the monitoring service, but otherwise I'm a pretty happy customer.

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe--Not as simple as they say, Is it safe? Time will tell.
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Cummins
Reviews.Content: I got my product, and it truly looked simple.  Having watched the YouTube videos from the co., I expected an easy install.  I wasn't expecting 15 minutes, but 3 hours? 45 minutes on hold for support, finally left a message, no call back 3 hours later.  I called "Sales." THEY answered immediately.  The sales person did get me to a support person.  The support person was helpful.  My problem is that there are several things not mentioned in the pre-sales information or in the product videos.  The base station must be near a window, not near any electronic devices, at least 3 feet above the floor, and within 15 feed of the keypad (but not less than 10 feet from it).  The entry sensors can't be near any metal.Adding this system to a small apartment (four entry sensors and a motion sensor) should have been a breeze.  After two calls to tech support (who were very nice and helpful, by the way), I have the system working.  BUT . . . the system shows the keyboard can't establish a connection to the base station on a regular basis, and the keypad shows that a sensor is open all the time.  Test mode shows everything working, all the entry sensors blink properly showing they are closed . . . another call to tech support is coming.  At this point, I am not very comfortable with whether I am protected or not.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe, great DIY Home Security
Reviews.Author: F C
Reviews.Content: I have had SimpliSafe for a little over a year now and I am pleased to say that I've been very happy with it. Installation and setup was a breeze, took less than 30 minutes. You can build your own custom setup as it's easily expandable and affordable. No complaints here.Pros: Inexpensive professional monitoring  Easy setup  No contracts  Wireless  Transportable  Customer serviceCons: Audible alarm could be louder (I plan on getting an extra 105db Siren for my system)

Reviews.Title: One yard sign is included
Reviews.Author: lyn
Reviews.Content: Got my system today. Very easy to setup; well designed web & mobile app; all devices are built with great quality.Oh, and I do receive one yard sign and two window decals with my system.

Reviews.Title: Very good.....but check your cell reception
Reviews.Author: Zed
Reviews.Content: This is a good system for the price. Service is also good. My only complaint is that at my home the cell reception for T-Mobile is poor so this has meant the dispatch service will not work efficiently. To be fair, Simplisafe offered me a Verizon module but it is delayed by 4-5 weeks. Hopefully this fixes this issue. My advice is to check the T-Mobile coverage in your area and if it is poor, request a Verizon module up front. But overall, a good product and an honest, reliable company.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for our little house
Reviews.Author: dechanique
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased our first home in December. There was a Brinks (now ADT) box installed on the property already, but we didn't want to have to purchase a landline or pay the upcharges to have a wireless system. After much research, we decided to go with Simplisafe. The installation was simple - it DOES have two options, the sticky backs and two small screws. I had to use a combination of both in several locations due to the trim on my windows (it was not flat). I disabled the motion sensor as my husband was not comfortable having that on.Our house is small (1100sf), but we also installed the sensors in our detached garage and the wireless signal extended far enough to not need to install a second base-station.We love the key-fobs - it makes arming and disarming the system so easy! We had a house-sitter while we were on our honeymoon, and we were able to just hand over the key and the key-fob and he had no issues at all. He raved about the key-fob~ My only wish is that it made some sort of visual or audible key that the system is indeed armed or disarmed. I press the off or away button several times just to make sure it's really on! Kind of wish it chirped like my car! :PI also like that Simplisafe is coming out with more devices to be incorporated into the system for complete home protection.  They already have freeze and water sensors, but are coming out with fire detectors, CO sensors and other devices to be incorporated into the system. We are definitely buying both above mentioned items when UL approves them for use.Customer service is friendly. We have not had any false alarms (one month of use), have not lost signal (we live in a big urban area, so we have no problem with cell signal), and otherwise have had no complications.We did have to file a permit with our local police department (per our County regulations). The permit was free. We received a discount on our homeowner policy, and would be eligible to receive additional discounts once we add fire and CO sensors.All in all, I recommend this system highly. Only time will tell it's long-term usefulness and responsiveness of the monitoring company, though I hope we never have to find out. :P

Reviews.Title: Great System
Reviews.Author: James or Gary
Reviews.Content: We purchased simplisafe March of this year (2012)and this works great for our home.  The couple times the system has gone off (due to us) the monitoring company has called within 10 seconds of the alarm going off. If you want a great alarm system without the hassle of a contract you should go with SimpliSafe you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Okay for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The system works, is great for people who want to be alerted in case of break ins etc and for peace of mind. They are constantly upgrading which is good but it also means that every new feature is costing more and more. e.g. Now there is simplisafe 2 with some more features but it cost more. So in the long run to keep up with simplisafe, you will have to dish out more cash (reminds me of Microsoft where you have to keep paying with every upgrade). Also we are having issues with the sensors as they are not detecting movement that easily.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME system  ... Like Magic
Reviews.Author: James DeBow
Reviews.Content: I bought my security system the other day after an alarm company salesman tried to rope me into a contract and would not answer my questions about termination fees he just kept saying it was "like everything else".  I researched online and found out that termination fees on big companies contracts can be like $3000!!! Are you kidding me... So, I did some more research and found Simpli-Safe.  I had it all set up my pin codes, sensors, online account, test signal, EVERYTHING in 30 minutes without a single hiccup or problem.  Also, if I want for an additional 5 dollars a month I can upgrade to the new simplisafe 2 system that than includes smart phone alarm management along with some other things.  I read in someone else's review from last year that not having this was a drawback so I wanted to correct that error as it is now an option.  I've never wrote a good review online about a product before.  This system so far (First day still) has been a dream.  I'm glad a company has finally made something that works how it is supposed too.  I have already recommended it to my dad and several of my friends.

Reviews.Title: Simpli-safe May not be for you
Reviews.Author: Michael Flick
Reviews.Content: To add to my review below.  I have decided to only use non motion sensors because of complications that occur when you may be gone for extended periods.  I am also trying the upgraded monitoring so I can control the sensors from my ipad.  This seems to be working well but the monthly fee is higher.Simpli-Safe was great about sending more entry sensors and refunding the cost of the motion detectors I returned.I would recommend the system.------I installed the Simpli- Safe system in my vacation home and was very happy for 4 months.  After 4 months I began to get many false alarms and the police were called.  This seems to be a good system but only if you are available to personally deal with equipment failures or other alarm issues immediately as they arise.I am not sure this is a good system if you are away from your property for long periods if time.I

Reviews.Title: Great when it works
Reviews.Author: LarryC
Reviews.Content: I've had this thing for a few months and the "version 2" model - the newest one - has a lot of issues with the smoke detectors loosing comm with the base station, and the base station losing communication with the monitoring center.  These seem like very common issues that they are working on.  It's sort of frustrating, and they are sort of slow sending out replacement smoke detectors.Until those problems are fixed, it's really not that useful as a monitored alarm system and I bot would recommend anyone install the thing, unless you really don't need all of the features.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE
Reviews.Author: Krust
Reviews.Content: This product sounds like a good idea - and I was excited at the prospect of installing myself and having a lower monthly contract fee. From the first day, I had to call support (be prepared to wait on hold sometimes 10 minutes at a time). They said I was on the border between a good and bad cell area. Too bad they could not identify this for you BEFORE you pay for the product, have it shipped and take the time to install it.The base station would not connect - so I had to keep calling support - and taking up a LOT of minutes on my cell phone.Looks like you get what you pay for. I would CALL first and see if you are in a good area. I live in a pretty high population area - so not sure if it is my location or the cell service they use ( I am pretty sure it is the latter - t-mobile.Would I recommend this?  In theory, it is a good idea - but no - I would NOT recommend it!

Reviews.Title: pleased
Reviews.Author: don't want to
Reviews.Content: the product was extremely easy to set up compared to my old radio shack model.i like the extended range and the fact that it's wireless. would have been much better if the website had offered a verizon module right off the bat, rather than having to wait till after set up to find out we were sent a t-mobile?????also, the notion of having to go through additional hoops to customize the system because we didn't want/need the more expensive service was almost childish.

Reviews.Title: Easy install but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Hutch
Reviews.Content: While the product was easy to install, it was not perfect.  The install constantly crashed on Windows 8 forcing me to locate a different PC to run it on, and the adhesive strips on one of the sensors was bad causing it to fall off the windows frame.  Fortunately, a replacement strip was included and that did work normally.  Also, the base station is listed at 85db but is not nearly that loud.  The additional 105db speaker, however, more than makes up for it.  I would recommend this to friends and/or family, but with the understanding that some of the products don't appear quite as high quality as those from the more well know security companies and the self install is not for everyone, even though it was very easy.

Reviews.Title: simplisafe...exceeded my expectations..
Reviews.Author: grog
Reviews.Content: I do not review many products, but I feel that this alarm system deserves to be recognized for what it is... simple, effective and affordable.  Installation was easy, although I did take the time to drill small holes and use the included screws for the window and door sensors.  Everything works as advertised and I love the monthly monitoring program...$15.00 and NO contract!!  Just buy it, install it, and put your mind at ease that your family, home and property will be safe.

Reviews.Title: Awesome security system at a fraction of the cost!
Reviews.Author: Hairopist
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research prior to purchasing a security system. I purchased a new home that had a competitor's system in place. I looked into the monthly fee and was surprised to find how expensive the monthly fee was. I then went to the Better Business Bureau and found the competitor's company had numerous complaints due to long contracts that could not be broken and automatic renewals that did not let customers out of their contract! What a farce!Now enter Simplisafe. I just installed this in my business. This company's product has been flawless. The monthly monitoring fee can be cancelled at any time. If you install it and don't like it, you have 60 days to return it! The monitoring fee is half the amount and is probably using the same monitoring companies that the competitors are using. This means that that these other companies are taking advantage of its customers; which is wrong! I have had no issues with Simplisafe. It was shipped and arrived quickly. It took minimal time to install a few door sensors, a motion detector, and multiple panic buttons and keychains (this was for a business). I had two triggered alarms (our mistake), received immediate notification via text alerts and phone call at the business, and the monitoring company cancelled the call to the police. This made me feel great that everything worked as it was supposed to. One alarm happened while I was 2 hours away from the business. I was able to cancel the call to police and then shut my alarm off remotely via my phone until I was able to go the business to fix the problem. HINT- purchase the upgraded package that gives you this ability-it is a huge piece of mind if you are on a trip and not able to immediately respond.I will be purchasing a second system for my home. I have not had any direct interaction with the company.....because it has worked as designed. It may not have some fancy keypad (the competitors have weather, traffic, etc), but who needs it? Why anyone would pay more per month and be tied to a 3+ year contract for the competitors' systems for some fancy keypad is beyond me.I would highly recommend Simplisafe to anyone!

Reviews.Title: i feel so much safer at home now
Reviews.Author: James Gardner
Reviews.Content: I love simplisafe...I live in a large place with lots of doors and windows and always wonder if I remembered to shut everything well when I get in bed.  Now I can even set the alarm from my bed if I wanted quick complete protection. I sleep so much better at night knowing it is monitoring doors and windows.  I also really like that it works just like a car alarm and is very easy to install.The peace of mind I have now is so much greater than I thought would be the case.The only issue I had with the system is that one late summer night, the temperatures dropped to an unseasonably low which caused the heat to turn on. The temperature change of a steam heat radiator triggered a motion sensor.  The alarm went off for the standard 5 minutes and the police were dispached to check things out.  The next day, I simply repositioned the motion sensor to an area where there was no radiator and haven't had the problem since.  So easy to make adjustments like this and thankfully I didn't have to call to make a service appointment for a hard wired motion sensor to be repositioned.

Reviews.Title: A++ Product
Reviews.Author: dman
Reviews.Content: I have been using SimpliSafe for over a year now. It is a phenomenal product....especially for the money. I also think it is awesome that the monitoring fee's are only $15.00 a month(which is optional), while other companies charge much more. One time the maintenance man of my apartment set off my alarm and sure enough I got the call from the monitoring company. The support is excellent to- I had trouble with one of the sensors and the company sent me a new one with a prepackaged label for the old one to send back. They did not give me any hassle. I highly recommend this for protecting your home. Why pay more money for the same end result from one of the more expensive companies?

Reviews.Title: Easy install, worked for me!
Reviews.Author: Skip
Reviews.Content: The install was quick and easy, the monitoring is inexpensive and prompt - I know because the alarm was tripped when I was away, and the police were dispatched to find that whoever it was had gone, and I lost nothing...VERY happy with Simplisafe!

Reviews.Title: A really great system - good hardware and service
Reviews.Author: newmediadave
Reviews.Content: Just want to go on record that this is a great system. I've used it for 9 months and it works as promised and the company is incredibly responsive. I originally used it in a big apartment and now it's in a 5,000 square foot house and works just as well. Obviously I've added more sensors. You will be happy with this equipment and the service you get.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: sarae878
Reviews.Content: I received Simplisafe in the mail. It literally took 30 mins to install and about 15 mins to program. VERY EASY! I would recommend this to anyone who wants a monitoring system that is economical, easy and has great customer service!

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe = Good night of sleep!
Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: I can finally sleep!  After three of my neighbor's houses were broken into I researched an affordable and easy system to buy.  A co-worker suggested Simplisafe.  I had our security contact research it and he said it looked like a good product to buy it.  He has checked out the system and is going to buy one for his parents rental property that has been broken into twice.

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe, pretty simple
Reviews.Author: moose
Reviews.Content: This system arrived in about 3 days as promised.  It was packed nicely and easy to access all the components.  The installation was very easy...just read all the instructions especially when you install the sensors, they do have to be aligned to the magnet in a precise manner.  I installed the whole system in less than one hour.  The only issue I had was the sensor for my front door which is a metal one.  The sensor kept falling off which is something that will cause the alarm to go off.  If you have a wooden door, you will be fine.  I had to end up putting some gorilla glue on the back and that seemed to do the trick although I may have a bit of a mess if I want to move the system when I move.  The system is very easy to use although the keypad doesn't illuminate and I have trouble seeing it without my readers.  There is a keychain remote that has a button for shutting the system off and another button for setting it when you leave plus a panic button.  If you are at home you have to use the keypad to set the alarm which is still easy...just hit "home".  They allow you three days to learn everything before you go live with the monitoring station so if you make some errors you don't have to worry about getting a call.  I like that one of the components (that actually contacts the monitoring center) has a light at the base that turns on/off and has a voice that tells you when your alarm is set for away, home, or if you are testing.  I do recommend Simplisafe, it was about half the price of a local company that I contacted initially and the monitoring fee is very reasonable.  Watch the video on their website for further information.

Reviews.Title: Challenging
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: I purchased the wireless system to replace an older system with another vendor. It was easy to install and set because of great instructions. I am not getting adequate signal for the system to function, which I had questioned before purchase. They replaced a circuit board inside the base unit and then the entire base, neither improved the situation. Now I am getting a Verizon base unit next week where the original was T-Mobil. It seems that the Verizon unit was suddenly available after originally being told that it would be two months. I don't know what changed. Through all of it, the customer service reps were excellent to work with.

Reviews.Title: A review that is easy on the eyes
Reviews.Author: TeflonDon
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. Sensors are extremely easy to install. Its like your mother holding your hand while you install it.2. Notification system: Notifies when someone opens the window or door, and when the alarm type is changed (Home/Away/Off)3. Phone app: this app is as easy to use as checking the weather app on your phone. It allows you to control the system.4. Sensors: I have had no false alarms, and my windows (14 ea), doors (2 ea), and motion sensors (2 ea), work without failure.5. Test mode: this allows you to test all sensors to ensure they are working properly6. text option: you can choose if you want to receive a text for every event (alarm triggered, Armed, Unarmed)Cons:1. I haven't met one person that has heard of Simplisafe (i work with over 2,000 people)!2. Keypad/Alarm pad looks extremely cheap (i thought it was a fisher price toy).3. Keys on Alarm pad does not illuminate. I have to use my iPhone light to turn it on/off at night.4. You actually have to pay $25 a month to really utilize the system (Iphone app, Set mode remotely, and name/label sensors).5. Sound: The triggered sound that comes from the base, and the entry delay warning beep that comes from the keypad are faint (I need to purchase the upgraded siren).I am giving this a 5 star review because when you arm the system, the base loudly says " ALARM ON" and the room lights up blue. My wife likes to randomly activate the system whenever people are in the house and it sounds and looks really impressive. My wife feels safe at home with Simplisafe, and that's all i can ask for.

Reviews.Title: A Great Investment
Reviews.Author: Ryzeldorf "Ryzeldorf"
Reviews.Content: I shopped ADT, SafeTouch(FL) and Brinks and never bought for several reasons. I am not comfortable with any of their contract games. The monthly price is high and requires a land line or the rental or purchase of adapters for cable modem dial out or cell dial out to the call center. The cost of the install is never actually free to have the devices I need to fully secure my home and they nickel and dime big time for every little add on. Another trick is the short period of time you have to cancel your account or make changes at the end of your contract term before auto-re-enrollment. It's a joke that ultimately meant I never purchased.SimpliSafe fits a niche that, I believe, will make them very successful in the long run. It's very easy to install and configure. The system is almost completely ready and pre-programmed out of the box and works flawlessly. The components are really light weight but seem well crafted. I assume this is due to the stick-on nature of the product. Just a note, screws are also included for mounting. So I mounted my whole system permanently. The screw lengths, though, are very short. I prefer a longer screw to attach the window and door sensors.I chose the $25.00/month plan as I like the monitoring and arming/ disarming from my phone.I just put in another order for some more components for a couple areas I forgot and can't wait to get them in.As for the reps, I made one call and the rep was very responsive and helpful and the overall experience has been awesome.I see SimpliSafe having a ton of success with its model as there is no one offering this type of comprehensive product/ service beginning to end. I shopped all alternatives and this was the clear winner.*** One quick note you should know>>> When the system is first activated, it will not dial out for emergency help for 72 hours after setup as this is considered your practice time before full active. So it will go off if you have an event but it will not dial out for help.4/29/13 Update- Still love this system! In fact I ordered additional window sensors, fire alarm and the Freeze/ Temp sensor. I really like that I can check in on my system at any point from my iPhone. On testing the unit I get very fast responses from the call center. On the freeze sensor, I live in Florida and would appreciate a heat alarm in the event of an AC failure. I don't think this should be too hard as it automatically alerts at 41 degrees to warn of possible freezing pipes for those up north. Maybe this will be added in the future.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommended
Reviews.Author: peggym801
Reviews.Content: 12.MAR.2013Our system arrived on 08.FED.2013 and I installed it that evening.The install was easy and quick.We have not had one issue.No failures.Even though we have a small 11 LB dog we have not had one nuisance alarm.It has performed exactly how it was advertised.The SimpliSafe.com web site makes configuration easy.I use the app on my android frequently.If you think that this is a low quality system because it is inexpensive, you would be wrong.It is in fact a quality system that lives up to and exceeds how it is advertised.It truly is a very good system at a very good price.04.APR.2013We have added more entry sensors, motion sensors, a 2nd key fob, smoke sensors and a carbon monoxide sensor.We now have every component that SimpliSafe makes and I have never regretted this investment one day.Expanding the system was very easy to do.We trust it and have so much confidence in this system that we arm it in the "Home" mode every night.We always arm it "Away" when no one is home.01.FEB.2014Everything I previously posted is still true.We have "Armed" and "Disarmed" a couple of hundred times without one issue.The system has done exactly what I expect it to do, work flawlessly.Do not think that the videos and advertising that SimpliSafe uses is just "hyping" the system to get a sale.This is a good quality system and the monitoring service is very good too.I would not have it if it did not believe in it.When I go away, I do not worry about what I might find when I come home.I feel simply safe.

Reviews.Title: Great value - reasonably easy to setup
Reviews.Author: alchemyiam
Reviews.Content: My neighbor in the cul-de sac had a break in a couple of months ago which of course scared most of the neighbors. Had several security companies come around and give me quotes for install of their systems. One of the more reputable local alarm companies were looking for ~$3K for hardware plus ~$2K for install plus high monitoring fees.Read various reviews and decide to go with this system. included some extra keychain remotes for family memebers(makes going in and out much easier), a few extra motion sensors, an extra keypad for the rear door, an extra alarm for outside the front door and proximity sensors for all the doors including the garage door for a total of ~$750.Also went with the basic (standard) monitoring plan. It would be nice to have the upgraded monitoring plan to personalize the system etc. But just nice to haves as they say. The basic plan of $14.99 seems to be excellent value compared to ADT etc.It seems to me the main vulnerability is if a burglar breaks in and smashes the base station before the entry alarm is triggered then you are screwed. I have increased the exit time alarm and at home entry alarm times to 2 mins (since they are not so critical), but set the entry alarm time to 30 secs.  I wouldn't use the SIMPLISAFE decals, but use ADT stickers just to make it more difficult to figure out what system you have. Also make sure the base station is well hidden. I bought some ADT signs and decals on ebay for ~$30.Currently they don't have their fire alarm or CO2 detectors ready yet, but claim they should be out soon.What i did was to purchase 2 x DROPCAM webcams - so I can monitor most of my house. If I get an alarm I can check out the DROPCAM cameras very quickly on my smartphone. The DROPCAMs are nice because you get basic real-time monitoring for free.The only problem I had was that 2 of the keychain remotes worked intermittently. Once I replaced the batteries they seemed to work ok. makes me wonder if their batteries are past it! Install was generally very easy. The only tricky bit was trying to find the best place to install the motion sensors to catch all burglars, but not have false alarms. For me the motion sensors probably make more sense than the window break alarms (currently not avail until later this year). Fortunately i don't have a large pet so don't have to mess around setting up motion sensors to account for that.Overall great value and great combo with the DROPCAMs

Reviews.Title: Excellent Security System - Minor Installation Issues - No Contract...
Reviews.Author: beceetwo
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Simplisafe2 Wireless Home Security System 8-piece Plus Package through the Simplisafe website in late June, 2013.  I also bought several additional Entry Sensors to fully protect my home.  This system is excellent.  It took me a couple days to get it functional, not because it is hard to install, but because I had some issues unique to my house and property that took longer to install.After four months the Simplisafe system is working fine with no problems.  Initially, I had problems installing the Entry Sensors on my casement windows.  There was not enough room for the Sensor and the magnet installation without interfering with the screen for the window.  I resolved that problem by installing the sensor between the window and the screen (screen is on the inside) on the jamb and glued ½ inch button magnets (purchased at the local big box DIY store) in the window frame by drilling (with a forstner bit) two ½ inch holes lined up with the sensor.  This worked very well and resolved that installation problem.Another problem I encountered was Entry Sensors indicating "Open" when they were closed.  After talking to Customer Service, it was determined that I had installed the magnet for the Entry Sensor on a steel door and the sensor on the jamb.  This causes the door to become magnetized and causes false alarms.  After switching the sensor to the door and the magnet to the jamb, the problem was resolved.We have had a couple instances where the system was accidentally set off and the response from the dispatch center was excellent.  We also had a situation where our granddaughter came to our house when we weren't home to drop something off and entered the wrong code.  The local Sheriff Department responded very quickly, luckily she had proper I.D. so we didn't have to bail her out of jail!!!  Point is, that if you are concerned about dispatch center response time --- I can say, by personal experience, that it is good.In conclusion, the Simplisafe Security System is an excellent product.  With 27 components in our system (4 of them in an out-building 150 feet from the house), I have had no failures to date.  The times that I contacted Customer Service, their response was courteous, quick and accurate --- I was never on "hold" more than a few seconds.  What Simpisafe charges for their premium service is less than most companies charge for basic service.  I would buy the Simplisafe System again and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Marginal but functional
Reviews.Author: NotSure
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Simplisafe basic kit with a few additional items. Installation was pretty simple. Testing was no big deal. After three days of "practice" you are moved into monitoring mode if you purchased a monthly monitoring package. After being moved into monitoring mode, I would arm the system (which speaks to you) and the voice would say something like "Unable to link to the dispatch center". I moved the base station to other parts of the house to attempt to correct this problem. My phone gets a great Verizon signal in my house so I'm not sure why the base station is having a hard time communicating. Also, the key chain remote only works when I'm inside the house which is really kind of pointless. I have the Android app on my phone and it only works when my phone is connected to WiFi. I might as well log into the web site and use it instead of the app and cut back to the $15/month monitoring. Aside from these issues it seems to work fine. Also, if you order the yard sign be prepared to get your own stick to put it on. They only send you the sign with two-sided-tape on the back. But hey, no contract is nice!!

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe Installation
Reviews.Author: John Rubio "Temeculan"
Reviews.Content: Since we just installed our SimpliSafe security system yesterday, I am only going to review the install aspects of the system.First, when I opened the package, there was a notice stating that I had to contact my local police and fire service to see if I was required to register my security system. It took me two hours of calling various local police and fire contacts to finally get an answer that no registration was required. In our area, I finally got an answer from the police and fire dispatch personnel. This is a very inconvenient waste of time and I am surprised that SimpliSafe doesn't already have this info documented. I was not made aware in my pre-purchase phone conversation with SimpliSafe that the cell phone service provider for their cell signal is T-Mobile. Since T-Mobile has a very poor signal in our area, I was a bit concerned. To my surprise, the signal seems to be working well. They do provide a landline phone jack on the base station to use as a backup. I do think they should be more up front about this info though.Next, everything went up very smoothly and per all the instructions. You should give yourself a good two hours to get everything installed and to document all the serial numbers of your devices. I took an extra hour to deactivate and disconnect my old ADT system. BTW, ADT requires 30 day notice of termination of services provided you are "out of contract."If you are mounting any device to a textured wall (i.e. keypad, motion sensors), use the screw mounts. If the adhesive fails and you device fall of the wall, the damaged devices will probably be at your cost.I am currently in the 3 day "practice mode" so we can get familiar with the system before going to live Dispatch Service. Personally, I think Simplisafe should allow the user to determine when they are ready to go to the live Dispatch Service, whether it's 3 ,2 or 1 day(s). For those that have never used a security system, I think 3 days are a good idea, but for users that have had other systems, 1 day should be enough. Per a phone conversation with a SimpliSafe representative, I was told that while in practice mode, my home is not protected.I will probably update this review in a few weeks/months to detail our experience with the service.

Reviews.Title: Simply safe is a great product
Reviews.Author: Bernadette
Reviews.Content: We have had the Simply safe alarm for about 4 months or more and we love it. It is nice to know that our home is in safe hands while we are away. Very easy to install, a lot less expensive that all other alarm systems.No contracts and better yet not a outrageous bill every month. Very affordable.

Reviews.Title: I like it....
Reviews.Author: strauba
Reviews.Content: We installed the system this year (early spring, 2012) and found it VERY easy to do so.  It's great to be able to put the keypad anywhere in the house and moving it is a snap with the removable sticky pads.  Notification emails of an armed, disarmed, or alarm activated system are great as well.  Monthly service cost ($19.99) is very reasonable too (we have just the basic burglar alarm service-no fire, etc).

Reviews.Title: Previous "Buyer Beware!" Updated w/ Verizon Service
Reviews.Author: TurtleToes
Reviews.Content: I am extremely dissatisfied with this system becasue it is unreliable. I manage a short-term rental property long-distance which requires that I be able to enable and disable the system from my computer. At least twice in the past two months, the signal did not go through when I was trying to enable it. On both occasions there had been a power outage, which happens fairly frequently in the location of my rental property. I am told that I must reboot the system. Unfortunately I live 3000 miles away and do not have anyone readily available who can just go in and do that for me. I also am now told that the cellular signal is weak in my area and that may be part of the problem. I wish I had known this before investing in this $400 system. Simplisafe should tell prospective customers that if the T Mobile cellular signal is weak, their system probably won't work adequately. Would not recommend this system to others unless they are sure they have a good cellular signal and live in the property where it is installed.Now that Simplisafe has incorporated Verizon cell phone service, I am happy to report that I no longer have to reboot my system after inevitable power outages. The connection did not fail even once this winter in spite of a number of ice storms. Changed rating from 1 to 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: NH
Reviews.Content: I am updating this review since I've now had 6 months to use this system. I agree that the value is great and the concept is great.  I was sold on the concept when I bought the system.First month:First, the keychain which connects via the USB to your computer doesn't work and SimpliSafe support blames Apple for their recent Mac update.  They specifically said "it's not our fault" as in it's Apple's fault.  I'm in the software industry, and I can tell you that it is your job SimpliSafe to adjust to the updates even if that's a pain in the butt to do.  If you haven't kept up with the updates then apologize for the inconvenience and tell me your software development team is working on a fix, instead of telling me "it's not our fault!".  The first step in the instructions is the connect the keychain to your computer.  A BIG FAIL.Second, within 48 hours the keypad froze.  The screen froze and was not syncing with monitoring.  The excuse I got was "what wall did you install it to?".  My response "the wall by the door I go in and out the most like instructed".  Then the customer rep says "is it close to a light switch?  If so, it often has this problem, just take the battery out and reboot".  That's your solution?!?  Now, most, if not all, households probably have a light switch nearby the door you enter the house.  So now, I'm told I have to move the keypad away from the light switch which mean away from the door and to an inconvenient location.  Though I was told the light switch is 'probably' the cause but can't be sure so test it for a while and see what happens.  I pointed out there was NO mention of this pretty big fault for the system.  The customer support rep just shrug it off like "oh well" and not even apologized once for my inconvenience and the failure.Third, as if the first two above weren't bad enough, the worst annoyance was the customer rep's attitude and tone.  He interrupted me repeatedly, had absolutely no aptitude for being in customer service, and was downright rude and completely obvious he hated his job and just didn't give a damn how he talked to his customer.So I give it 2 stars (generously) for my first 2 days of my experience with SimpliSafe.  I sincerely hope it gets better.  If my experience becomes better with it, and I hope it does, I'd keep the system and update the review.  If not, I'll return it and downgrade my review further.Fast forward to six month:You get what you pay for.  Again, I liked the concept.  You own the system, you pay low monitoring fee.  Who wants to be stuck with 3-yr commitment with ADT?  (I used to be stuck).  Though SimpliSafe is cheaper overall you only get what you pay for.  The customer service reps are *consistently* far less professional.  Every time I talk with them they lack professionalism, they sound like they hate their job, they don't have the customer service attitude.  Every time I've talked with monitoring people, they have the "I don't know, I'm just work for the monitoring company, I don't know details about your system".  They do not AT ALL come across as people you can trust.  Just so slack.  The DMV treats me better than this.  Now the product itself.  The motion detector isn't what it describes on the website.  The delay from key pad to central unit happens a lot.  Sometimes the system gets stuck and you have to reboot.  It's simply not reliable.  You don't want a security system that's not reliable and works "probably most of the time".  So if you are looking for a reliable product with dependable service, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe2  A good idea unless it doesn't work!
Reviews.Author: sgk1945
Reviews.Content: First I received my system and the keypad malfunctioned.  When I called customer service I found that they don't answer the phone after 3:00PM California Time.  Not too convenient.  I was close to returning the system but decided that there were so many features I liked that I would give them a chance to redeem themselves, so I had them send another keypad.  It arrived today. (They're not in a hurry to ship warranty replacement parts.)  I installed it and tested all the sensors.  I thought I was in business, so I activated my monitoring and went into test mode.....The base station did not connect to the monitoring center.  I followed instructions and relocated the base....4 times!.  It's now sitting in a window in the middle of my master bedroom.  There's no way I'm going to leave it there because it looks ugly and it would be too easy for someone to break in and smash it before the entry delay expired, but I wanted to give it the best possibility of connecting.  No joy.I tried calling customer service again but, of course, they only work on Boston time and there is no support available off hours....kind of strange for a security company.  What if I was about to leave on vacation and there was a problem?  I would have to either cancel vacation or leave without arming the system; Two bad choices.I forgot to mention, when I received my system it was just a bunch of parts thrown into a box, somewhat at random.  I suspect what they sent me was untested warranty returns.  I wonder when they receive my return, if they'll send it to someone else.I give this system 2 stars for the creative concept and affordable cost and 0 stars for customer service, quality, and reliability.I haven't totally given up but, as you can tell, I'm close to throwing in the towel.Update: 5/1/2014 I was finally able to be near my system during Sinplisafe business hours.  I ended up removing the SIM and they determined that they had the wrong number in their system.  After they corrected the error on their end everything worked.  Although I cannot improve my quality or customer service ratings, I did change my overall rating from two stars to three.On a positive note,  Tech Support did tell me that they are soon to be operating 7 days a week, still only open to 3:00 California time, but their long range plan is to be available 24/7.  If this happens I can raise my rating to 4 stars.  I can't overlook the fact that there were two defective components in one system.

Reviews.Title: Waiting for Glass Break Module
Reviews.Author: Joseph H. Wolff
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install... like the system and most of the features...  hoping glass sensor comes out soon.  Little concerned about the sticky tape mounting system will eventually fail causing false alarm but so far so good

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product, Simple to Install...Should have an optional Surveillence add-on
Reviews.Author: James Anderson
Reviews.Content: I am constantly away on travel and was looking for a reliable, 24/7 monitoring DIY (to cut on installation costs) home alarm system. I found it with SimpliSafe. I can't depend on wireless internet and Home phone connections for monitoring ( I was a former Installation Tech so I  know how easy it is to fail) so the fact that Simplisafe uses cell tower technology is what drew me on the most.  Everything can be setup in less than an hour, no matter how technically inclined you may or may not be. I brought the basic starter package because I live in a 1 bedroom apt, but it has everything that I need.Compared to competitors that I researched, they offered about the same amount of features but for a cheaper price. So far, no real complaints. the first 2-3 days after you install it, your system is in "test" mode so you have a little bit of time to play around with and even set it off a couple of times which doesnt alert 911. The standard Audible alarm could be louder though...If you have a large home you will def need to purchase the  louder optional audible alarm.  A day after my alarm went into "active"  mode, maintenance  came into my apartment to do work (even though I told them to call first because I wasn't home). My alarm immediately set off, I received a SMS Text warning that a sensor was triggered, and I received a call from Simplisafe Dispatch asking for my "safe word" or 911 would be dispatched. That let me know that it worked and that was great! The best thing is you can arm or disarm the alarm from a smart phone or computer, so you can be literally anywhere to control it!  I only wish that Simplisafe offered some type of video surveillance to be included with the system. I ended up separately  purchasing a cloud-based motion sensored video surveillance system called Dropcam that works great with it. Overall, great quality product, you will get "bang" for your buck.

Reviews.Title: [updated] Excellent DIY home security
Reviews.Author: Impetigo
Reviews.Content: [Updated comments at bottom]PROS:1. SIMPLE AND EASY TO USE.  It comes with a USB memory stick/keychain that you use to easily "transfer" settings from your computer (when using that method, which is what I did) to the system base (the tower with the cellular transmitter).  The 3M stickers are very sticky and will have no problem securely/sturdily holding up the keypad and sensors to your wall, door, etc.  No need to use the included screws to mount them.2. CLEAN DESIGN.  The sensors, keypads, and everything is pretty well designed and reasonably attractive (albeit bulky in some cases).3. EASY TO USE.  Press "home" to turn it on when you want the system armed while you're at home and "away" when you want to turn it on when you leave the house.  Turn "off" to turn it off (after entering your PIN).4. WORKS AS INTENDED.  Properly situating the base station is the most important thing to do, but if you can find a good location you will have no issues with the system.  If you have a bigger house, it may be more problematic.5. CAN CONFIGURE VIA COMPUTER/MOBILE DEVICE.  Each sensor has a serial code that you can use to specifically identify the sensor (e.g. "basement door" or "kitchen window") using computer or mobile device, which comes in handy when you get alerts as you can identify which sensor was set off.6. CHEAPER MONTHLY MONITORING THAN ADT.  $15/mo for the no-frills monitoring, $20/mo to also get alerts, and $25/mo to get monitoring of other sensors (water/flood, carbon monoxide, fire, etc.).  A lot cheaper than ADT.7. NO CONTRACT LIKE ADT.8. 60-DAY RETURNS.  Despite all the cons, they do let you try it out for a full two months.  And when you call to return it they don't actually try to convince you to keep it.===CONS:1. HORRIBLE CONSTANT AUDIO "WARNING" MESSAGE AND FLASHING BLUE LIGHT IF NOT USING MONTHLY MONITORING.  Yes, you will hear an annoying message from the base station frequently (when turning the alarm on or off) that reminds you that you do not have monitoring set up, and thereby reminding you to get it set up to avoid hearing this stupid message.  Yeah, the thieves will hear it to upon breaking into your home.  Gee, thanks a lot SimpliSafe!  You can't turn off the audio message or the flashing.  This is a bit of a scam since you can't really use it as a stand alone system, at least, not without seeming like a joke to anyone who ever hears that message about not having monitoring set up.  2-stars off just for this, which is essentially deceptive advertising.2. BULKY ENTRY SENSORS.  They're rather large which naturally makes it more noticeable and more of an eye sore.  Also makes it somewhat difficult to install easily, depending on your specific door/window type/location/etc.  The ADT wireless sensors are definitely smaller.3. KEYPAD HAS NO INDICATOR LED LIGHT to show if the system is on/off.  How lame, no LED light (always on or flashing) to show that the system is active or not!  You have to look at the screen, which has the backlight off by default (battery powered after all) and try to read it, which is not easy to do.  What an oversight to not include a simple flashing (maybe just every 15 seconds or so like a fire alarm) LED light.  The only other way to visually see if it's on is to look at the base station "cone" that has a blue light that is steady to indicate that it's on (but obviously, you can't look at it except in the room where it's located).4. UP FRONT COST.  Significant up front cost (I paid over 8 hundred dollars) but it will pay itself off after 1-2 years, depending on your level of service.  This assume that the system works well.5. HAVE TO PAY MONTHLY MONITORING TO GET MOBILE ALERTS, OR ANY ALERTS (e.g. fire alarm, carbon monoxide, water sensor, etc.) OTHER THAN THE BASIC SECURITY ALERT.  So, basically you have to get monthly monitoring unless you're using only the basic security system.  No water/flood monitoring if you don't get monthly monitoring.===NOT SURE IF PRO OR CON:1. WATER SENSORS HAVE NO REPLACEMENT BATTERIES.  Not sure if it's because they're supposed to be water tight, but you can't buy replacement batteries for the water sensors from SimpliSafe (as opposed to all the other sensor batteries, including AA batteries, lol).  You have to unscrew (x4 screws) the back cover to access the inside of the sensor.===FINAL THOUGHTS: I haven't set up the monitoring yet but plan to do so in the near future and will update this review after I do so.  Hope this helps!****************************[UPDATED: 12/27/13]****************************So, I have now been using the SimpliSafe2 system for about two weeks now, after almost returning the entire system.  I figured out a few things that have made this system pretty darn good.GOOD:1. You can ask SimpliSafe (via their website forum is the easiest way) to send you an update for your system that will turn off the horrible audio warning that there is no monitoring set up (if you choose not to use that monthly service).  You can also turn off the flashing blue light on the base station.2. Monitoring via PC or smartphone/tablet (requires the $25/month monitoring plan) is super easy and useful.  I use SimpliSafe with my iPad Air, my Samsung Galaxy Note 3, and my home and work computer.  The iPad app is not optimized for tablets so I just use the smartphone version which is fine.  You can also easily use the website as well (which is what I mostly do).  Using the mobile software, which is surprisingly well designed and useful, you can check the system status (alarm off or in home/away mode) and see if there were any alarms that went off.  You can also turn it off/on using the software/website.  If an alarm went off, you can check which sensor it was, which is very useful since you can label every sensor so that you know if a water sensor in your basement went off (I bought about 10 water sensors at 20 dollars each, so not cheap but very useful) or your kitchen door or living room window entry sensor.  You do need to get the higher priced monthly monitoring but for me it has been totally worth it.  You can also get info on which PIN disarmed alarms as well along with info on when the alarms went off or were disarmed.You also can get email and/or text alerts if any alarms/sensors were triggered.  Overall, these features are the best thing about SimpliSafe.  Also, it's very useful that not only are the sensors' operational status indicated on the software/website, but it will indicate if battery status is low (so you don't need to run around the house every month checking them all).  I use about 10 entry sensors and 12 water sensors so that is very useful for me.3. Monitoring works well.  I live in a 3-story house with my base station near a window on the middle level and have had no issues with sensors around the house connecting with the base station.  When testing the system (in test mode) or when you activate the alarm, I have gotten a phone call from the monitoring company (Amcest) probably in 30 seconds or less, but definitely within a minute.  No problems in my house using the T-mobile cellular transmitter, but apparently there are other modules (AT&T;, Verizon) if you don't get good T-mobile reception.4. Sensors work well.  Entry sensors work perfectly well and the water sensors also very well.  The water sensors have "right angle" prongs on the bottom, and they work best when installed vertically (so that the writing on the case is upright) rather than placing it on the floor flat.  When I tested a sensor by placing the bottom horizontal part of the prong in about a couple mm of water, it went off and the alarm went off and I got email/text alerts.  If you leave it flat, there will need to be significantly higher water levels to set it off, since the horizontal part of the right angle prongs need to get in contact with water to set it off -- and that happens easily if installed upright and not easily when lying flat on a surface (not to mention it will likely end up getting water damage in the sensor).5. Well designed, both aesthetically and functionally.  Ultra simple keypad and very clean physical design of the components (sensors, keypads, etc.).  Not only easy to use (I was even able to teach my parents how to use it in only a couple minutes lol... the multiple PINs are great for that purpose) but looks professional and not like a toy like the Fortress system.6. Fire/Carbon Monoxide alarms.  I haven't set these up yet but it's nice that you can hook these up to the system to get alarms/monitoring for when you're out of the house (for fire) or in the house (for fire or carbon monoxide).7. Website message board is pretty useful.  Their customer service phone line ends at 6pm EST and is not open every day, but the website forum is pretty useful as they have at least one staff member who seems to monitor it frequently so that most questions are answered within a day usually by other users or staff.BAD (STILL): The only real negative I have to say about this system so far is that you cannot set up an alarm delay of less than 30 seconds when on "away" mode.  This is the mode you set up when you leave the house, and so having 30 seconds for the would-be burglar to look around the house is too long, since during that time the system is just beeping and no alerts are being sent to the monitoring center.  If they find and destroy the base station (easy for a burglar who knows how to use google to find out how large and obvious looking the base station is) then that's the end of your alarm system.  The odd thing is that you can set the delay to 1 second or even "instant on" (activates alarm immediately after triggere) when on "home" mode, but for me I would want the shorter delay for away mode since that is when there is no one at home to do anything (like call police or grab a weapon, etc.).  Hopefully they will "fix" that (obviously, these alarm delays are intended to cut down on unintentional alarm activations and police/fire station notifications which add up cost to the monitoring/alarm company and the users).  I would be happy with a 15 second delay at least.CONCLUSIONS: Having now tried out the SimpliSafe2 system for the past few weeks I have to say that it is a great system and the best DIY that I have seen.  I love it and can't wait for more features (especially more home monitoring features like thermostat control, etc.) to come out eventually.  So far so good!Original rating: 3/5 starsUpdated rating: 4/5 stars (would increase to 5 stars if the "away" mode alarm delay could be set to less than 30 seconds)****************************[UPDATE #2]****************************Apparently, the 30 second "away" mode alarm delay is due to an alarm regulation or standard, and you can set all entry sensors besides one to "instant on" even in "away" mode.  That actually makes sense since you have to enter the home to turn off the alarm so you wouldn't want the alarm going off every time you enter your house.  I've consequently updated my rating to 5/5 stars as this is a very nice DIY alarm system.  I ended up spending about $850 for my system (with many additional entry/water sensors and a couple extra keypads) but it's totally worth it given the functionality and quality.  Hope it holds up over time!

Reviews.Title: So simple to install, great customer support
Reviews.Author: Artur B. Adib
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the whole thing, from opening the package and seeing how easy it is to install the sensors to the quick availability of customer support - no B.S.The ability to add all kinds of sensors as needed (freeze, smoke, CO, etc) for much less than the competition is also a big plus. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Best deal for the money
Reviews.Author: Sebbytron
Reviews.Content: Works as it is supposed to. Was very easy to setup. Haven't had any issues with false alarms And I have two bulldogs.

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe2 seems to be what is advertised
Reviews.Author: jad608
Reviews.Content: I have had Simplisafe working for around 3 months. It is easy to install, Easy to use and seems to be problem free.I fortunately haven't had any opportunities  for the system to signal the response center. I have the minimal coverage for $14.99 per month.I also installed the system myself, with a few additional window sensors. I also purchased 1 additional motion sensor.I may add 2 more motion sensors in the future, 1 for the Lower level(just have window sensors now) and 1 for the rear porch/5 seasons room area.I have had no sensor problems. The install was easy. It took me some time to figure out what was and was not included in minimal coverage, as opposed to the 24.99 package but I am happy with everything so far.

Reviews.Title: I'm Simply Safer
Reviews.Author: DealStalker
Reviews.Content: After hearing Simply Safe advertized on radio I looked online at the reviews and thought I would give it a try.  Because I am blind I had a friend install it for me, but to tell you the truth, I could have done it myself.  My friend looked for a long time not believing it could be so simple.  I got the monitoring package and only 3 days after coming on line with the local police station, my house was broken into.  But because the alarm was screaming away the theif took only one thing and ran.  Given the time, it could have been really bad but the alarm prevented this from happening.  I am thrilled with the system...so simple and effective...and the key chain remote is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: M. Johnson "M.Johnson"
Reviews.Content: After lots of research on home securities systems over the last year or so, I was glad to hear about Simplisafe on the Rush Limbaugh radio show. I went online and checked it out, reading reviews and studying the offered packages and of course the cost to monitor month to month as well.  I was quite impressed with what Simplisafe had to offer for the money spent.  I had at one point almost went with ADT, but after really looking into what it would cost me for both the equipment needed and the cost (at that time, would have to had signed a three year contract), it didn't take me long to decide that's not what I wanted.  I got a great package deal from Simplisafe and had everything I needed and more.What I like about their product is the option of adding sensors, detectors etc, later if needed, and of course the very budget friendly monitoring service offered.  When I went to set mine up, I called customer service to ask about a detached garage I have, and rather a sensor would work.  They told me as long as it's within 150 feet of the sensor it would work, and although from my garage door to the base station isn't nearly that far, it works like a champ. I often worried about someone entering my garage while I was away or slept, but with the 105 decibel alarm out there, I'm quite sure it will deter anyone who ventures in there.My main reason for wanting an alarm system is that I have a hearing problem, and wanted something to wake me in the event of a break in or attempt of breaking in.  This system foots that bill very well and I'm quite sure that if that unfortunate event ever occurs, I'll be more than ready to do what is needed.  It's only been a little more than two weeks, but so far I am one very happy customer.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe Wirless Alarm
Reviews.Author: kd
Reviews.Content: I bought simplisafe alarm system after reading all the reviews and i'm not sorry i did.easy to setup and install. customer service is one of the best you can find. everything is going good so far including the monitoring co.i feel much better knowing that my daughters house is protected. thank you SimpliSafe. and the $14.99 a month for monitoring is a steal.

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe2 Wireless Home Security.
Reviews.Author: T. Marksbury
Reviews.Content: This was much easier that I expected.  We opted to use the screws for installation in addition to the 3m command strips provided.  The step by step instructions provided in the installation instructions (printed and online) couldn't have been clearer.I would not hesitate to add maybe a co2 or water alarm to the system at a later date.I can not really review the monitoring as of yet.  It has only been "live" for a day.

Reviews.Title: Everything as advertised
Reviews.Author: Janie Ostlund
Reviews.Content: These security products were everything I expected at a lot less money than the "big" guys. Installation of 7 devices took less than 1/2 hour and thanks to the installation video was very easy. I anticipate taking this equipment with me when we move after retirement and because of the release tape that should be a breeze. Wish I had spent the money before the break-in we suffered. Would have saved me hundreds of dollars and a lot of grief.

Reviews.Title: LIKED IT
Reviews.Author: Jeri
Reviews.Content: I like it because it was easy to install.  I would recommend it .  It is a much better value than any other security system on the market that I know of.

Reviews.Title: Safety unlimited!
Reviews.Author: Ted McGill "Ted"
Reviews.Content: Renting a house has its limitations.  Ours had no security system until last week.  The Simpli Safe system arrived, and 30 minutes later my system was up and running.It's simple, and now we're safe.  What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe
Reviews.Author: Michael Schneider
Reviews.Content: Thus far the alarm system is as advertised.  I had no trouble whatsoever setting the system up.  All components are working as they should and have been tested.  Not sure how far the keychain remote will actually work but it certainly works anywhere in the driveway.  I was worried about the wife getting use to it but it hasn't been a problem.  I really like the home feature and I feel as if I can sleep better not having to worry about every little noise around the house.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to install and friendly company
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to setup and install. Additionally they checked in on me every day or so via email for status. Well worth the money spent so far.

Reviews.Title: Simple, Safe, and Easy to Install
Reviews.Author: JBSNM "JBSNM"
Reviews.Content: PROS:fast and easy installproduct seems to workmany options to make installation simplecompatable with smart phonescheap monthy feeeasy to customize to get the parts you want for your homeCONS:Too few items come with the basic packages - should come with 2 remotes and 2 window/door sensorsYou have to wait for three days to know if the alarm company has a good signal. In other words, I only knew that the AC had a good connection once I got an email after the 3-day 'practice' period. It would be good to know immediately after installation if the system base was in a spot that receives adequate reception since the system is wireless.All in all, a great product (so far) and the ability to install without having to mess with meeting someone to do the install is a huge benenfit. The peace of mind that comes with knowing your house is a "harder target" is priceless. Our home was burglarized weeks ago and the violated feeling is tough to endure.

Reviews.Title: Faulty Equipment, Poor CS...Tons of false alarms
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: This is a very poor alarm service.  I have had the service since July and have had 3 false alarms in my time with it.  The first was caused by my puppy, who was less than 8lbs at the time, who set off the motion sensors (Simplisafe claims that dogs under 25lbs will not set off the alarm.  I was never called for this (checked phone records) and neither was my secondary contact.  They called the police though, and I was fined for a false alarm fee.Second time, I accidentally set off the alarm, managed to turn it off quickly, but never received a call, though when I called Simplisafe about it, the claimed that yes, they called and yes, the cops were on their way.  Managed to nip that in the bud, whew.Third time, I had all of my motion sensors disabled since the incident with my dog.  I also do not arm the alarm unless I feel threatened.  The alarm went off when, apparently, I was in the house.  I did not hear a siren.  I did not get a call (again I checked my phone records with my provider).  They dispatched police, though I never saw them (despite being HOME?!?).  I called CS again, explained that the alarm system was completely off, even when I left the house for the day, and the time period given on the website gives a time when I was home.  I was promptly told that I was mistaken, that the motion sensors would never go off unless if they were turned on and that I was "technically inept".  I was also told that clearly, I must not be able to read a phone account correctly because they called and I did not answer.  I asked for the CS reps name, got none.  I canceled my service.

Reviews.Title: Extremely unreliable
Reviews.Author: scorch
Reviews.Content: I bought a simplisafe system for my home because I accepted a one year contract to work in China, and I wanted my house monitored without having to sign a three year contract with any other company.  Twice, so far, I have received emails from simplisafe telling me that my equipment isn't working and that certain steps must be taken, such as checking the batteries, etc.  Fortunately, my son was able to go to my home the first time to rectify the problem.  However, now, only a few months later, I have received another notice that my system isn't working, and again, they recommend certain pedestrian steps to fix the problem, such as checking the batteries or rebooting the system.
