Do they expect me to fly to the United States from China every few months to keep maintaining a system that has been advertised having batteries that last three years, etc.?  It is impossible for me to feel that my home is securely protected.  By having a simplisafe system, I have just added one more worry, one more concern, one more burden to my already busy life.  I certainly do not trust this company at all, and this is due to the fact that the failure of their substandard equipment (which I have to pay a monthly fee for) is offering no sercurity at all. For anyone who contemplatesa long absence from their home and does not want to do repetitive maintenance on their security system, I would advise you notto consider simplisafe.

Reviews.Title: Is anyone out there?
Reviews.Author: Hiktikniteflite
Reviews.Content: We purchased our Simplisafe system in 2013...easy to install and inexpensive.  However, I just tested our system again today and never got a call from the monitoring service (Amscor).  I then armed the system for real and set it off.  15 minutes went by and still no call.  So, I called Simplisafe ... 17 minutes on hold, no answer.  Then I called Amscor ... I asked them why no one called on the test.  Response: "We prioritize test alarms lower than actual alarms".  Ok, on the surface that sounds reasonable, however, on a Saturday morning they have a rash of real alarms they are not staffed to handle?  I then asked them why they never called about my actual alarm.  Response: "Well, you input your code within 15 seconds ... so we assumed it was a test"  "If you had waited to input your code another 30, or 60 seconds we would have dispatched".You be the judge, but I'm reminded of the old adage, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup, Everything As Advertised
Reviews.Author: Adam J. Facciponti
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after hearing it recommended by Dave Ramsey and having some problems in my neighborhood with break-ins and thefts.  I am completely happy with it.  Installation is no problem, the price is well worth it if you ask me, and it eliminates a lot of worry.  I'd recommend anyone set the base station to be silent if the alarm is tripped.  If someone does break in, you want the keypad to draw their attention, not the base station.

Reviews.Title: System has one major flaw - leaving an entry point open (door/window) doesn't trigger any alerts via SMS, E-mail, or their APP.
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I like this system a lot.  However, today I learned that if you arm the system in HOME or AWAY mode, but have a door or window open, the system warns you via the base station (hidden away per their recommendation) and the keypad.  I OFTEN arm via the keyfob when I'm in the driveway or via their app or website.  No alert comes that says "You left ____ open".  Given that I get alerts for arming, disarming, low battery, etc. - this is absolutely unacceptable since they provide remote arming options.PLEASE MAKE THIS AN ALERT THAT IS SENT!  Until you do, I can no longer recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and use
Reviews.Author: W. Bell
Reviews.Content: We have had the system installed for about 2 weeks and so far love it.The system is easy to install.  I used the screws to attach the sensors into rough drywall.  Outside sirens I used plastic inserts into stucco walls.  The three day practice period allowed us to try the system out without having to answer the phone to say that we were okay.  I mounted one door sensor outside in a metal shed and the signal works fine.  I tried to put a motion sensor in our RV in the backyard (About 70 feet from the base) and it would not work probably too much metal and distance.  The smart phone app works okay as well as accessing via a remote PC.We sent the monitoring certificate to our homeowners insurance and received a $60 discount for the year.I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe - The Name Says It All
Reviews.Author: Scott Simerson
Reviews.Content: I purchased the basic system to replace my ADT wired system.  The ADT system has worked fine for the last four years, but it monitored only two doors and two rooms, and the monthly monitoring fee recently went up to $34.  I like that the SimpliSafe system is expandable, has a reasonable monitoring fee of $14, and lets me know audibly when a window/door opens and when the system is armed/disarmed.  An alarm system is not something most people get excited about, but this one definitely has me smiling!

Reviews.Title: I'm telling all my friends about this alarm system.
Reviews.Author: David Lin
Reviews.Content: I used to install alarm systems, Simplisafe is the highest value alarm system on the market without all the games.  The website allows you to buy what you need and then you pay for the monitoring (if you want it).  No contracts, no games.  Also, when the equipment arrived it was a nice touch that the sensor and various devices were already paired with the base station.  This made the set up a lot quicker.  The operation is very simple and my wife loves it.  I also got an $87/yr homeowners insurance credit for having a monitored security and fire alarm system.  Simplisafe provides the certificate that you just send to your insurance company.  Also, since you own the equipment the monitoring fees are quite reasonable since they are not trying recover the cost of equipment.  On a technical note, the range of the wireless sensors to the base station is very good and so far the system has been rock stable - no false alarms.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install, well-priced.  Rude, unfriendly, unhelpful call center employees.
Reviews.Author: Darren Mayes
Reviews.Content: The system seems to work as advertised. I echo most of the reviews available online. Sales department is extremely friendly and helpful, but that is where it ends.  Keisha and some other call center employees are miserable to deal with. I'd rather speak with call centers from Mumbai or Hyderabad.  Most recently, our cleaning lady tripped the panic button, which I quickly disabled with our code.  A few minutes later, Simplisafe called asking for my safe word. After repeating it several times, the call center asked if I lived at a completely incorrect address.  Turns out, they called the wrong house, and were rude as always. It really seems I am inconveniencing them when I call.  Simplisafe, for a company that is so highly regarded and sponsored by many personalities I respect, needs to address these repeated negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: Works great! Easy setup!
Reviews.Author: Mark Orecchio
Reviews.Content: I bought this for vacant rental properties.  Three days after I installed it the alarm went off and within 5 minutes four police were at my vacant home. The neighbors saw three people run out of the house.  This system probably saved my copper plumbing from getting stolen which would have cost more than the system and a years monitoring.  I love how it's very customizable. A must for any landlord that has a vacant home!!

Reviews.Title: Tired of the warnings for not having the monitoring contract.
Reviews.Author: Dave Bernardini
Reviews.Content: I ordered your hardware to self monitor my home, however I constantly have flashing blue lights on the basestation and recorded messages that I dont have a monitoring contract. How do I get rid of that?  Additionally I know you get what you pay for and the hardware is very inexpensive compared to other hardware on the market......put its also very cheap, the buttons on the keypad stick if not pushed directly at a 90 degree angle to the button and I have a motion detector that seems to always work in test mode but often doesn't identify motion when in the "away" mode. It was very easy to set up but is cheaper that I would like. I would have been willing to pay a bit more for better components......a motion detector with a small LED that blinks as you walk by so you know it is functioning would be a nice upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: Paul D Harjung
Reviews.Content: Simplisafe has an excellent system. It is well made, easy to use and easy to install. I would have given them 5 stars, except I see a few things that could be improved. I still recommend this system to anyone. I replaced an older wired system I had for 10 years.1. The motion sensors are designed to be mounted in a corner, yet come with tape in the center of the back. The tape is in the wrong place. More tape in the right spots would help.2. The motion sensors need lights that show when motion is detected. I've used motion sensors for years and they all do this. It' a better way to test and determine if you or your pet will set it off.3. The key chain fob is an interesting idea but could be improved. Why not add a "home" button and then it can be used as a remote from your bedroom at night. And it should probably have some additional security mechanism, like a fingerprint sensor or a way to enter your code. If you lose your keys, anyone can disable your alarm by pressing a button.4. The system is easy to install but it should allow you to name your sensors so they are easier to keep track off. Like "front door". Otherwise you have to keep referring back to a list of your serial numbers and where the sensors are. This is a simple improvement that would help.5. It should come with 2 or 3 yard signs that are waterproof. My old system had metal signs and plastic posts. The one large cardboard sign with tape on the back won't last outside. Would also be good advertising for Simplisafe!Overall, this is a good system. Fairly priced and well documented. Anyone can install this.

Reviews.Title: I'm happy so far - install done - monitoring yet to come
Reviews.Author: Thorbuck
Reviews.Content: The installation instructions were very good in comparison with what one usually receives with new products, with one outstanding exception.  On the cover one is advised to plug the Keychain Remote into a computer to follow easy, animated Easy Setup Wizard instructions.  The instructions will not load - I tired on both a PC and a Mac.  So, I used the printed instructions (very good).  I didn't find out until deep into the printed instructions (page 20) that one has to plug the Keychain Remote into the base station first, and then into a computer to be able to access the Easy Setup Wizard.  I would have given the install event a 5 star if not for the confusion over how to access the Setup Wizard.

Reviews.Title: Great system and support group.
Reviews.Author: steve mirous
Reviews.Content: I am not a tecki.  After reading all the material and reviewing the components I had a few questions.  I called the support group for some information and got hold of Greeny.  She walked me thru and between us got the system hooked up.  Believe me this was no easy task on her part but she was very patient,  new the system and the internet completely .  She did a great job.  We already caught a perp with the system, my wife.  She put in the wrong number and the response was swift from their monitoring station.  Since the initial installation I added a couple more sensors and called tech support to make sure they were up and running and done correctly.  Again I received the same professional tech and service.  Having started and run business's in my life, I do recognize and asset when I encounter one.  We are pleased.  S.M.  cleveland, Ohio

Reviews.Title: Great value - Great Service
Reviews.Author: M.A.Moore
Reviews.Content: After checking with four or five other systems - all requiring a minimum contract of three years - also necessitating an install appointment I found SimpliSafe.The system was easy to install (about thirty minutes) with the manual as well as the thumb drive step by step, it has worked perfectly and I feel quite confident that the monitoring is accurate and that my home is secure. I also like the ability to review my history on line in real time.Terrific value without hassles!!!

Reviews.Title: Simple to install
Reviews.Author: Ki Wiz
Reviews.Content: I just moved into an apartment with just my daughter and I. I felt that I needed a security system, because I get a bit paranoid. I was looking for something that I could install myself and wouldn't come with a contract. SimpliSafe was exactly what I was looking for. It arrived in a timely manner. It was very easy to install. Although I couldn't get the cellular reception to work in my apartment, I was able to hook it up to a landline and still retain the security services that I need. I even worked with a friendly customer service rep to see if we could move the base station around to get reception, but in the end he kindly downgraded my service plan from the Interactive to the Alert. The system works great. I just order another door/window censor to expand my system. I got exactly what I wanted and it was affordable. I also look forward to moving out and being able to take my system with me.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe is the Perfect Security System
Reviews.Author: bab1016
Reviews.Content: For anyone who doesnt want to be tied to a long term high cost security contract, this is the solution is for you.  I had the system insalled and tested within 20 minutes of opening the box.Most companies offer a free alarm but you'l be paying close to $30.00 to $40.00 per month for a 3 to 5 year term.  With SimpliSafe you pay a for what you need as far as hardware and only 14.99 for cellular 24x7 coverage.Thanks SimpliSafe!

Reviews.Title: Piece of mind is priceless
Reviews.Author: C. Brillhart
Reviews.Content: It was a horrible experience to be robbed. I had never had an alarm system before and I knew now that I needed one if I was going to feel safe again. My insurance adjustor from Pacific Specialty was actually the one that brought up this product to me. He couldn't remember the name of it, but said he heard it on the Glenn Beck radio show. Within the next couple of days and after much research, I ordered Simplisafe. I couldn't be happier and it's such a relief to know that my house is being looked after while I'm not home. It's like having a person housesitting for me. You just can't put a price on feeling safe. I've already recommended Simplisafe to several of my friends and I hope they choose it over other systems.

Reviews.Title: Simple and safe, Excellent deal
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: For the price,  installation ease and monthly costs, well worth the money. Add the smoke alarm the next day and forwarded the certificate I download to my insurance company for a nice 15% discount.

Reviews.Title: Pleased and satisfied!!!
Reviews.Author: Donald S.
Reviews.Content: We found the alarm system to be everything your advertisements claim it to be.  Your directions for installation are clear and the installation is simple.  We are pleasantly satisfied and have already recommended it to a number of family members and friends.  Happy and ... safer ...in Tampa... Don and Jean

Reviews.Title: Great Security System
Reviews.Author: Robert Ellis
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Simplisafe system for my mother's home after she started having problems in the area.  She couldn't afford the outrageous monthly charges that most security companies charge so I decided to give this one a try.  The system arrived in 3 days and was extremely easy to install.  It's also easy to operate. My 86 yr. old mother has only accidentally set it off once in 3 months.  That allowed us to see how efficient the monitoring company was.  We were impressed (I can't believe they're only $15 a month).In fact I was so impressed I ordered a system for my home.  I was a little concerned that the cell connection would be a problem for me because the T-Mobile (system used by Simplisafe) coverage map showed my house in the "satisfactory" area.  It wasn't a problem, I have a great connection and I couldn't be happier.  If you need a security system you really should try this one.

Reviews.Title: The Best!!
Reviews.Author: Peter "pjopie"
Reviews.Content: I have had Simplisafe for 3 years now in my FL home and absolutely love this system and the company that stands by its product. I installed the system myself, and im the type of guy that can't hammer a nail!!! Any problems I have ever had I called and received the best of customer support, just recently a lightning strike in my back yard caused the base station to stop working, I was notified by customer service that they were not receiving the signal from the base station. After arriving at the FL home I contacted customer support and had a new base station in 3 days shipped to me!! Can't get any better than this, if you have an alarm company they would have charged you for the service call to come out and replace whatever was wrong. Everything is soo easy, from replacing the batteries to adding additional detectors. ALL the other companies get way too much $$ to monitor your system so don't be fooled by there $99 systems, there 2-3 year contracts you have to sign and the service call fees they charge when you have a problem. Try this, you will love it and they make great gifts for relatives!!

Reviews.Title: pleased but could be improved.
Reviews.Author: Tonya H. Ingram
Reviews.Content: The installation was very easy! Here are some concerns:1. I wish the costumer service was 24/7 for when I have issues or questions.2. And we had problems with our 15 pound dog setting off the motion detector, so we didn't end up using the detector.  Installing it upside down was recommended to fix this problem, but it didn't work as the detector faced a set of stairs and she would still set if off coming up/down the stairs.3.  I wish the volume on the keypad was louder; when I am in the other room, I don't always hear the beeping to remind me to turn it off if I have opened a door. (I have it at its highest volume)Otherwise we have been happy so far. We have had it for 1 week, so we are still in the 60-day return window if not satisfied.

Reviews.Title: I only suggest a little more info in the manual
Reviews.Author: Steve Beisner
Reviews.Content: Installation was easy to do and to understand.I highly recommend this system.Had to wait two days after my (Saturday) installationto contact service (Mon-Fri only) about why I wascontinuously getting "No Link to Dispatcher".  On MondayService immediately knew what the problem was andhad me reset the base station.The improvement I'd suggest is that this and othertrouble shooting information be added as a separatesection in the manual. (The current small tablecalled "Troubleshooring" in the manual is prettyuseless: the section on my particular problemmentions nothing about resetting the base station.)

Reviews.Title: Great security coverage for a reasonable price!
Reviews.Author: S. Cole
Reviews.Content: I'm LOVING My SimpliSafe home alarm system! VERY EASY to install! I initially went for the middle "alert" monitoring package of $19.99/month but decided in the long run it was well worth the interactive monitoring package for the $24.99/month! I like the fact that if a friend or family member needs to enter the house and is nervous about turning off the system I can do it remotely for them from my phone. It's well worth the peace of mind knowing I've got smoke detectors, carbon monoxide detectors linked to the fire department in addition to motion sensors, & entry sensors all linked and monitored in case something happens when I'm home or away!I'm testing out the motion sensors on the "AWAY" setting with the cats home for the first time today. So far no false alarms!I'm anxious to see how the video camera in development work! My issue with other companies is I don't have a home internet network. I use the internet off my cell phone as the hot spot when I need it. So I can't use cameras that are out right now. But if they can work off the cell towers like the rest of the system I'll buy them in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: So Far, So Good!
Reviews.Author: delru
Reviews.Content: Have only been utilizing the system for 3 days (the practice period).  Never having an alarm system before, we were quite nervous about setting off alarms, if our placements would be proper, et al, therefore the "practice period" of 3 days has helped us settle in and eliminate our fears/concerns.The items are of good quality. We liked the heads-up during order placement, that we may need police/fire permits.  Our city in SoCal costs $35 for the police, then $20 for renewal thereafter.  Also found out that many insurance companies require the MONITORING COMPANY to be UL Listed to get a discount.  SimpliSafe's monitoring company is UL Listed, and we were impressed with the UL requirements to get this type of certification.We liked the chart in the back of the booklet that let's us keep track of where we've installed the sensors, as the sensors all have serial numbers.  When the keypad, or the alarm company advises of a situation with a sensor, it will alert by serial number.  By identifying, for example, Sensor #XYZ is the "right living room window", the location is easily identifiable.  We will print this info on a small card to carry in our wallets to have at all times for reference.  On the larger provided chart we keep at home, we have added "battery-type" for each item, so when the batteries need replacement, we will know what is needed.The only negative, so far, is the need for clearer correlation between action and result on the keypad.  For example, when changing the pin, you do the procedure, but it would be nice if the keypad would say something like "new pin successful".  Just so you KNOW it's been accepted. There are several other steps that we would like to see a confirmation that the action worked, and you didn't make a mistake.We like the sticky tapes to adhere some items - for a temporary solution, while you're trying to determine if a certain location will work.  But we highly recommend securing the keypad, siren, and motion sensors with screws.  The screws provided are too short for drywall, so be prepared to use your own.The deciding factor was NO LONG-TERM monitoring contracts.  Our daughter is locked into a 3-year contract, but in today's economy where you could lose your job tomorrow, we didn't want to commit to a long financial situation.  We also like the fact that we can add many more items, as situations change, and we can change the type of monitoring - at any time - with just a phone call.  So far, so good!

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe2
Reviews.Author: Gysmo
Reviews.Content: I received my simplisafe2 kit.  It took me about 3 hours to install.  It could be installed faster but I prefer to take my time when I am doing things.  After installing, I put it in test mode.  It could not make cellular contact.  I tried calling the office, but to my surprise it is closed on weekends and evenings.  I kind of thought it would be open 24/7.  I emailed about the problem.  I got a call 2 days later.  The tech had me take the tower apart and try a few things.  It wouldn't work.  He will send out a new tower.  I am a little disappointed about it.  Once the new tower comes and if everything is okay, I think it will do the job.  One thing about the motion sensor.  It says it detects up to 30 feet.  I think it's only like 20 feet.  Overall, I think it will do what I want.  Rate 7 out of 10

Reviews.Title: Saved our house!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Shea Tracy
Reviews.Content: We have had a far more expensive security system that was always having problems. The monthly fees continued to climb. We went with Simplisafe and it is THE best value and is very easy to install by yourself. During the Nemo snowstorm, our house at the Cape suffered severe winds and power outage. I checked my iPhone only to find Simplisafe telling me that the house temp was 46! We live several hours away, so we called the police and fire department who responded and went into our basement to turn off the main water valve, saving our house from frozen pipes!Had it not been for our Simplisafe system, we would have had enormous damage.My husband and I HIGHLY recommend this system. It is not only very effective, the customer service cannot be beat!Highly recommend Simplisafe!

Reviews.Title: Amazing system
Reviews.Author: Azminx
Reviews.Content: We're out of town a lot and this system has met all our requirements and more.Everyone who see how we'll it works for us, we'll they've gone out and ordered one for themselves too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!!!
Reviews.Author: I. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: Installed my system about six months ago.  Very easy to install and setup.  It's a completely wireless system via cellular, with no additional phone charges.  Also, you can't beat the low monthly 24 hour monitoring costs, with no contract.  Competitors want a 3 yr. contract.  Also, you can add to the system at any time.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: XpressTeks
Reviews.Content: After getting quotes from 2 of the "Big Name" security companies and finding out that their system was wireless, I decided to do some research and came across SimpiSafe.  I purchased the system directly from them and had it the day after I placed the order.  Within 45 minutes I had the whole system installed and working (in test mode)I purchased the main unit (2nd version) 1 Water Sensor, 2 Motion Sensors and 3 Entry Sensors.  I have it setup with the iPhone app and txt messaging for alerts.  For the cost, ease of use and ability to easily add onto the system at any time I give them 5 Stars!  Best part is that I don't have a home phone line, and with this system you don't need one, its all cellular based.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money and peace of mind
Reviews.Author: Cnicole
Reviews.Content: We have had the alarm for over a year, and it works really well. We've had a few calls from the security team, thanks to a house full of animals and kids that every once in a while open a door while the alarm is set. They always call promptly. Great customer service as well, They helped us deal with pets and motion sensors. With my husband gone frequently, I really appreciate the panic button behind the bed. We would recommend simplisafe for sure. Also, the key is nice to give to friends to use getting in while we are out of town.

Reviews.Title: Great Apartment Security
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: I live in a small apartment, and this system has been a great peace of mind. I've never had a problem with it. I recently moved, and upgraded to the Simplisafe 2 system. I couldn't be happier. Being able to arm my alarm and get alerts all from my phone is amazing. It fits right into the automated ecosystem of my home. It's up there with my Nest thermostat.

Reviews.Title: Great system and GREAT price!
Reviews.Author: BILL WELTY
Reviews.Content: Wow! I'll admit, I was a bit skeptical about going with SimpliSafe because the super-low price of monitoring I felt was too good to be true. I've had our system up and running since the end of May 2013 and thankfully no problems (as of today 6/20/13). I accidentally neglected to disarm the system before going downstairs this morning and my motion sensor* nailed me and tripped the alarm. I was right next to my downstairs keypad when it went off and was able to punch in my code within seconds of the alarm. I didn't think I'd get a call, but another second or two later my cell rang. It was SimpliSafe calling to see if all was well. Thanks, and if that's the "Johnny on the spot" service I can expect every time, then I'll be with SimpliSafe for a long time and will spread the word as often as I get the chance.*I'm in a bi-level home and have my motion sensors set for away mode and supplement my door and window sensors with motion sensors on my lower level in the two wide open rooms on ground level.  Our kitchen, living, and bed rooms are on the upper level and all the windows are well off the ground so I just did a door sensor on my front door.  That's why my motion sensors were active while I was home; typically you would use the Home mode when at home and the Away mode when you go out.  We use the Away mode for both overnight and when we go out for the added benefit of having the motion sensors providing backup cover for the 2 big rooms downstairs.

Reviews.Title: Great Product - Not enough personel to answer questions
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Everything out of the box worked well.  Set-up was easy with 16 sensors that took about an hour.  Great Value!  I had to call twice.  Once to check on activation which did not activate on the day it was suppose too and a permitting question.  On both occasions I was on hold for 15 and 25 min.  Two items that were to be automatic were not executed -- Activation was to occur 3 days after a practice period (had to call on the 5th day because system was not active (live)).  And the automatic permit information was to be sent upon activation to the local police department.  3 weeks later this still has not been done which may expose me to a fine or non-response should an alarm be activated.

Reviews.Title: Equipment is a bad joke and so is the service and they are liars.
Reviews.Author: B. O'Brien
Reviews.Content: I have batteries dying at the 4 month mark. Sticky backs failing to hold.Onto the real complaints though,On the website it wont allow you to downgrade service without calling in. They wont allow you to delete your credit card information from the web site without calling in, even then they lied about it.In the last week I have had the alarm trigger 3 different times due to a failing sensor. One time it took me 2 minutes to get to the keypad. I never heard from them.Another time they called me after I ran a test on the system. They called me 3 hours later to inform me it had "just" happened.Save your money.Also I was looking over a lot of the positive reviews..... Isnt it strange that a lot of them only have one review listed and it is for this product?

Reviews.Title: No Customer Service After 6 P.M.!!
Reviews.Author: kapflorida
Reviews.Content: October 10, 2013 Update: My original review is below for which I gave it 3 stars. If I could downgrade to NO stars I would!! We spent over $500.00 on the equipment (we ordered extra sensors, an extra key chain remote, a siren, extra yard signs, extra window decals, etc.) and... we are paying for a monthly Monitoring System. We have had it installed for about a month...seemed to work okay. Now all we have is a darn blinking blue light with a warning of "No Link to Dispatcher"! Just quit TXing for no reason...or maybe it is and they're apparently not Rxing. For hours I have tried to correct this device not working properly by process of elimination to no avail! As my title states...THERE IS NO CUSTOMER SERVICE AFTER 6 P.M.!! So here we sit with an expensive, useless "security" (yeah, right) system until tomorrow when I can reach (I hope)customer service to request a RMA! So...buyers beware...as I stated previously...you do get what you pay for!!"Long, long, long wait for customer service to answer and then their service isn't that great! Also, the equipment isn't as informative as my other system. It told me which door/window was open...."back door open...master bedroom door open" or "doors and windows closed" etc. Even though I paid a higher monthly fee and signed a contract with the other company, the service and equipment was spot on! If, this home wasn't on the "For Sale" list I would have gone with the other company. I guess you do get what you pay for!"

Reviews.Title: Ripoff
Reviews.Author: Major
Reviews.Content: Set up was easy except for a place to get cell reception.  The cell it uses gets much worse reception than my regular cell phone.  For about a month it connected to the simplisafe service most times.  After that - it never connected again no matter where I put it.  It is now an expensive piece of garbage!

Reviews.Title: First time security
Reviews.Author: DTom
Reviews.Content: My son in law recommended Simplysafe to me after installing it in his home. I forgot to get the offered discounts. No matter. I love the ease of installation and use. Even my wife has no problems with the system.

Reviews.Title: Works as expected and a great value
Reviews.Author: Aaron T
Reviews.Content: Pros:It's very reasonably priced compared to other options, and you can mix and match sensors.  I've already added a few myself, and you don't have to pay any extra fees, other than the price of the sensor.  That's great!It's also fairly simple to setup and to manage, and it's all done at your own convenience.It works!  I've been using it for a few weeks now and nothing unexpected yet.Cons:A small downside, and I don't know if this is available anywhere else either, is that I would've liked to be able to create my own modes.  It has home, and away.  But maybe I'd also like a vacation mode, or work mode (I work at home), where I can create more customized sensor setups for that situation.  I've heard they are constantly working on new features though, so I'm hoping I'll see more of that type of thing in the future.I'd also like to see some type of video offering. If I wanted to put a camera up it would be great to have the option as part of the security package.I've had it for a few weeks now, and although the dog did keep triggering the motion sensor despite being just around 30 lbs, everything else is as expected.  I'm not sure it's the sensor's fault though, he's not allowed on the couch but I can see it happening while I'm out.  That would bring him much closer to the sensor and the manual clearly states that it needs some distance even for smaller animals.Conclusion:The downsides I've experienced are negligible. Having owned a SimpliSafe for a few weeks/months now, I'm glad I didn't waste money and time trying one of the larger competitors first.  I'm not disappointed in any way and I'm saving quite a bit of money.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased!
Reviews.Author: Kitty H.
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this product! Easy to install. Great support if you need it. Love having my home secure! Just wish I had gotten the siren and I might add that later.

Reviews.Title: just like they say
Reviews.Author: Richard Miller
Reviews.Content: It was super easy to setup ,I started with a minimal system to check it out ,will fully up grade I am so happy with it ....the concept of affordable monitoring with out a multi-year commitment is awesome fire your alarm company and get simpisafe as quickly as you can !!!

Reviews.Title: Simplisensible
Reviews.Author: Rick Reiss
Reviews.Content: I received my system and within two hours had everything up and operating. The instructions are easy to follow and every stepis clearly defined. If the monitoring agreement is as functional as the alarm system, this is a real winner! I have been waiting for something like Simplisafe to come along to compete with the major alarm companies.

Reviews.Title: Why choose another alarm company?
Reviews.Author: Gary Earp
Reviews.Content: I had heard about Simpli-Safe on the radio and it sounded really good. I went on line to check it out and really liked what they had. They even had glass break detectors which is a bonus for me since I have a LOT of windows to cover. I ordered it and it arrived when they said it would.  It took about an hour to install it all together over a couple of days. It was super easy. It was even easy to add sensors which I had to add two. Couldn't be easier!  Very pleased with it so far. My wife loves it because it's much easier to arm/disarm than my previous system. No contract and inexpensive monitoring, what else could you want.

Reviews.Title: So easy and inexpensive!
Reviews.Author: Kar
Reviews.Content: Usually, I'm a huge fan of the saying, "you get what you pay for" so I was skeptical of an economical alarm system.  Wow, is this an exception!  A true "plug and play" system, you literally just stick up the components and turn it on.HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!The only little negative (that I expect is unavoidable for a self-installed system of any type) is that the instruction booklet is a tiny bit frustrating despite how nicely it is laid out and illustrated, but if you have questions you can call and speak to a friendly, knowledgable, caring customer support agent who enunciates and listens well to get over any little hurdles.  As an example of the booklet's shortcoming, the very front page says to put your key fob USB into your computer for a quick start and avoid the booklet altogether.  On the LAST PAGE of the booklet it says you need to insert the fob into the base unit to sync it with your system before putting it in the computer.  Yeah, it doesn't work if you don't so we didn't get the joy of using the quick start and were pretty frustrated to learn why on the very last page of the booklet.  But, again, that's nitpicking - please do not let this deter you!!!Also, consider your cell tower availability for T-Mobile or Verizon.  We live in a rural area where coverage for those networks is spotty so we rely on the landline.  However, when we reported a lack of cell service with T-Mobile, SimpliSafe sent us a Verizon chip (with fabulous instructions on how to replace the other) overnight for free.  It seems to be working better, but, again, whether this is an issue for you is cell coverage dependent and not a reflection on SimpliSafe.Usually I wait to review a product until I've used all its features, but I didn't want to wait until someone broke into the house and the police came to review the product; hopefully, that will never happen.  I have 100% confidence that the alarm system will do its thing.  We set it every night to Home and every time we leave to Away.  So easy!!Thank you, SimpliSafe, for an economical, easy, and reliable alarm system!!!

Reviews.Title: Almost too good to be true! But it is AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Troy Bond
Reviews.Content: I've never had a security system/service before since they were so costly. I came across Simplisafe from an ad on Facebook and decided to do some research. It sounded too good to be true. But what I found was so many people with such positive reviews. Also no contract and service was optional sold me. Decided to purchase it for my home. Then I was reminded to call my home insurance company to see what kind of discount they would give me on my premium. By doing that and providing them the Simplisafe certificate, the wash between my monthly premium and the basic $15 monitoring fee came out to be about $6 for my monthly monitoring!!!! Now that's affordable! I've had the system for about 3 weeks now with not one issue or false alarm. Everything came working flawlessly. I own two small dogs but during the day they are not near any motion sensors but in test mode they didn't register even if they were. It was a breeze to set up. I decided to use the screws rather than the tape so it took me longer but had it going the same night I got it in the mail! You can't go wrong with this system. I also like how you can take it with you if you move!! Awesome job, SimpliSafe!!

Reviews.Title: Everything it claimss to be!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is a great system. Its NOT a gimmick. Easy to install. Check out their website and watch the video. Customer service is very friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: Prompt responses by a real person
Reviews.Author: Kara McCauley
Reviews.Content: I liked being able to choose my own number of attachments without worrying about an excessive additional cost.  But, most of all, I liked actually being able to talk to a real person (either by email or phone) whenever I had an issue.  Also, their response was prompt and helpful.

Reviews.Title: Very Easy to Install and Works Great
Reviews.Author: A. Parker
Reviews.Content: Pros:This unit was incredibly easy to install. Essentially you just pull the tab back on each sensor and place against the wall.The wireless base station sounds whenever an entry sensor opens. I like this because I like to hear when someone comes in/out of a door, opens the window, etc.Monitoring is only $15 / month and optional. If you don't want monitoring, the base station will blink until you call their support line and get an update to make the system sound @ home only.Cons:The base station alarm is ok, but not as loud as you might like if you're planning to do sound at home only.No options for cameras yet—although I am not sure that's a bad thing with Simplisafe's MO. However, just use a few d-link style cameras and you'll be set if you want that option. Simplisafe is the best when it comes to alarms and sensors in my opinion.Overall:Great buy. You will enjoy this system and find it very easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Great home alarm for the money
Reviews.Author: David Reed
Reviews.Content: Shopped around for several months for a do it yourself home alarm. I received my simplisafe system and installed it last weekend. I couldn't be happier, easy installation and everything worked perfectly first try. The system is loaded with features that make the system very convenient if using the interactive monitoring. At $25 the interactive monitoring is about 1/3 the cost of most systems i found. So far i am blown away by how good the equipment and monitoring has worked.

Reviews.Title: Installed and operational in short order
Reviews.Author: Aidan D. Dunne "Oh no, not again."
Reviews.Content: Our last home had a wireless system from one of the bigger players in the market. It required a phone line and was a pain for the technician to install .. all the worthwhile functions ( adding new sensors etc. ) were tied up so that I would have to pay crazy prices to get the system modified. Also, I asked him what would happen if a burglar ripped the system off the wall or just cut the wires; all he could do was shrug.We since moved to a new house and I was determined to not use a system that was hard to extend and which was easy to disable.The new home had an older wired system. I researched home automation, with the idea of adding a new control panel that was GSM based and trying to patch the existing wired sensors into that, then hooking it all into my burgeoning home-automation system. After a while, I realized I was not going to get anywhere with that; although I'm fairly technical, I'm not an electrician and I was probably in for a steep learning curve.After a lot of research, we settled on Simplisafe and as I've only just installed it, I can't speak to the dispatch center's reliability, but my experience with regard to how well designed this system is speaks to me of a well-thought out plan for home security.Here are the pros and cons:pros:+ Once the system is installed you can add sensors very cheaply ( ~$30 for a motion sensor )+ it is easy to integrate new sensors into your system.+ The base station does not need to be on your home network+ Setup is simple , just plug the supplied usb fob into your computer, reconfigure, and plug it into the base station and it does the rest.+ Once initial setup is complete, configuration that you do on the web-based dashboard is sent via GSM to the base station so you can configure as needed.+ You can direct and control responses on a sensor-by-sensor basis.+ GSM based, battery backup; you can put the base station wherever you want+ Easy ( and cheap ) to install backup sirens ( I used a ladder to install my backup siren, so it'd be hard to pull it down )+ Set up multiple email/sms alerts ( both my wife and I get notifications )+ Smartphone apps available ( with top-tier subscription plan )+ Very mobile; you can reconfigure your sensor "field" at the expense of only the sticky strips needed to mount them. For renters, this is a dream; you can install a security system that is independent of the landlord and which you can easily take down and re-install in your new place in minutes if you move house.Cons ( a short list )- I wish it had z-wave integration.. I'd bet a shunt could be written to parse notification emails and route appropriately via a z-wave API.- I think the subscription plan should be a flat fee with all the bells and whistles at a single intermediate price. Currently, the subscription is billed at 3 tiers. The top tier is still very competitive when you look at the other players in the market.- Honestly, I can't think of any other downsides to the system, you pay up-front but the monitoring prices are very competitive. Once installed, you can extend the system component-by-component.Summary:Like I said, I only just installed this so I have no experience with the long-term operational effectiveness. I'll return with an update after an appropriate period of time. My past experience with security companies is that as soon as you have paid them the installation fee and signed the contract, you are just an inconvenience to them. I've found simplisafe to be proactive and enthusiastic about engaging with their customers. The cynical side of me understands that they have a business in selling more sensors and replacing batteries ( not to mention holding on to the monitoring contract ) but at least that means that customer-centric attitude is baked in at a corporate level.Technically speaking, I can tell this system was designed in a smart way; it's modular, easy to use, extensible and comprehensive.Based on my initial experience, I'd heartily recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I'm returning the whole thing after 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Willie Williams
Reviews.Content: Paid over $400 for the system and it never worked correctly. First keypad didn't communicate with base station. Got a replacement it worked sometimes. Then they sent a new base station to see if that would fix the problem. The 2nd one was worse. The speaker doesn't work. Can turn it on from the keypad, but not off. So after 2 weeks of trying to get an alarm system, I'm back where I started.

Reviews.Title: Great system that could use a facelift and a few improvements
Reviews.Author: JoeSoCal818
Reviews.Content: Pros: As DIY security systems go, it couldn't be easier to set up and use. Truly plug and play. Also, excellent features such as full battery backup and true, independent GSM connection (with paid monitoring service). The system is completely wireless and hardware is customizable to your needs.Cons: Hardware looks a little dated and clunky. Keypad is nice and simple, but no illuminated keys! You have to turn on the lights to see what you're doing. Even the cheapest devices have illuminated key pads. I was shocked by that. Also, you have to pay for "premium" service if you want anything more than just traditional monitoring and event logging. [edit]Overall, satisfied so far and the system will pay for itself in a year or two. Good, but has the potential to be excellent. I will update my revew if anything changes!

Reviews.Title: simple
Reviews.Author: mark fischer
Reviews.Content: We've had a hard-wired alarm system for years but a few years ago, decided to discontinue the monitoring because we rarely set the alarm due to false alarms.  We received a noticde from our insurance carrier that we were going to lose our discount unless we coudl provide a certificate showing the house had a monitored alarm system.I searched on-line and found a couple of DIY wireless systems but overall the Simplisafe seemed to be the best value.  I found an on-line coupon for a free alarm panel and that sealed the deal.  I was able to get everything i needed to replace my wired system for $420.The Simplisafe system was very simple to install.  I had a few minor issues getting the base unit to communicate back to their servers but that was resolved by resetting the base unit.  All other testing and installation was very straightforward.  we have a 35# dog and the instructions for installing motion sensors seem to have worked, no false alarms.  The money we're saving off of our insurance more than pays for monitoring (basic = $15/m).

Reviews.Title: So easy to install & I now feel much safer!
Reviews.Author: Priscilla Miller
Reviews.Content: I'm a young woman who recently moved into an apartment in a transitional neighborhood. Because I have two entry ways I'm very nervous about someone being able to break into the backdoor. I purchased the system that included a motion sensor and four entry point detectors. and got a key ring fob with panic button for free, which I keep next to my bed. The total set up took roughly 30-40 minutes including the testing portion. Not to sound weird but it was actually kind of fun to set it up! The color of the sensors are a subtle white color which match perfectly with my moldings. They actually blend in well enough that I don't think you'd see them unless you were really looking for them so don't worry about any eyesores in your living spaces. The key pad is compact and fits perfectly next to my front door. I love that I can have multiple pin numbers for my apartment management company and dog walker so that I know who exactly is entering and when.The alarm makes me feel safe, certainly is giving my dad less of a heart attack, and is super easy to monitor anywhere on the go right from my iPhone. I would HIGHLY recommend for someone who frequently moves and is looking for a mobile solution, lives in a rented house or apartment, or is looking for a safe and easy system to install. And although I hope I never have to truly 'use' it, it does help me sleep easier at night knowing the police are essentially at-the-ready, I could not recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: The best security system!!
Reviews.Author: Alicia Hammel
Reviews.Content: I am a renter who recently moved into a very good neighborhood but unknowingly moved into a place that had a criminal on the 2nd floor.  It wasn't until we were already settled in to our new place that we discovered the 2nd floor tenant is on Probation, is a drug addict and has "sticky fingers."  After learning this, my fiancé and I immediately started searching for a security system.  After speaking with many “name brand” security companies our frustrations emerged immediately.  Not only were their monthly service fees over priced but the systems they wanted to install were all hard wired and required a 3 year contract.  As renters there was no way we were signing a 3 year contract!  I went online and searched for an alternative.  Simplisafe and few other  companies offering similar services came up so I researched them all.  One of the other companies had lower prices for the security system itself but again, their monthly service fees were over priced so overall we would end up paying way more.  Honestly, I decided to go with Simplisafe mainly because they had the lowest monthly service fee and because of the coupon I found by doing a Google search and I AM SO GLAD I WENT WITH SIMPLISAFE!!  The security system is state of the art, my fiancé and I had the system completely installed in under 15 minutes (installation was so simple I could have done it myself) and it works GREAT!!  The system is easy to use, there are no contracts to sign and if we move, the system will very easily move with us.  My fiancé and I could only afford to start with a basic alarm system but Simplisafe makes it so easy to add on to any system that we have and plan to continue adding on to our system.  I’ve only had to contact customer service once with a question about my dog and their motion sensor but that one experience was very pleasant.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.  The 2nd floor tenant has since been arrested and is out of our lives but we are so happy with Simplisafe that we are continuing with their services.  I have been lucky enough to not have to experience Simplisafe’s response time to a triggered alarm but I am so confident with Simplisafe that I am sure it will be nothing but the best.  I love Simplisafe and have recommended it to everyone I know whether they own or rent.

Reviews.Title: COST EFFECTIVE and EASY....Love this system !!!
Reviews.Author: Chris A. Bernard
Reviews.Content: I installed 17 entry sensors (doors and windows) along with 2 motion and an extra 105 db siren in under an hour... Did the keypad initialization and then went to the thumb drive only to realize all of the devices were populated and set already in the software.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this system.  Only one flaw that I found, if you do not subscribe to the service, the base will flash.  Call SimpliSafe and get a download...REALLY SIMPLE FIX !  They should have put this info in the manual or added it as an option on the wizard.Suggestion: if you get the system, make sure to get the 105 db alarm.  I do have one inside.  I will be buying another for outside...

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe is simply the easiest and the best way to protect your family.
Reviews.Author: Brenda Watkins
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a Simplisafe Alarm system for my home as well as my parent’s home. Simplisafe made it easy to set up the system and get it connected to central dispatch. If I had a question, I called customer service and the problem was solved. They have thought of everything. There is nothing I can think of that I would add. The monthly charge is the cheapest I could find. The system was  inexpensive. Other companies wanted to charge me hundreds for the system and nearly $50.00 a month to monitor it. We live in a rural area and the cell phone service is not the best. I called Simplisafe and explained the problem and they sent me a component to fix the problem at no charge. If you need an alarm get Simplisafe.

Reviews.Title: SImple, Easy, as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Stephen Davison
Reviews.Content: I purchased the security system for a second home which is unoccupied for more than half the year. I learned of the company on This Old House, I did a bit of research on line, determined the system's weaknesses and strengths and decided for the price it was worth a try. I only installed the system a week ago, so not a longtime user, but what I have experienced it is has been great. Here are my pros and cons:PRO's-customer service was outstanding in answering questions both before purchase and after with installation/placement/usage questions.-very simple to install.  I did not use adhesive backing at all for any elements, I used screws for all elements of the system and it took me about two hours which included fabricating a mount in the attic by the attic vent for an extra siren. (I had 3 motion sensors/4 entry sensors/a smoke alarm/extra siren/keypad)-system test after installation was simple/website account set-up was straightforward/activating monitoring and using apps was easy.-system is very flexible and perfect for a second home. I will know via text and e-mail within ten seconds if there is an alarm activation or problem regardless of where I am as long as I have my cell phone and cell service.-I can set up specific passwords for service people to enter house then change those passwords when they are done, remotely, and I will know every time they disarm/arm the system.-I can change a multitude of settings from any computer/ipad/phone at any time in addition to arming/disarming system.-perfect for a second home.CON's-I personally would not install any sensors using the tape mount that is provided. Seems like in just a matter of time, it will let go and you will have sensors on the floor. They provide screws for every sensor and it is worth taking the extra time.- There is no camera feed at this time-Siren is not loud enough for my liking. I think that both the base siren and the extra siren need to be louder.  I installed the extra siren in the attic, facing outward, right behind the attic vent so that it would not be exposed to the elements, but still blast basically straight out, and it is not loud enough. If it is a cold, windy night and all neighbors have windows closed they will not hear it.  Yes, the police will still be dispatched, but I would like the whole neighborhood to look out their windows.Overall, perfect for my application-battery life remains to be seen, but for $400, I have everything I need to protect the house.

Reviews.Title: We feel safer already
Reviews.Author: lucinda c. woerner
Reviews.Content: Our vacation home was robbed recently and we needed to install a security system. The police recommended using a wireless system as burglars tend to cut the power to a home they plan to enter. Simplisafe was affordable and so easy to install that we plan to install a system in our primary home also.

Reviews.Title: Works exactly as advertised ..
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: This product installs and works exactly as advertised, it is literally plug and play.  It's an excellent solution for anyone looking for an alarm system.  I have bought two now, one for an office building and one for my daughter's house, and both worked just like the ad said they would.The only thing I would change is the shopping cart on the web site - it's cumbersome and makes a shopper go back and forth every time they select a single item.  A better way to shop would be the ability to open a page of options and devices and select all you need from one page, then click Add to Cart when finished.  Candidly, they might even sell more stuff that way.But the product itself is excellent, and I would recommend this alarm system to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A reliable home security system at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Prasanth
Reviews.Content: I replaced ADT home security system with simplisafe a month ago.ADT kept jacking up the subscription fee and I was waiting for the contract period to be over .. Installation of Simplisafe was a breeze. ( it took more time taking out the ADT system! ) Everything connected with the base station on the first try. I had problem connecting with wireless service ( default T-Mobile that came with base station) since there was no coverage in our area. Simplisafe sent me a verizon card and it arrived in 3 days. Replacing the card was easy and system is fully functional now. No contract, reliable  and a reasonable monitoring fee.. Just the product I was looking for. I highly recommend Simplisafe to anyone planning to move away from highly priced home monitoring providers.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install home security system
Reviews.Author: George Provencher
Reviews.Content: I purchased this system after seeing it on PBS "Ask This Old House" TV show.  I was impressed with the system's ease of installation. After reading several reviews, I purchased their full package plus a few extra pieces to fully protect all areas of our house.The best features of this system:  No wiring needed, units are battery powered, I installed the system in a ten room house in less than three hours including programming which is super easy; I selected the most expensive monitoring available which is only $25 per month with no contracts so you can cancel anytime; the system monitors break ins, fire, freezing, carbon monoxide and water leakage on selected appliances and can be connected to your cell phone or tablet which gives you all info and total control of the system.I had been looking around for a monitoring system and I did check with the "big name brands" and their ads for a free system  install.  All I can say is make darn sure you read all the fine print before you sign any deal and that you have a thorough understanding of all prices and commitments.I placed the system in operation and opened an alarmed door.  Before I could reset the alarm, the monitoring company was calling.Talk about fast response times!!Last but not least, this system does not depend on your phone line nor does it tie it up.  This system has a built in cell phone to communicate with the monitoring company so you need to live in an area which has cell phone coverage.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe is an Outstanding Product!
Reviews.Author: S.Dickson
Reviews.Content: As a retired police detective supervisor of 34 years in a major California Sheriff's Department serving over one (1) million residents, I have had years of experience responding to both business and residential burglaries. I previously owned two homes where I had traditional "hardwire" burglar alarm systems that involved door sensors, carpet sensor pads and motion detectors. These systems,  25 to 30 years ago cost me over $1,200 each and were local alarm (outside bell) systems that were not monitored by a call center.Retired cop friends of mine have installed the SimpliSafe system so I had an opportunity to physically examine operating systems and do the touch and feel test. One of my retired friends travels alot and uses the SimpliSafe monitoring center and a SmartPhone application to receive notifications when his neighbors enter his house to water his plants. He loves it.We chose to not have our system monitored and rely on neighbors to hear the siren. The system we selected involved two motion detectors, six door sensors and a panic alarm along with smoke detector. Burglars may break a double pane window but in my experience they don't exit through the point of entry in a window, but go out a door. So, we wanted to detect motion, movement, exiting and with the close proximity of neighbors knew that the siren would generate a call to the police, scare off a theif and protect our belongings.We received a discount on our system due to our friends recommendations and they recieved a free months monitoring from SimplySafe, so look for discounts from friends you know and ask the Simplisafe representative for them.We installed the system in less than two hours, and it has worked perfectly, no different from the old systems I had previously installed on my old homes and the components offer five year litihium battery life, and an easy system check. A plus for the wife is that she can use the key chain remote and not utilize the entry key pad. Our neighbor is eager to check our home now since we supplied her with a key chain remote as well.$400 bucks as compared to $1,200 in 1980 dollars or a contract alarm company that requires an initial installation fee and multi-year contract. Who would you select? You do the math! When you give consideration to just the equipment that comprises an alarm system, could it be said that the stuff the commercial companies want to sell you in a three year contract as advertised on TV is better than the stuff that SimpliSafe sells? I think it's pretty much the same stuff. So, if it makes you comfortable paying more because you think you are getting something more then don't do Simplisafe.Next big advantage to SimpliSafe: You own it! It's portable, you can move it from house to house, apartment to apartment by yourself and you don't need a service call or to pay extra to a technician to move it. How cool is that? If you have a college aged daughter who has moved out to her first apartment, buy her a system and get some peace of mind!Also interesting, was the quality feedback and follow-up response by the folks at SimpliSafe. They have customer service down, are based in New Jersey, not some call center in a foreign country. You will enjoy working with these folks.Don't be initimidated by something you don't know. The instructions that come with the delivered system are more complete and informative that what is offered on the SimplSafe website as they should be and you will easily be able to install this system.This is a great value for the price, will give you peace of mind and you will love the interior panic button features that you can purchase to place adjacent to your front door, night stand and in the bathroom of elderly folks who live with you. You will also love the feature that enables you to alarm interior portions of your home to detect intrusion while you are sleeping.Remember to check with your local law enforcement agency regarding alarm ordinances, permits, restrictions and all that when selecting any alarm.And, let's be honest here regarding police capability. I don't know of any police agency that can provide instantaneous police responses to even the most critical emergency.  Having been the Commander of a 9-1-1 Dispatch Call Center I have seen all the issues with answering 9-1-1 calls, getting information, formulating and typing a call up, sending it to a dispatcher, getting the call sent, locating the nearest police car to the call and all the variables associated with traffic jams, weather, confusion in the call and all that. We need to do everything we possible can to enhance our safety and "tip the scales" in our favor. A good burglar alarm is simply another tool in your tool box of safety items to prevent victimization of you and your loved ones.Stay safe!

Reviews.Title: Works well so far
Reviews.Author: Kodack
Reviews.Content: It was a pretty hassle free installation. I added 2 additional motion detectors and the 115db siren to the system and it's great. You have to order additional sensors directly from simplisafe though. I don't know why but Amazon doesn't sell them, and the few motion detectors I found on amazon for it were marked up 100% over retail. Don't pay $80 for a motion detector, buy it direct from the mfg for $30 each.A few things to know:The first 72 hours after activating you will be in "test mode". They will NOT respond to alarms during this time. IT gives you time to get used to disarming the system.You MAY need an alarm permit from your city. Mine was $50 a yearYou SHOULD tell your insurance company you have a monitored alarm. This saved me $80 a year on homeowners insurance.The monitoring plans are $15 for monitoring only, $20 for texts when system is armed, goes off, etc, and $25 if you want to be able to arm it and change settings from the website.The only sensor I used the sticky pads with was on a window and it worked well. I screwed all other sensors and devices to the wall or door.The motion detector went off from my 12lb cat in a hallway. I ended up mounting it upside down to prevent false alarms. The other 2 motion detectors were far enough away and high enough up that the cat doesn't set them off.The Keyfob is a liability. If a burglar knows where to find it, they can cancel the alarm. Hide it and don't tell anyone where it is.The keyfob has a panic button. Don't keep it on your keys, you might accidentally hit the button starting your car, then look out.....police time.The keyfob is a USB stick. You can configure your system using the included application on the thumb drive. Then you plug the thumb drive into the base station and it programs itself from there. Pretty cool setup.Something else to keep in mind is if a burglar can find your base station within 30 seconds (by default) and destroy it, your alarm won't go off. It's a good idea to hide the base station somewhere and don't tell people where it is. I put mine inside of a cabinet not near any doors.I set the alarm off once to test it. The monitoring center called within 60 seconds and when I didn't answer they had already called the police. Pretty good monitoring if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: It serves the purpose.
Reviews.Author: Joann
Reviews.Content: I like the simplicity of the installation.The only negative I have is that the keypad is not illuminated and we need to put the light on in the room in order to see the numbers so that we can disarm the system.Decent for the money.

Reviews.Title: Very good system, and an excellent value
Reviews.Author: Henry K. Thomas
Reviews.Content: Instead of using motion detectors, my wife had asked that we put sensors on all of our doors and windows.  We looked at both ADT and a local company, but the amount of hardware that we needed made them much more expensive than Simplisafe.  We have now installed all of the Simplisafe equipment and are very happy with the result.  We chose the upgraded monitoring and I personally like being able to arm/disarm the system with my smartphone.  We do, however, have a couple of areas where we would support an upgrade:  1.  Light the keypad keys, if only briefly, so that we can better see to arm/disarm the system during the night.  2.  When a door or window is opened, instead of hearing a chime, we would like to hear the name we have assigned to that sensor.  Overall, we are very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Takes a bit of getting used to, but works very well
Reviews.Author: Henry Wolford
Reviews.Content: The system itself is very good and it is extremely easy to install.  However, the instructions, user manual, and the online support services leave a lot to be desired.  In the initial "practice" period, I ran into a lot of "quirky" problems which almost caused me to pack it up and send it back.  The online and phone support exchanges were well supported and once I knew why something happened, I felt more comfortable.Let me give you one example.  The installation instructions sated, "Do not place the base unit on the floor."  I figured the reason was to prevent kids and animals from damaging it while running around.  As I have neither, I placed the unit on a raised platform near my fireplace.  On the third day, the base station lost the cellular connection to the company.  This happened on the weekend when no tech support was available.  The online support community (which has no search function) eventually let me know, what should have been included in the instructions.  The unit needed to be 3-5 feet off the ground for better cell receptions, near a window, and the base station has a land line back-up capability.  Had the install instruction had such suggestions, the problem would have been avoided.On the whole, now that I have sorted through a lot of the small issues not adequately laid out in the user manual or install instructions, I am very happy with it.  I had ADT and they kept raising the monthly monitoring fees.  They were not interested in upgrading the system or keeping the price flat.  At $45 a month, I was getting the same service I would from SimpliSafe at $15.  That made for a pretty fast payback on the up front equipment costs. On the other hand, I was able to add smoke detection and carbon monoxide, remote arming/disarming ability, and more entry sensors than my ADT system and only pay $25 a month for a greatly enhanced system over ADT.When I tried to negotiate with ADT for the upgraded services (after being a customer for five years) they would have charged me almost as much as the equipment from SimpliSafe cost, plus another $8 a month for the monitoring...and I still would not have been able to remotely arm/disarm or verify the system status.  When I told them this would cause me to leave to another company, they simply said, Okay, have a nice day."Here's the best advice I can give you for getting comfortable with the system.  Take full advantage of the 3 days of practice time.  Trigger everything.  Run through all of the arming/disarming options.  Put the system to the test.  Go to the online support forum and read through as much as you can stand, because it is there you will really learn how the system works.  Finally, ask every question, no matter how trivial, to SimpliSafe either via the phone or the online email.

Reviews.Title: Impressive features for little money
Reviews.Author: Samuel Lattuca
Reviews.Content: Having experience with security systems in the past I purchased this system aware of the 60 day return policy. The system was installed in an older building which I had serious doubts about the wireless system dealing with. The order was expediently shipped and was as ordered with free shipping. The equipment has a 3 year warranty and the components are value priced. The batteries are supposed to last 3 to 5 years and probably will, based on previous experience with systems but haven't had it long enough to contradict that. Installation is pretty much foolproof and is voice assisted to aid you. The system and monitoring service is easy to set up and is also guided as you go through the process. Not sure how it could be any better for the money. The only shortage I detected which is probably available in a higher model is the ability to discriminate which sensors are which. The system will not report that a particular sensor is open, only that that type of sensor is reporting, which could be a problem if you have a large system with lots of similar components. (i.e. the system will report an open entry sensor, but does not identify which sensor.) Zone identification is something found in higher end models. One extra benefit I didn't anticipate is that even with the smallest monitoring package, if you log on to your account it will list the time of events, such as alarm disabled at 2:15 P.M. or power outage at 3:10. All in all, excluding the one shortcoming,  I believe this product and company to be a very good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Really 5-Star!
Reviews.Author: Donald Sandmann "Don"
Reviews.Content: My package arrived as scheduled.  Within 90 minutes I had installed and tested the system.  The instructions are easy to follow.  I am a DIY'er, but I believe almost anyone can do this.  We feel especially secure knowing that the connection to monitoring is wireless.

Reviews.Title: Great Home Security System
Reviews.Author: Alabama Man
Reviews.Content: Set up was fairly simple....it talks you through it.The only advice I have for any prospective buyers is do not point motion sensors towards a window.I had a few false alarms with mine and each time they were pointed towards a window.Once I moved those sensors, not one false alarm since.

Reviews.Title: Great value...easy to install.
Reviews.Author: Juliana Worthington
Reviews.Content: Only 3 comments on the system.  The motion detector set up in the directions shows a "corner" mount, but the units only had tape for a flush mount.  In arming windows, due to the configuration of my windows, I had to reverse the magnet and the sensor...might be a good idea to note that option in the directions.  Finally, I still am not comfortable with the key chain unit that doesn't require a code be entered to shut the alarm off.  My purse is stolen, the thief not only has my address, he's also got free access with the key chain "off".  Even with those negatives, it's a great system and I feel much more secure having it in place.

Reviews.Title: Mechanically/electronicly fine
Reviews.Author: Robert Granell
Reviews.Content: Everything works as intended.  Good customer service assistance, but hours much too limited for my taste.  Although there is a manual for installation, website instructions, a forum, etc, you will need a week to discover where all the answers are hidden if you really want to understand your system.  They need a new comprehensive manual.The keypad does all the right things, but has small print and needs a BIG button to initiate backlighting.  I have a small flashlight nearby....not a good answer!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Donald E. Gundred
Reviews.Content: I have only had the system up and running for a few days.  After changing the receiver to Verizon from T-Mobile, the reception has been great.  I have tested all the sensors and everything seems to work as designed.  The customer support has been great, as they mailed the Verizon unit in overnight mail.  So far very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Bobbi Gagne
Reviews.Content: After having our home broken into after having lived in it for thirty three years we felt unsafe to leave our home as the break in occurred in the daytime. Being an older couple we wanted a system we could get quickly, install ourselves, and cover key points in our two story home. We also did not want any high pressure sales people or high monthly monitoring bills. After much research and reading reviews on this product and others we selected Simplisafe. We received our order quickly, when we wanted to add extras to meet our needs those items were the same price as when we ordered the system which often isn't the case and those items came quickly as well. Our questions submitted through email were all responded to and calls were answered. The system took us about four hours to install but we live in an older home where doors and windows are not always level and we have a lot if access points including windows and doors. Also as we are in our sixties and my husband has major knee replacement issues we found the two of us were able to get the system installed. The directions answered mist of our questions about installing and ensuring we covered key areas along with how to have motion detectors inside the house which when the alarm is on at night are not operating so you don't set them off moving around in your home. I found we were offered choices as to the amount and fees of monitoring which fit many budgets and we were not pressured to select the highest. I highly recommend this product and will review in a year to let folks know if my opinion has changed.

Reviews.Title: So easy, a child could install it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Kyle J. Sexton"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to feel like my home was more secure when I travel, but I hate being a slave to the contracts required by security companies. Simplisafe is a different kind of company, clearly.My 13-year-old son and I had a blast installing this system in our home... so much fun in fact that I wish it had taken longer. We had the whole thing done in 20 minutes, and now he is super comfortable with how it works and why it's there. My neighbor's home was broken into and robbed while she was upstairs -- shocking -- so this system brings much piece of mind.I had no intention of signing up for the monthly service, but I really admired the company's comfortable approach with a cancel-anytime service, so I went for it. Now that I've installed the app on my phone, I think I'm going to keep it. It will be nice to monitor my home security when I travel, and I'm even thinking of adding more features to my system, such as the glass-break monitor and additional panic buttons. They didn't sell me a thing... they just made it really easy and fun to buy.

Reviews.Title: Great System - Performs as Advertized!
Reviews.Author: S. Jackson
Reviews.Content: I have installed and have used this system for just a week so far, but I can say that everything when as anticipated from the product descriptions on the SimpliSafe website.I ordered the system directly on the SimpliSafe website.  I ordered a basic system package and many additional specific sensors to achieve the home alarm system that I wanted. and I received my complete order within just a few days.  In addition, I realized that I had forgotten to order 2 additional sensors, ordered them that evening (separate order) and received these at the same time as the main system!I did screw most sensors into window and door frames, but did rely on the adhesive only for the magnet section attached to the doors/windows themselves.  I think that the adhesive would be adequate for most flat surfaces.I did do all of the system setup through the MyAccount feature on the SimpliSafe website, rather than the supplied installation wizard on the keychain remote.  This was because this was my preference (I'm a PC kind of guy), and I did not even try the wizard.The instructions were clear and the voice prompts through the base station make setup practically idiot-proof.I elected the $25/month service and am able to access the system through an iPhone app along with the website.  I am also getting e-mails and SMS alerts for system activity....we are first-time alarm system users at home and this is giving me a level of confidence that all is going well.
