I'll probably discontinue all but alarm alerts shortly.The Pros:No contract!Half the monthly expense of the "name-brand" wired systemsAdd or remove components to the system at any time.The Cons:Integrated camera not available  -From what I understand from their website SimpliSafe plans to release this product in the near future.All in all I give the system 5 stars and recommend it to home users.

Reviews.Title: If you are looking for a great security system at a great price, look no further than Simplisafe
Reviews.Author: Mike Schroeder
Reviews.Content: I have installed this system twice now and this one is for my Guns and Ammo business. I absolutely love the ease of installation and the selection of sensors available. The customer service is outstanding as well as there correspondence. The features available with this system is equal to any of the top security companies for a whole lot less. I have no regrets or wish I had's from buying this system.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe Alarm System Installation
Reviews.Author: Jill Bann
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, this is an excellent DIY system.  Ease of use and programming via the wizard and keychain remote is wonderful!  The growth aspect of this system is a big plus.I elected to install the entry sensors on all doors with provided screws.  I like the tape provided, but I don't trust it from the false alarm perspective.  My alarm is installed in a mountain cabin that experiences BIG temperature changes.The motion sensors require a bit more thought regarding sensitivity and placement.  My cabin has a stem wall underneath and the heating vents are installed in the floor (not the ceiling like many houses or apartments).  If you orient the sensors in the normal upright mode, they look down at a 45 degree angle.  Using the integral test mode, I discovered that they may activate erroneously when the heat comes on in a cold house.  Based on the feedback data provided on the website, I reinstalled the sensors 4' from the floor (to intercept intruders at the waist or chest) and flipped them upside down (so the beam pointed level to 45 degrees up).  That helped appreciably.  I also played with the sensitivity switch located in the battery compartment and set all my sensors to L (low).  They are shipped with the switch set in the midrange position between high and low.  I noticed no real degradation between medium and low except an increased "persistence" in sensitivity, detection range did not seem adversely effected in my house.Regarding monitoring, I had to disable mine as there is no T-Mobile support outside of big metropolitan areas in my state (AZ).  Simply put, I would jump on the monitor option even if it were $20 a month if you could negotiate a deal with carriers like Verizon that actually provide excellent cell phone coverage in rural areas.  Further, when I disable monitoring, I wouldn't have expected to get a "can't connect with dispatcher" prompt on my keyboard unit.  That alerts any visitors that view your keypad that your alarm is not fully functional.Finally, when I use my keychain remote to arm or disarm the system from outside my home, I have no feedback as to whether the command "took".  This drawback is the single reason I gave 4 stars.  This really needs to be fixed.  As an engineer, I would not necessarily change the keychain remote.  Rather, I would add an additional add-on product (like a freeze sensor or a water sensor) that annunciates the state of the alarm system from the base station given the inherent growth of the base module from an I/O perspective.  A simple visual sensor that reflects a command change for two seconds would suffice (and not reflect the current state of the alarm system on a continual basis).  If this sensor could be placed in a window or near a door panel, it would greatly improve the utility of the system and confidence of the user.  Given that such a device is reasonable in price, I would purchase this in a minute.All in all, this system is a great value for the money.  Kudos to the development team.  If I can help evaluate prototypes or beta software in the future, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: Works very well
Reviews.Author: D. Confarotta
Reviews.Content: Everything arrived, installed and works well. The price is great. I think there could be a bit more instructions for activating the system.

Reviews.Title: Good easy system.
Reviews.Author: D. Shiras
Reviews.Content: 1.  Simplisafe was recommend by several radio programs that I listen to and trust.2.  It was easy to install.  The molding around the door frames, however, did not make it convenient to install entry sensors.  It also was not obvious to me what the arrow on the side of the entry sensor was for.  At first, I thought it indicated that the module had to be mounted with the arrow pointing up.  Subsequently, I determined by experimentation, that it worked either way and decided that the arrow probably referred to the battery inside.3.  It is active now (two days) and all sensors communicate with the base station.  We have not signed up for monitoring yet.  I knew that we didn't have to, but the directions for installation almost make it seem as if you must.  They do not indicate that you have an option and that the system will work without monitoring.  Additionally, the smart phone features require a higher monthly fee which isn't obvious from the advertising.  (Still, this higher fee is less than we were paying in our last house for ADT.)4.  I like the computer set up and the use of the remote as a way to easily program/reprogram the base station for changing codes, adding/subtracting sensors, changing delays for exit and entry before setting the system, adjusting the volume of the base station voice cues from off to high, etc.

Reviews.Title: I have base st.,keypad,4ea motion sensors, 2ea loud seirens and a door sensor.
Reviews.Author: HAROLD G.
Reviews.Content: The keypad display is very small and hard to see also does not display the zone that is violated. MAJOR PROBLEMThe motion sensor (small pet) will work for 3 or 4 days then will set off alarm for no reason, I WILL TURN MOTIONDECTOR UPSIDE DOWN, I hope this will fix this problem.  The master station in setting on my bed, head boardI have 4 ea motion sensors, 1ea in enclosed porch,1ea in garage,1ea in the enclosed pattio and1ea in work shop. 1 ea big siren garage and 1 ea located under the eve outside the pattio.. 1 ea entry sensor on gate.I do not have the alarm monitoring service, because of 30 second delay,then service calls you for safe word,thencalls 911 this could add up to 45 to 60 secons. In 3 seconds i can be firing deadly shots then call 911I use the keychain remote to turn system on and off.Draw a floor plan and mark areas to be monitored, then make a list of equipment required.When installing the system mount units temporaly because you will be moving most of it to get in correct place.The inst. manual has a lot to be desired you have to read between the lines. for inst, the keychain remote isshown on page 1 but does not describe it's functions.I bought the basic unit then purchased additional equipment.Mibway

Reviews.Title: Simply Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jack Spratson "Jack"
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: I did not purchase my Simplisafe system on Amazon, I bought it directly from the Simplisafe website.I'm a long term electronics technician.  While I'm not an alarm installer, I have installed alarm systems in the past.  My current home is large and the layout makes it very difficult to install a wired alarmed system.  I had never tried a wireless system and truly fretted installing a glitchy wireless system which would eat batteries.  I would not consider a wireless alarm system because of preconceived notions and concerns about instabilities.I saw the Simplisafe system advertised so I went to Amazon to read the reviews.  The reviews looked good but some of the negative comments scared me a little.  For example, people said the system is not for a large home.  What does that mean?  What do they consider large?  Would my basement door sensor ever be detected through the tile floor?  Would the system give false alarms during thunderstorms?Well, I decided to give the system a try.  I'm glad I did, it was by far the easiest alarm system I have ever installed.  No wires, just think about where you want the sensor, clean the spot on the trim with alcohol, then peel and stick.All the sensors I purchased with the base station came pre-installed in the system, what a nice touch.  Initially I had a problem where one of the sensors wasn't responding. The system would give a verbal warning that one of the sensor was not responding.  I called Simplisafe and the very polite customer service person advised me to move the base station from behind the TV because of possible interference.  I did, but again the there was a sensor which was not responding.  So I looked up the sensor then traveled around the house looking for it.  It was not to be found.  Then I solved the mystery, I had failed to install one of the sensors (it was still in the box) so it never became active and wasn't detected by the base station.  It was my mistake.The system works flawlessly.  I moved the base station to the third floor and it has no problems detecting the basement sensors.This system even allows the user to put a sensor on a closet, refrigerator, or liquor cabinet so that even when the alarm is off, if anyone opens the door with the sensor, it immediately sends a text to phone number(s) of your choice.  I have a locked closet at with a gun locker in it.  If that door is opened for any reason, the alarm system contacts me via text.  Also when the system is armed or disarmed, I receive a text which tells me who disarmed the system.  The pass code it tied to a name.You can add sensors at any time.  My system has a panic button, door sensors, motion sensor, glass break sensors, smoke and carbon monoxide sensors.  There are approximately 30 sensors in my home and it all works flawlessly.It's a very well designed system and it works very well.  Don't hesitate to give it a try, I wish I hadn't been so fearful of a wireless system and tried it sooner.

Reviews.Title: Great system, easy to install, great support
Reviews.Author: L. Herbei
Reviews.Content: This is a great system. It is worth spending the time to attach everything with screws. I think that is one of the most important things to do. I would recommend also as your package arrives to take the extra siren batteries off (if you ordered it) as it may go off if it is not installed and synced with the station. Put batteries in just when ready to install. Spend the time to study where to set the motion sensors and the other type of sensors as this is key. The most sensitive will be the motions sensors that should be at 4-6ft height to detect humans properly and not pointed to heat sources or windows, ideally in a corner and oriented in the direction opposed to the windows. This is key to not have false alarms in the future.I can say that the client support is exceptional, I used the support email. All tips and questions were responded timely. My system is the full most complete one (all sensor types), with smoke detector and carbon monoxide detector, flood detector, etc. It integrates seamlessly and the phone application is very responsive and useful. I bought the interactive monitoring and you can turn on/off the alarm remotely, set it up in Home or Away mode also. You can also monitor the status of the sensors and receive SMSs and email messages.This works great. With this package you can also change the setting on your system online from your Simplisafe account. No more carrying the USB remote stick from the alarm to the computer and back. I found that being very useful.I think it is one of the best systems out there and the good is that it is an alternative to the big guys which have so hidden fees and a pushy sales practice and many still require wires. Way to go Simplisafe!

Reviews.Title: works great and easy to install
Reviews.Author: eric siegel
Reviews.Content: SimpliSafe forgot to include the keypad with the original shipment but sent it next day air.  The system was simple to install and works great. I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Wireless connection
Reviews.Author: Richard A Govers
Reviews.Content: Initially I had no connection to the SimpliSafe system, so I hooked up a land line to the base station and got connected.I called tech support and received a SIM card especially for Verizon (my wireless company), but I still could not get the base station to pick up a wireless signal, even though I show two bars on my cell phone at the location where the base station is located.  I called tech support a second time and we tried other locations in the house where I also have a land line connection.  All to no avail.I would think that the base station ought to establish a wireless connection if my cell phone can.

Reviews.Title: New to Simplisafe
Reviews.Author: sjckid
Reviews.Content: As stated, very easy to install! Very good basic system. I have been using it for a few days and no major issues so far.  As of now I am not using the monitoring system.  Maybe in the future I will.  The only thing I don't like is that the system constantly reminds you that you are not signed up for the service. It also announced that we are not using monitoring service when I  walked into the house. Not good if a burglar walked in!I would recommend this system.  Very easy to set up and gives you peace of mind.I forgot to add that I ordered just what I need.  I didn't go with a set package. You can talk to the sales rep and do this.  Be sure to ask for a discount.

Reviews.Title: Good Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Lance
Reviews.Content: Seems like a good product and was easy to install.  Customer service has been good and the monitoring center calls within seconds to acknowledge a test.  My only complaint is that at the $14.99 monthly rate the various sensors are not specifically identified on the keypad when a sensor is "open".  You have to physically check each opening to determine which one is open. However, if a sensor happens to be in a "fault" condition it will report in and you can see which sensor when you log in to your account online.

Reviews.Title: Simple to hook up like the name
Reviews.Author: johnny shipp
Reviews.Content: However will be 5 stars when Simplisafe safe get the glass breakage senson in, because all one would have to do is break the glass then hold the two door or window senson togather to keep them from going off. The service so far has been great, the best part is a  low price.

Reviews.Title: To simplisafe
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It was so easy to set up. And it works really well. And the price was right.I also save on my home owners insurance.Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: judy
Reviews.Content: Love this alarm. I feel so safe at night.  Its really effeciant and I haven't had any problems with it . I installed it myself with just a little help from simplisafe to get started. I didn't use a computer. All I needed for the base station. I recommend it to every one I  know. Thankyou simply safe.  I purchased the economy  package.. I will add to it if I want too later.

Reviews.Title: An excellent security system thus far
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Thus far, the system has been easy to use and was easy to set up.  Total setup time took about 30 minutes.  I like the response of the tower though sometimes it is hard to understand. I would definitely recommend this system to others.  My one concern is how well it will do on the Verizon network.  I tried three other systems before this one and so far this is the only one that has worked.  Hope the success lasts since we live in the country and my wife feels much safer with a dependable alarm system.  Should I have any problems, I will let you know.

Reviews.Title: I feel secure now
Reviews.Author: Terry Weeks
Reviews.Content: Super easy to setup due to clear and well written (and well drawn / animated) instructions.Awesome follow-up emails from company to make sure everything is working fine.If I can be broken into from a gated community with 2 locked outside doors and a double dead-bolt, then it can happen to you as well. Don't procrastinate until it's too late. Just do it and feel at ease once again.

Reviews.Title: A Great User Friendly System
Reviews.Author: Rod J. Mustanski, Author and Guest Speaker
Reviews.Content: Previously had another brand home security system and it was fine until I had to replace it after 8 years...the new generation could not be initialized and it just plain did not work.  The Simplisafe system installment was simple to set up and the operation of the system is first rate.  Highly recommend it for anyone wanting to secure their home.Rod J. MustanskiVirginia

Reviews.Title: New system in Florida house
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Gagnon
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install and use.  My only suggestion is to use a better quality installation tape for the heavier pieces (keypad and siren) like the 3M indoor/outdoor variety.  I would also like the option of a delayed arming in the "home" mode.

Reviews.Title: Very simple setup, so far so good...
Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: This system was a snap to setup. Everything was already configured by the time it arrived so all I had to do was to stick the pieces where I wanted them, turn on the base, and then test each unit. Every unit worked as expected and we're live with our alarm. We have large dogs so we had to figure out where we can put the motion detector. Simplisafe has a three day testing period where they won't report alarms to the authorities so we could experiment with the motion detector and find a good spot for it where the dogs won't trigger it.

Reviews.Title: used in classic car storage area
Reviews.Author: Frank Entwisle
Reviews.Content: i really need an entry sensor suitable for garage doors. the entry components don't lend themselves to that application although i did eventually find a way to make them work bypassing the operating cables, rails etc with some fabrication of mounts.

Reviews.Title: Great easy to use security system.
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: Installation was very easy and setting up my account online was a snap. The system will save me about $30/mo in monitoring charges. I have one very small complaint. The cap on the key chain remote comes off in my pocket  so I used some electrical tape to secure it.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Holly L. Lawton
Reviews.Content: This system was so easy to install and easy to use.  A flash drive provides step by step directions.  Installation of the system was simple.

Reviews.Title: Works great....simple..
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Schneider
Reviews.Content: Everything worked as advertised....Great!Not sure about this....i called my insurance company...Hartford AARP....no discount for this Simpli Safe monitored system...Is this because it is self installed???? The agent "didnt know"...

Reviews.Title: great, inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Joel E Cleary
Reviews.Content: Very good system.  The motion detectors, when modified, even work without false alarms in spite of our pets, too.  My only criticism is the instructions on synching the system to the base.....took me awhile to figure that out as the instructions sucked.Otherwise would highly recommend it.  And I am still waiting for their video camera system to be released.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and NO CONTRACTS!
Reviews.Author: Julie Blalock
Reviews.Content: System arrived 6 days from placing order. Very easy to install. System is simple to learn and website is easy to navigate. Love not having a contract and the low price of monthly monitoring compared to the big name alarm companies .

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up!
Reviews.Author: C. Castle
Reviews.Content: A fantastic, easy to use system. They resolved a missing component issue quickly and without hassle. Interactive monitoring is great! Learned about SimpliSafe from Glenn Beck!

Reviews.Title: Good system
Reviews.Author: Gary Barker
Reviews.Content: The system is easy to set up.  The biggest problem we had was making decisions on where to place the base station, keypad, motion sensors and extra alarm.  Our house doesn't exactly fit the "included diagrams".System seems to work well.  Wish it had a glass breakage sensor.

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: James A. Peer
Reviews.Content: This is my second system from Simplisafe.  One on my primary house and a second on another property.  Easy to install and use.  No problems with either system.  Great peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe is great!
Reviews.Author: Jack Higgins
Reviews.Content: SimpliSafe is easy to install, great customer support and simple to use.  Everyone should have the safe, secure home SimpliSafe provides.

Reviews.Title: The Best and easiest !!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I did the research and ordered the SimpliSafe System. This security system is very easy to install. More important it is affordable and simple to use. The dispatch center works from personal experience, a door was opened, not realizing the system was armed and the alarmed sounded. I put in our pin number as the phone rang, it was the dispatch center. I couldn't be happier with the SimpliSafe Security System.

Reviews.Title: BETTER than advertised!!
Reviews.Author: A.J. Coach
Reviews.Content: Simple & fast to install - my system, 18 motion sensors, 2 entry sensors, smoke detector, wireless keypad, 2 sirens, panic button - all installed and ready to go in 2 hrs & 15 min. and everything worked correctly right away. Monitoring works excellent. I recommend this to anyone that wants a low cost comprehensive security system. We are lovin' it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Sporty
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a totally wireless security system for years.  As a retired Deputy Sheriff I know that phone and cable lines can be cut rendering any system useless.  In the event of a power outage the system will fail unless you have a Simplisafe2 wireless home security system.  It monitors nearly everything you can think of from intrusion, shattering glass, water, freeze, fire, CO2.  Battery life is up to five years.  All that for a price that is affordable and if you move, you can take it with you and reactivate it at your new location.  It is monitored for only $14.94 a month.  Great value to be sure.

Reviews.Title: Finally a Home Security System I Like
Reviews.Author: Wizzard "gwitte2"
Reviews.Content: I have installed this system and love it.  For years, I avoided a home security system because of 1) the high monthly cost of central monitoring, 2) the inability to use motion detectors when you have pets, and 3) the annoyance potential extra cost of police response to false alarms.Pros:- It is completely wireless and very easy to install, re-position sensors, and even move to a different residence.- Central monitoring is just $14.95 per month but you can even use it without any central monitoring.- The system's built-in cell phone for central monitoring is not susceptible to being easily disabled and there is no extra cost for the cell-phone.- You can customize your system by purchasing the exact number and type of sensors you want.It has practically every type of sensor you may need including CO, smoke, freeze, etc.- The motion detector does not trip for objects less than 40(?) pounds so you can use it even if you have certain pets.- You can arm the system at night while sleeping for a sense of protection at night.- It supports a “duress” code that can be used to silence the alarm yet still request police.- The batteries in the sensors supposedly last five years and are replaceable.Cons:- I really cannot think of anything since the system is so well thought-out and so well designed.Check out the video at the SimpliSafe web site.  It provides a very thorough, brief summary.If you want an effective home security system – you should definitely consider this one.

Reviews.Title: As stated in sales promo
Reviews.Author: Barry Rooks
Reviews.Content: I purchased and installed this for elderly parents and it was extremely easy to install. It's operation is simple enough that they seem to understand and are able to operate easily. Very easy to log in and do everything online if you are semi internet skilled (as I would classify myself) Just now activated the monitoring system. If I knew they would not start raising monitoring rates at a rapid pace I would have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great and easy to Install
Reviews.Author: M. M. "Matty"
Reviews.Content: I would have given 5 stars if glass break sensors were available for the system. Also, I have had some issues with my base station saying "no link with dispatcher" a lot. Other than that, I am quite pleased with the system, and for the price of the monthly fee, it far exceeds my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Very Easy
Reviews.Author: Toni Keller
Reviews.Content: I like my new SimpliSafe system very much. Easy to install and set-up. I like that I can use the link to the dispatcher as I need it.Looked around and this was the best value with pretty much the same equipment (except video) as everyone else.

Reviews.Title: Bought this still testing it...
Reviews.Author: wildturkey
Reviews.Content: When I bought this unit I asked if I could put a sensor in the barn.. oh yes was their response!. Could I put this unit in a house with no heat if I were to go south for the winter.. oh yes was their response ! . The truth is, temperature has a effect on the batteries and if the temp goes below 41 degrees the sensor may read as error. I live in northern Michigan so that could be a problem. I also found out if you put the base unit on the fireplace the signal slowly goes into a random error mode one sensor after another going bad it seems the base unit or cone doesn't like stone or concrete an the signal just goes into the fireplace material. This wasn't in the book so am scared I may have paid for a unit that won't meet my needs. I have all the sensor's in place an moved the base unit and have no trouble but, I still wanted to turn the heat off an go south this may not be the unit for that. I called there "help line" after waiting for quite a while they finally talked me though the problems. The problem being some employees known more about the system then others. As I called like three times asking questions. So I guess my recommendation would be to ask a lot of questions but that my not be enough.

Reviews.Title: overall pretty good, but with some minor concerns
Reviews.Author: B. Zhang
Reviews.Content: Overall, the system is pretty good, easy installation for most parts, easy control in most situations. I'd like to give 5 starts if they could fix these issues:1. Customer service: I wouldn't say it's bad, but every time I call the customer service, I need to leave a voice mail, then somebody will call me back in a few hours. I'd like to talk to somebody when have time and the need to make the call.2. They clearly didn't consider the garage door sensor, you could still install the entry sensor if you are lucky enough to find a good place for it, or motion sensor for certain usage, but they should consider a total solution including the garage door.3. Remote control. It's a horrible design with cheap quality, the cap of the remote control gets off so easily, and the cover of the battery can be off easily too, what's more, it's way too big to be easily carried. They should redesign the remote control.4. I spent $10 additionally for the smartphone app, and email/sms notifications. The smartphone app doesn't have many functions that I can use from the web interface.

Reviews.Title: The name says it all
Reviews.Author: mrmjones
Reviews.Content: SImplisafe is simple and safe.  It's very easy (simple) to setup and my family and I feel secure (safe) with it.  Installation was easy and quick.  I recommend the interactive monitoring $24.99...by the way is still cheaper than any other monitoring service because it allows me to setup each sensor by name.  If the alarms goes off or there is a error I'll get a text letting me know exactly which sensor it is (i.e. backdoor sensor instead of receiving just a serial number of the sensor.  Who's going to remember their sensors by serial number...not this guy.Since the burglar or fire service has not been needed I can't tell you how quick the response is from the fire department or police but the monitoring service notification during a test is pretty quick.  I'm hoping i never get to use it.  Like I said before the peace of mind is all I need.The only complaint I have is the volume of the alarm.  The siren is not as loud the reviews claim.  You can definitely hear it but it's not ear piercing.  That should be a quick fix by ordering another siren....that's only if you want it to extremely loud.  I have three levels in my house.I love that you can customize it.  If you order it and find out you need more sensors, sirens, or anything else it's easy to set up.So far so good and I'm impressed with the product.  It saves me a lot of money.  Before this I was paying $64 a month to Vivint for their home automation system which was a good system but $24.99 compared to $64 is not close over three years.  Plus I couldn't take Vivint's system with me but I can take Simplisafe anywhere I go because it's completely wireless.  I must say I did like the camera that Vivint provided.  Simplisafe does not provide a camera yet but I'm fine with that because I can set that up on my own at home with my server.Also, Simplisafe home security is provided to you without a contract.  If you don't want the monitoring service you don't have to get it.  You'll just have an alarm that the neighbors will hear and contact the police for you if you're away.  The sound of the alarm with deter a burglar and they won't know if the police is coming or not.  I was in a 36 month $64 a month contract with Vivint but the system was "so called" free.  Not likely, that's over $2300 over the span of three years just for monitoring service and home automation.  I don't think so....I'm willing to bet the system price was included.  The good news is it helped me rent my house out when I left.  I hope this helps you with your decision for home security.

Reviews.Title: Awesome....(Reviews from a customer migrated from FrontPoint)
Reviews.Author: hari
Reviews.Content: First of all, SimpliSafe is my second home security system within a month. I had initially analyzed AT&T; , but went for FrontPoint considering it being rated number one among all the home security systems as per some of sites. Though the customer service of FrontPoint was very good, there were couple of drawbacks in the design of the equipment. Hence I thought of trying out SimpliSafe.And Frankly speaking, I love the design of SimpliSafe!. The fact that the keypad is separate from the base station and Siren, means you need not worry about mistyping the passcode and the siren ringing with more than 100 DB while you are near the keypad.(This happened to me with the FrontPoint!, got me almost deaf).And you can have multiple keypad for multiple doors of entry. Secondly, I could invest more of my money into the equipment than the service. FrontPoint was costing me $43 for interactive service. Also with the SS I did not have to haggle unnecessarily with the sales guy as I had to do with FP.I really loved the feature of SS to have a USB driven settings that I can use to customize the system for home and away options and add & remove any components. With FP, I was forced to go with the interactive package to achieve this. Also the SS components are very easy to remove from the walls/wood. On the other hand FP components when removed, left remains of the adhesive on the walls, almost ruining the looks.Atleast it's good to know that SS can have a back up option of broadband. Apart from AT&T; & SS, no other well known system have this dual capability. Coming to the financials:Any of the systems would at least cost you $1500 or more over period of 3 years even with lot of haggling. With SS, I bought equipment's in actually a bit of excess and purchased worth of $500. This has allowed me to "super" protect my home with actually 4 motion sensors and 8 contact sensors with other extras. And I can go for the interactive/monitoring service only when needed. I have control of what I need for my home rather some sales/customer service guy pushing only a limited set of equipment on my throat.Areas for improvement of SimpliSafe: Need the Glass Break Sensor (I think they will have it by March 2014). Secondly need to improve the customer service over weekends. Weekdays, it's pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Kudos!
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: So far, so good! The web site, videos and  ordering process were great. Easy to understand and use. Installation was a breeze, with good directions. Customer service has been wonderful helping us get set up, on-line and working. Thank you for coming up with an excellent, reliable and low-cost security system!

Reviews.Title: Easy Installation-Easily Customization-Up front pricing
Reviews.Author: Joel Langemaat
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research about security systems and asked many different people what they liked/disliked.  Every time it came back to pricing/contracts, home phone lines, installation fees etc.  I was not someone that wanted to pay $40-50 a month and be locked into a contract for 1-2 yrs minimum.I really enjoyed being able to customize the system to my home, along w/ very simple installation of the product.  I was a little hesitant about not having a licensed professional install product but it was very simple once watching/reading easy instructions.I am now interested to see how product and entry way sensors hold up to wear and tear of going in and out of doors along w/ seeing how battery life lasts in sensors.  Overall I am very pleased so far w/ the system and enjoy the simplicity of being able to do everything online when viewing my system.  As our family grows I am sure it will be simple to add sensors or more security monitoring as needed w/o having to worry about hidden fees etc. to do so, as many other companies require.

Reviews.Title: Setup
Reviews.Author: Marina Jorgensen
Reviews.Content: Everything about the setup of this system was very easy except for the changing of the code from the factory setting to my personal code. For some reason it took me several tries to get the code right. I followed the instructions in the book but initially failed to save the code I put in. I eventually got it in, through trial and error. The system looks very professional and the alarms were indeed nice and loud. For the money I am satisfied with my purchase and would recommend this to my family and friends without  hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Easy installation prompt assistance
Reviews.Author: Ambrish Vyas
Reviews.Content: I found the equipment very easy to install. Support staff were great at explaining how the system works and I have not had any problems since I started using it. Thank you SimpliSafe.

Reviews.Title: Great for Cottage or Second Home
Reviews.Author: Stephen South
Reviews.Content: I am taking care of an estate home in another state and needed something simple and fast as well as mobile and low cost to protect the property as I am not there 90% of the time.  This was a perfect solution.  Took about an hour to install and program.  Everything seems to working fine and so far no nasty false alarms.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe System a Snap to install.
Reviews.Author: Gary Fyke
Reviews.Content: I purchased the package priced at $419.00 and found it had more door/window sensors than actually needed, but included the smoke detector and two motion sensors. I bought the system as a gift to my daughter to help give her peace of mind and a sense of security. The home she lives in with her mother is on the very last lot on her street with two sides exposed to farm fields. The town is small, has no local police service other than the Sheriff's patrol who seldom, if ever, drives by her house. There is a volunteer fire and ambulance service, that is quite good.  As two women, living by themselves, in there location, they easily could become a target of opportunity to anyone seeking to burglarize their home or even target for a home invasion. I am a retired police officer and former sheriff's officer and her mother is a retired police dispatcher. We are very aware of the potential dangers that are present today and especially the vulnerabilities they have. I assisted in the placement of the sensors and other items of the package, with my daughter actually doing the installations, including setting up the alert response programing via WiFi. Her mother opted for the top grade alert notification plan and it was activated within an hour of opening the carton it arrived in. My daughter was very pleased with the appearance of the equipment, its ease of installation and the ease of activation. She repeated her thank you's so many times about how much relief she felt with the system in place, before i left their house,  I had to chuckle. This was one gift I have made that I absolutely knew was genuinely appreciated. It also gave me the gift that I have done something that may well prevent harm from touching someone I love. Peace of mind comes to the giver as-well-as the receiver. The reduction of the homeowner's insurance premium to my ex-wife appears to be a large enough to cover several months of the alert monitoring cost.  Seems like a win-win-win.

Reviews.Title: ONE Suggestion!
Reviews.Author: David V Avakian
Reviews.Content: The motion sensors come with the mounting tape on the flat side of the back which will not serve to mount the devices in a corner - where they are most effective.  Appluying the mounting tape on the 45 degree corners would be more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: hOME SECURITY SYSTEM
Reviews.Author: JIM CHAPPELL
Reviews.Content: vERY REASONABLE SYSTEM, RELIABLE AND LATEST TECHNOLOGY, EASE OF INSTALLATION. PERSONNEL WERE  COURTIOS AND KNOWLEDGABLE. nO SALES PITCH OR HARD SELL OF EXTRAS,lOWEST MONITORING OF ANY OTHER SECURITY COMPANY. i WAS VERY WELL INFORMED OF HOW THE SYSTEM WORKED AND INSTALLED WITH NO bull ***** WHICH DEVELOPED CONFIDENCE WITH THIS SYSTEM.i WILL FEEL VERY COMFORTABLE THAT MY ELDERLY WIFE WILL BE SECURE WHEN i PASS ON. tHEY GAVE ME GREAT PEACE OF MIND.gIVE THEM A TRY THEY ARE THE BEST I FOUND AND MOST COST EFFECTIVE

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe too eacy
Reviews.Author: Ed Sachs
Reviews.Content: Set up was a snap.  Testing is easy and complete with smart motion sensor.If your nervous of telephone wires being cut, this is your answer.  We have our base station plugged into a battery back up system if they cut power to the house, we still have 6 hours of battery power.

Reviews.Title: ZERO questions when you choose SimpliSafe
Reviews.Author: Ken Moore
Reviews.Content: I don't have any questions, just compliments. I received your system a couple of days ago and I have already installed it. It is FANTASTIC. A monkey could hook this thing up. I cannot express the joy and satisfaction one gets when something that you install out-of-the-box works so well. I had to move a sensor and the removal process was well thought out. Really you guys thought of everything.Now, here is where the rubber meets the road. I called into your Customer Service Department. Spoke to a David. Great personality, knew what he was talking about and get this, actually provided CRAZY GOOD SERVICE. When is the last time you said that about customer service?? It's a lost art.Thank you SimpleSafe for a great product, great service and PEACE OF MIND!!!

Reviews.Title: Great for Small Business
Reviews.Author: Chris Mercadante
Reviews.Content: I have been a Small Business Owner for 10 years and I have had the ADT's and others in the past with 3 different location it was expensive - now with 1 location I wanted something easy and trustworthy.  My brother put this in his house and he was talking about it, so I did a little research and found that it is very simple - this is a NO BRAINER for a small business.  I had everything set up in 20 minutes and I thought I was missing something, NO way it could be that easy!!!  I was wrong, it is that easy.  If I don't like something I would tell you it was bad, but when something is this easy and it actually work  - well I have no issues recommending this product to anyone!  Anyone with any question please feel free to ask me - if you have a small business and have a security system cancel it and order one of these - great product, easy setup, and the service is great - I have not needed it but my brother needed a new usb keychain he called and they sent one out to him - can't beat that!!

Reviews.Title: Just installed - so far, I'm very impressed.
Reviews.Author: Nate Johnson
Reviews.Content: 3 days into using the system.Installation was dead easy.  I installed 15 entry sensors, 4 motion sensors, the panic button, and the fire alarm in a couple of hours.  Just be sure to note the sensor ID as you are installing so you can enter the locations in later.The web interface is nice and the SMS to your phone feature is great.The remote monitoring just went live so I've yet to have any experience with that and obviously this could go from a 5 star to a 1 star if that doesn't work as described.  Will have to test it and update this review.Otherwise,  I saved roughly $1500 from ADT's install quote and am saving $30 per month on service.

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: Myron E West
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Very easy to install and set up. Reasonable monitoring fee for all the interactive tools with smart phones and computer.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amykins
Reviews.Content: SimpliSafe was very easy to install and has given us no issues. Very pleased!  I also love the monthly monitoring fee - lowest you can find!

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe Alarm System
Reviews.Author: Roluardo Amaral
Reviews.Content: This security system was very easy to install. The option of having to activate or cancel 24 hr monitor service when you want to, is a big plus. The extra siren was worth the price. recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: Simpli Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: V1Rotate
Reviews.Content: I've used and tested the SimpliSafe system for nearly 3 weeks now. I'd love to meet the person/people who came up with this... genius! It's exactly what I've been waiting for. You can attach the sensors and keypad with the included adhesive backings or the included hardware (very tiny screws). I really like that they included the option of attaching the sensors and keypad more securely/permanently with the micro-screws, which is what I did. No wires, no big holes drilled in the walls, no phone lines. Very easy install. The ability to manage all of the sensors on my PC and then download it to the SimpliSafe base via the USB keychain is brilliant. Their customer service is great as well. I was missing a yard sign in the package so I e-mailed them.  The very next day I received a reply and the yard sign was in the mail and on it's way to me. Very impressed! And the monitoring service is very nicely priced. Thank you SimpliSafe for the peace of mind I now have!

Reviews.Title: Great Security System!
Reviews.Author: D. Wright
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love our Simplisafe system! This is a second home for us and we have a security system from one of the "big guys" in our first home. Expensive monitoring and expensive maintenance.It took my husband about an hour to install our system, but we bought the best system and added to it: more door/window sensors, etc. Installation couldn't have been easier and that was what concerned me the most: getting in over our heads on "tech" stuff. No need for worry!Luckily, we haven't had to put the monitoring company to test yet, but I'm sure everything will work as advertised, just like everything else has with this system!I would highly recommend this security to anyone--apartment, condo, home, or mansion!

Reviews.Title: Love the System
Reviews.Author: Gary M. Simmons
Reviews.Content: I ordered the system and expected to have issues when installing but to my pleasant surprise, the installation was very easy.  Love the simple way to leave the house and also the at home activation feature.

Reviews.Title: Easy install. Great customer service
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research this system is by far the best. It came in the mail with a step by step video for installation which only took 15 minutes to install. The greatest part is there is no contracts and I can take the alarm if I decide to move.

Reviews.Title: Super easy install, shipped quickly
Reviews.Author: Grumpy "Grumpy"
Reviews.Content: Instructions for this system are very easy to read and follow.  Majority of the way I wanted things setup were available on the screen.  I love that it will notify me when the system is disarmed.  I can see using other features of this when I have kids who should stay out of certain areas!

Reviews.Title: Great product at an excellent price.
Reviews.Author: Captainbob
Reviews.Content: I have had an alarm system in my Condo by ADT for years. The alarm used the phone line to connect to the monitoring station, and it is so easy for the thieves today, to cut or disconnect the phone line outside your home, before they break in. What caught my eye about the Simplisafe system, is that it used a wireless connection via cellphone network, so it was impossible for a thief to disarm it. THe other issue, is that this system is installed by the customer, easily and quickly. No drilling holes in walls, waiting for a day for a technician to show up to install, change or add on to your system, you do it yourself.It comes preprogrammed, installs easily, and you're good to go.  In the several tests I did on the system, the monitoring station called me on my phone, in 30 seconds or less, each time I tripped the alarm.  I called their tech support line a couple of times with some questions I had, and each time, got friendly and knowledgeable customer technical support. And the topper, is no contract to sign. The monitoring I chose includes an app for my Smartphone, so I can even monitor the system from work, and turn the alarm on and off from my phone if I want.  I am delighted with this system.

Reviews.Title: Great alarm so easy to install
Reviews.Author: mike arnett
Reviews.Content: Alarm took me literally 15 minutes to set up and have it running.  I have the $25 a month service plan and its great. iPhone app shows alarm status and you can arm and disarm right from the app. Like it a lot and if I can say one bad thing it would be that the external siren is a bit expensive and should be included in the package.

Reviews.Title: Tim Lewis
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: First, you were recommended by my best friend for 63 years so that was a good start.  I have received all of my security items and have found them to be sturdy, reliable, and perhaps most important, easy to install.  I had one glitch with my order that was taken care of the same day by a very nice young lady in customer service.  Online ordering of my system from a good choice of products was very easy.  I could track shipment via email that was sent to me and the package arrived in good shape on time.  Not a single item was damaged.  Instructions to set up system are outstandingly easy.  I have already recommended it to several of my other friends.

Reviews.Title: New user
Reviews.Author: Tucky
Reviews.Content: Simplisafe was so easy to install and use. Very impressed- now sleeping better at night knowing we have a alarm -

Reviews.Title: Easy as pie
Reviews.Author: ipikman
Reviews.Content: Ordered from website..very easy to install.Customer support was quick and correct.Each component was self identifying and took about 3 minutes per device.1 hour and I was up and online.The central alarm system has been right on the spot ..operators are knowledgable and prompt.

Reviews.Title: Easy Protection
Reviews.Author: ajnewengland
Reviews.Content: We purchased this system after much research and I must say it seems to be the perfect solution for anyone in need of an alarm system.  We bought this 2 days before we left on a week long vacation and had it completely set up in 45 minutes.  The directions are clear and the installation could not have been easier.I liked the way you could reasonably purchase additional components, as your circumstances require, and we even had enough door sensors to arm the garage man door.  I had to call customer service to activate the system prior to the usual test period.  They were very helpful and professional and we were up and running live in no time.We did have one false alarm during the first couple of days where the police were called but if we had paid more attention to the advice of turning the motion sensors upside down (or had more time to test) to avoid the cats from setting it off, we would have been fine.  I was able to rectify the problem by going on line and changing the setting on that one motion sensor to "secret alert only" from my hotel room 3,000 miles away - problem fixed.The key chain remote is awesome but the keypad is a breeze to use too.  My sister, who had never dealt with a home alarm, was able to arm/ disarm with ease without ever laying eyes on it beforehand.I did get 2 quotes from "regular" alarm companies, but I don't think they can even compete with this system.  You never own their equipment and the shortest contract I found was 3 years and twice the price for monitoring - forget it!!Thank you for a great product.  I give this system a AAA+ rating.

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe
Reviews.Author: Robert K Reitzel
Reviews.Content: Found the system to be all that it claimed  to be. Easy to install, reasonable price, helpful, and more importantly, an easy to contact staff. Have recommended product to family and friends.  Money well spent.  Highly recommend this system.

Reviews.Title: Simpli Easy
Reviews.Author: S. Schwalbach
Reviews.Content: Just purchased the Simpli Safe home protection system.  It was very easy to install and the on line and also the direct phone support has been terrific.  I would recommend it to anyone interested in home alarm systems and the low cost is a plus.

Reviews.Title: So easy, so SIMPLE
Reviews.Author: rsaxon
Reviews.Content: After two incidents of attempted break-ins in the neighborhood in less than a week, I decided it was time for an alarm system.  I had heard of SimpliSafe and the price was right so I ordered it.  In one hour, I had the equipment installed.  In another 30 minutes, I had it up and running!  Never have I had something go together so well.  I did have a problem with sensor error that turned out to be an extra sensor that I did not install.  The system was looking for it and couldn't find it.  Once I "removed" it from the system, all was fine.  Tech support was very helpful.  I am sold on this system and look forward to a long, safe relationship.

Reviews.Title: Excellent alarm system for the price!
Reviews.Author: Paul S. Shannon
Reviews.Content: I've been very happy with SimpliSafe and just purchased a second one for a new apartment (the first went with the sale of the old).  Excellent product!

Reviews.Title: Fairly Simple to Install, Very easy to operate and at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Nabia
Reviews.Content: This system is pretty much as described.  I am very technical but I thought it was simple enough to install.  I only wish it came with a "breaking" glass sensor with it.  I used the entry sensor in combination with a motion sensor in case a burglar doesn't slide open the window but breaks the glass instead (good advice from another reviewer).  The alerts in email and texts along with the extra pins and "name that sensor or device" features are worth the upgrade to $24.99 per month in my opinion.  All of my employees think it's easy to operate as well.  The design is sleek, no one can pick out the base station.  I noticed when you don't install a sensor the system can still give you errors on it.  So be sure to remove any not in use if you're getting alerts on them.  I would recommend this to anyone for their home or business.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe absolutely ROCKS
Reviews.Author: paula bodie
Reviews.Content: SimpliSafe is without question the best value out there for home security.  SimpliSafe also offers extreme flexibility for those who may not want system monitoring initially, but would rather have the option of adding monitoring at a later time.  Self-installation was very easy, and the day-to-day use of the system is a breeze.

Reviews.Title: SUPER EASY TO DO
Reviews.Author: nellenot "nellenot"
Reviews.Content: I just set my system up and i couldn't believe how easy it was. i followed the directions that came with the system. when i was done i activated my account online, sent a test signal and voila! i'm done! i had a couple of questions about enabling and disabling the system so i called the call center and they answered everything for me and were able to check if my system was correctly set up and it was! then i got to play with it, i spent a good half hour playing around getting used to it - you can set the alarm off as much as you want for the first 72 hours - then you are set up with emergency contact. a few tips, i have a cocker spaniel, well under 30lbs but he set off the sensor, so i turned it upside down, set it about 5 feet up from the floor and he didn't set it off anymore. another tip would be to use the screws to attach the keypad, it is fairly heavy and fell off the wall with the adhesive strips, but no big deal, screws are included, so i secured it and it is fine now. i also secured all of the entry sensors w/just one screw but i thought it might be worth it, i'm not sure how long the strips would last. i am so excited about this system i just can't believe how easy and affordable it is. i love the fact that you can add extras as you need them, and if you can't afford the monitoring you can cancel it at any time and restart again as well with no questions asked. you can also take it with you when you move. my neighbor hired a company to install hers and i found out she paid a lot more money and didn't get half the stuff i got. this is the best money i spent in a long time, thank you simplisafe!

Reviews.Title: Shut up and take my money!
Reviews.Author: Zach Butler
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD------------------------------------+ Does not rely on public utilities (except T-mobile)+ Costs less to purchase equipment outright than some other companies' installation fees+ $25/mo monitoring (we wanted to be able to control it with our androids)+ For me, this package came with the perfect amount of sensors, and no other BS. With other companies, if I wanted four sensors I had to purchase their higher tier package which came with a bunch of other crap I didn't really need, like home automation.+ You can purchase and add sensors individually. This is one of the biggest benefits for me. I move a lot, and my next apartment may need a few more entry sensors. It's nice that I can just go online and buy more if I need them. It's also perfect for people on a limited budget who want to accumulate equipment over time.+ You can take it with you. I move every 3 months for school, and all I have to do is peel my equipment off the wall, stick it up in the new place, and notify them of the address change.+ The equipment doesn't feel like cheap plastic crap+ Everything stuck to the wall securely on the first try for me. No sensors have fallen down, and the keypad (the only item I mess with on a regular basis) feels secure and doesn't move when I touch it. I forgot to clean the wall before I put the keypad up, but I used a lysol wipe for all the other sensors.+ They usually call me within 45 seconds of the alarm being triggered.+ My fab works in my house, in my yard, and even from my parking lot.THE BAD-------------------------------------- The siren is in the base station, not the keypad. From reading their site, I was under the impression that the siren was in the keypad because some intruders will try to smash the keypad on traditional systems before it can call the police. The idea being that with simplisafe, the keypad goes off, they smash it, and the base station silently calls the police in the background anyways. It does, but not silently. Additionally, the keypad is usually by the door, so that is where you would want a siren.- The siren in the base station isn't loud enough. You can definitely hear it throughout my whole apartment, but I would doubt if my neighbors or anyone outside can hear it. If you have a house, your neighbors will never hear it. For that reason, a 105dB siren seems necessary. I'll be buying one shortly and putting it near the door.- The only way to set the system to 'home' when you're leaving is to open the door, set it to home, and then leave. Not a big deal, but it makes it more difficult when you're leaving but someone else is still home. The 'away' mode does give you sufficient time to leave. I usually just use the app in this case.- The android app is a little buggy yet. It works fine, just not perfectly.- The base station has a redundant connection in case cell service is out, but it's an RJ-11 phone line, not an RJ-45 network cable. I read another review on here where someone was excited because they could plug it into their router for a backup connection. When I unboxed it, I saw the backup connection is phone line only. This was probably the most disappointing con for me, as I only know three people with a landline, and only one person without an internet connection. Internet is ubiquitous, phone service is not. Please fix this simplisafe!!OVERALL-------------------------------------I highly recommend this system. It's affordable, modern, easy to use, easy to setup, modular, and portable. The pros far outweigh the cons, and this system will be far cheaper than an equivalent product from ADT or Comcast. GET IT- you'll be happy you did!

Reviews.Title: Sophisticated product with easy installation
Reviews.Author: Habitat Volunteer "Bill T"
Reviews.Content: I bought extra sensors, so my installation took more than an hour to complete. The T-Mobile signal did not work well in my area, but SimpliSafe technical support quickly sent an alternate component which works very well. Great support team. The installed system works just as advertised and I feel very secure with this system, whether I am away, or at home. The freeze alerts and water leak sensors are bonus features that most security systems do not provide.I purchased the highest level of monitoring from SimpliSafe and their fee was half the cost of other systems - PLUS, I get freeze and water leak sensors that other systems do not routinely provide. I feel comfortably secure against burglary, fire, freeze conditions, and water pipe leaks. As an added bonus, my home insurance discount is so high that my actual yearly cost for 24/7 monitoring is only $13 per year. All-in-all, a great product at a great price. The monitoring feedback is customizable so that you can choose to receive alarms, sensor alerts, and/or activity notifications by e-mail or text messages to your phone.

Reviews.Title: Not what was expected
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, it didn't work.  It would never connect via the cellular connection so my house/monitoring never worked, despite having paid for it.  Support was decent, responded quickly, however their best ideas were to turn it off, take out the batteries, put them back in, turn it on and put it closer to a window.  Also, two entry sensors would stay in an error state constantly, causing the unit to flash bright blue all the time.  Ended up sending it back as I didn't feel it was worth it.  Parts felt cheap and they're not UL listed (for what that's worth).  Sent it back for a refund.  YMMV.

Reviews.Title: Peace of mind for less than you'd think
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I purchased the base-model SimpliSafe system for my one-bedroom apartment a few weeks ago. I wanted a system that would give me a little extra security while I am at work and at night. I read the reviews and was fairly confident I was getting a good value for my money. The system arrived about five days after I placed my order. I knew it was supposed to be simple to install, but I had no idea how easy it would be. I rate the difficulty level at about that of assembling a Lack table from Ikea (i.e. you do not need to be particularly handy, nor do you need any tools if you use the included Command strips). I had everything up and running in about 15 minutes. I've had a professional wireless system in the past and actually think this one is better quality. You can't beat $15 a month for monitoring - the other companies charge twice that - and I love that I can purchase additional sensors as-needed. I strongly recommend this product to anyone needing an alarm.

Reviews.Title: SimpliGREAT!
Reviews.Author: gd9704
Reviews.Content: Simplisafe is a great security system.  YOU determine how many sensors you need for your home (not a commissioned salesperson,) YOU determine what sort of monitoring you want (or no monitoring at all if you wish,) and YOU can install it-easily!  Oh, and if you move, YOU can take it with you to your new home.  EASILY!!!Best of all, the price is fair, and it works great!My home is a 1,800 sq. ft. split-level.  I ended up choosing the deluxe system (which comes with a 105dB alarm, flood sensor, freeze sensor and panic alarm), added an additional entry sensor, an additional remote, and three smoke alarms. With the additional equipment, my security system is now also a FIRE alarm, FLOOD alarm, and a FREEZE alarm.  I used to worry about having a sump-pump failure when I wasn't home.  Not anymore.Installation couldn't be easier.  The sensors come shipped with quality 3M adhesive strips that securely attach each piece of equipment to your home.  They are easily removed if needed.  Simplisafe ships extras with your system in case you decide later to move something.  You also have the option of attaching equipment with small screws if you prefer.  All equipment comes with screws should you prefer that route.The base station is the brains of the operation.  It communicates with your keypad and sensors wirelessly.  It communicates with Simplisafe's monitoring via cellular connection.THIS was the only hiccup of my installation.Simplisafe systems are shipped with T-Mobile cellular modules installed in their base stations.  Apparently, where I live, T-Mobile's signal wasn't strong enough to send & receive data.  A few calls to Simplisafe's tech support (which was very good, wait time less than 5 minutes each call, U.S.-based call personnel) ruled out any equipment problems.  The tech sent out a Verizon module.  Within a few days, it arrived at my door (no charge.)  A few minutes later, my system was online and working perfectly!I opted for the 24/7 interactive monitoring.  This gives you the ability to fine-tune your system via Simplisafe's website--entry delays, keypad/voice volume levels, even specific entry sensors can set to custom specifications.  Some entry sensors you may want to trigger an alarm instantly.  You can do that.  Some entry sensors you may not want an alarm at all.  You can do that.  You can even set an entry sensor to alert you secretly via text or e-mail that it has been tripped.  (Liquor cabinet, anyone?)24/7 also gives you the ability to control your system via smart phone.  The freeze sensor will tell you what the current temperature in your home is through your phone.  You can be sent alerts of the system being armed/disarmed.All in all, I'm very happy with this system.  My only complaint would be that the entry sensors are a bit bulkier than wired versions you'll see with typical systems.  The benefits of Simplisafe definitely overcome this minor shortcoming, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe for a town house
Reviews.Author: Richard S. Valko
Reviews.Content: Easy setup with batteries included. The adhesive on the sensor is strong but able to come off without damage if need. The only con I have is the voice and chime could be a bit louder, but it is still loud enough. In the end it gives me a little peace of mind when leaving my home.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SUPPORT!
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: In attempting to install my system this weekend, I ran into a Keypad communication issue.  I called this morning, (Monday, August 5, 2013) and after a brief time on hold, was connected to "Frances".  After asking me a few questions about what I had encountered and done, she had me open the base station and give her the numeric details of , the internal SIM card.  To wit, she discovered that my system needed further setup.  Frances continued instructing me, step by step, until all of the issues were resolved and my keypad was successfully communicating with my base station.It was truly enjoyable working with such an alert, intelligent (and patient) customer service person!  She even called me back when my cell phone dropped our call in the middle of everything!Thank You, Frances and SimpliSafe!

Reviews.Title: DIY Friendly, No Contract, Simple but Effective
Reviews.Author: C Cookston
Reviews.Content: In short:Pros:-Monitoring Services Available but not required-System Can Work without Monitoring as Stand Alone (like a car alarm)-No Monitoring/Service Contract-Several Economical Options for Monitoring Services-Wireless, Nearly Effortless DIY Set Up-Screw Less, 3M Command Strip Mounting-You Own the Equipment-Great Customer ServiceCons:-Since you own the equipment, there is a not-insignificant upfront cost to purchase it-No integrated video surveillance (yet)-Apps for Android and Apple are glitchy-No home automation capability (i.e. control thermostat, lights, etc.)I really didn't want to be stuck with a monitoring/service contract for a home security system, so I had settled on purchasing and installing a system myself and skipping the monitoring service by just using a system stand alone (like a car alarm basically.)  The trouble I was running into was that most if not all security systems that are sophisticated enough to offer a single point of control (keypad) for many different types of sensors (entry, motion, glass break, etc.) are made purposefully difficult to program as to scare off DIYers like myself from attempting the job and keep the licensed installers in business.  Then I heard about SimpliSafe on the Glenn Beck Radio program and then later the same day on The Dave Ramsey Radio program and looked it up.  SimpliSafe offers a wide assortment of wireless sensors, a single point of control and no contract is required.  They pre-program the system for you prior to shipment so all you have to do is activate the batteries on each sensor and place.  They even include 3M Command strips so you can easily remove/relocate sensors without damaging your walls.There are three monitoring plans with no contract required, starting at $15/month for basic monitoring up to $25/month for full remote control via mobile devices (costs as of the time of this writing.)  I really like that there is no contract.  I can downgrade/cancel my monitoring at any time and the system will still work stand alone (like a car alarm for your house.)  I doubt I ever will because the rates are very affordable and I like knowing the police (fire department in the case of the smoke alarm) will show up if needed, but I find comfort in knowing I have the option and am not stuck.  With some other alarm companies, they retain ownership of the equipment so if you stop monitoring services they will come by to collect their equipment even after the term of the contract is up.I was always weary of "free equipment, free install, one day and one day only" so called deals for greasy door to door salesman, because I know there is no such thing as free lunch.  They make their money back on monthly fees over the 2 year contracts that they lock you into.  I also don't like having to schedule a time to be home to meet the installer, let alone having a stranger in my house at all.  I just find it very convenient to be able to do it myself and if I have any problems, be able to just email or if I prefer, call an english speaking customer service agent.SimpliSafe, with no contract, easy set up and a complete system was the perfect solution for me.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Security System
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: The SimpliSafe Security System has met all of my expectations and then some.  Not only was it very easy for me to install, but the customer service representative I talked with to set up the cell phone base station was exceptional !  (The reception was not good in my area so we experimented to find the best location for the base station.)  The system is easy to use and response times for alerts are very fast.  Probably the best feature of the system is the various options available for me in regard to monitoring.  I am going to purchase this system for my rental units and heartily recommend it to all !  Dick H.  Edgewood, MD

Reviews.Title: Reliable and value for money
Reviews.Author: Brahma
Reviews.Content: I did research various options online before deciding on simplisafe. They use 'different looking' sensors and control panel but are of decent quality. "No contract" was important for me. You can cancel monitoring anytime and still use it as an alarm. You can add sensors as you go.  Installation was easy. I get prompt text alerts whenever my alarm is armed/disarmed. The base alarm is only loud enough for people in the house. Strongly recommend extra wireless siren which is loud enough to alert neighbors or anyone outside.You do have to spend money upfront to buy the equipment but 60 days risk free trial, 3 yrs warranty and  the savings in monitoring cost compared to others made my decision easy.

Reviews.Title: Simplesafe is Simple and Safe...easiest installation I have ever tried
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: I bought the Simplesafe system with 5 motion sensors and 14 entry sensors.  It was TOO TOO easy to install and set up.When I bought the system I did not know that I would get a text message AND an email for any and every event that happens to my system. It is an amazing system.I also get a text message and email when the electricity is interrupted.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: Simplisafe has been nothing but good to me. As a new home owner with a growing family, the idea if having a security system to protect my family and belongings was a most, but I was not crazy about signing a 2 yr contract at $70 bucks a month. Then I found simplisafe... No contracts, reasonable start up cost and low monthly service fee. Not to include exceptional customer service. I have had very few problems with my system over the 6 months I have had it, majority of them were user error and the others were easily fixed by talking to customer service. The one thing that really stood out was when I ordered the new smoke detector and simplisafe contacted me letting me know there we a problem with the unit. It stood out because usually the customer would be the calling complaint but simplisafe beat me to it and replace it free of charge.Great system, and I will continue to suggest it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Buckland "RCBUCK"
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably easy to install. Worked right out of the box five months ago and I have had no problems with it at all. My twenty pound dog is yet to set off a motion detector. Service was polite and efficient. I would recommend the system to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: Felica
Reviews.Content: We are so happy with our Simplisafe system! It was extremely easy to install and works perfectly! They also have awesome customer service! SO happy we went with Simplisafe and not ADT!

Reviews.Title: Works great! Great value!
Reviews.Author: greatdane
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my simplisafe purchase. Six months ago, I purchased and installed my system that included the base station, a keypad, 2 door sensors and 2 motion sensors. So far so great! The install was easy and the setup was easier. I do have a couple of gripes about the install. My first gripe is that the screws for the sensor mounts are tiny so I supplemented them with some longer more effective screws from Home Depot. This was not a cost issue but a convenience issue. My second gripe is that the motion sensors have a fixed position mount. So, to allow for a high downward looking mount, I constructed/painted some wood shims to put under the motion sensors. Once installed, I could not be happier with the system and service. Works great! Great value! SimpliSafe has a great product but as with most things there remains room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: An alarm system anybody can install!
Reviews.Author: Barry L. Sprajc
Reviews.Content: Piece of cake!  I just installed my wireless ALARM system, ANYBODY CAN DO IT! After our neighbor had an attempted break-in last week thwarted by his ATD alarm system, I called them to ask about their $99 special. Some special. They quoted my $850 + $47/month locked into a 3 year contract for insufficient security coverage. I paid $497 + $14.95/month (for optional monitoring) with no contract! Uses the cell network so a thief cutting the phone line does not render the system useless. Packages start at $225 and you can add whatever sensors you need. I can ARM and DISARM it with a key-fob just like your car. I highly recommend it to anyone needing home security.Note: Had a minor issue with the keypad saying it was not in range. The fix for me was to remove the batteries from the base station, insert the usb key, and then put the batteries back in. And the problem was solved.

Reviews.Title: Bought Basic
Reviews.Author: Bill Steele "Bill Steele"
Reviews.Content: The motion sensor reaches as described, about 30 feet.We have two cats and they have not triggered anything at all.I have an office in my garage and the door sensor can be readall the way through a one hour fire wall, plus a bathroom plusa doorway.Very simple, inexpensive, and EFFICIENT!I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Perfect DIY system
Reviews.Author: Carter Daniels
Reviews.Content: Owned the Simplisafe 2 now for almost a year. Extremely easy install. No contracts.  Peace of mind without breaking the bank. I like the fact that I was able to start small and can add on as I see fit. When setting it up I did have a question about the "test" time for the system. The tech support group at Simplisafe is top notch.I would warn to make sure you are within T-Mobiles coverage area because the system does use this to communicate. [...]

Reviews.Title: Simpli Safe is FANTASTIC!! LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Jewel "curlytailpugrescue.org"
Reviews.Content: We purchased Simpli Safe after the copper piping was stolen from the basement at a home we have that is presently unoccupied (waiting to sell). After researching a few companies we opted to give simpli safe a try and we LOVE IT! SOOO easy to use and install, and it gives us piece of mind to know the house is now protected.  LOVE the text messages we get when someone enters it.  This means we know when the realtor shows it, how long they stayed, etc., I have had one false alarm (during a severe lightning storm) and I got a call within seconds to let me know it was armed.  Same thing when the realtor mis-entered the code. Immediately, I got a call and a text. The low monthly monitoring cost and no-contract also attracted us! We have suggested it to many people!! Additionally, they are VERY responsive and quick to questions on facebook and are always looking to improve their system.  We are sooo very satisfied and I would never recommend something to someone that I did not use myself and was not truly satisfied with.  The sense of security is just wonderful and no longer do we worry about if someone is breaking into the house, and yet, if they do, we know the police will be notified within minutes.  We also love the lawn signs, which act as a deterrent.  Just a fantastic system, great price, and moreover, total piece of mind with great customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: Okay as long as you don't have issues after hours
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned the biggest pro to the system is the relatively inexpensive and contract - free monitoring service offered with it, but the equipment is expensive. Being a bit anal I did a cost - benefit analysis and found that the overall cost of this system is actually more expensive than competitors, if using the monitoring service for 2 years. Most of their competitors make their money via monthly monitoring charges like cable companies and so similarly they typically lease the equipment at a discount. So although Simplisafe's monitoring is slightly cheaper (if using the top tier plan that offers app access) than some other companies, you really aren't saving much long term because the bulk of the cost is up front. My biggest complaint so far is that, yes the customer service is great, but during business hours. A couple of nights ago we received an alert that dispatch wasn't receiving a signal so we went to the website to troubleshoot and none of their suggestions worked, so every 15 minutes or so we received a loud message from the base starting at about 1 am. Needless to say that was the moment when do it yourself became less of a great idea. I definitely miss the 24 hour technical support of the company I used previously. After losing several hours of sleep we were finally able to get in touch with support for assistance, but keep in mind that you are often on your own with this system - at least after 6 pm eastern.

Reviews.Title: Can't be beat
Reviews.Author: lovethissystem
Reviews.Content: Hands down the greatest system for your home.  I installed it in about 25 minutes.  I put an entry sensor on 3 entry doors, 2 shed doors, and a motion sensor in each room of the house.  Not even the guy from Ocean's 13 break dancing can get through my house.  The upside down trick on the motion sensor is true.  I have a 70 lb huskie and he does not trip the motion sensors.  It's been about 3 months since I installed the system and the tape is still holding very strong.  That's the only thing I worry about - a sensor falling because of the tape and tripping the system.Definitely pay attention to the part in the book about keeping lights - especially lamps - away from motion sensors.  I left a lamp on by accident and it set off the motion sensor.People on the phones are great too and if you e-mail them they answer in a few hours.  Customer service can't be beat.Adding components and removing them is a breeze too if you're in the middle of painting walls or trimming doors like I was.  So don't wait to set it up because of that.  You can unhook the sensor and remove it for however long you need.  My next component to add will be a smoke detector which is part of the $15 monitoring service.All in all, this can't be beat.  The big contract companies will be out of business in no time.
