Reviews.Title: Very pleased with the sytem and the service , BUT...................
Reviews.Author: Mark W. King
Reviews.Content: The keychain remote is a piece of crap. I have had mine for less than 3 months and the end cap that covers the USB connecteris gone, and now the battery compartment cover has vanished to who knows where.Simply put, the thing falls apart. Replacement cap for the USB is available at 5 bucks a pop(for a tiny plastic cap). Very disappointed with the remote.

Reviews.Title: I have installed security systems on weekends for many years and this is the best for the money
Reviews.Author: Bob Dillard
Reviews.Content: A system anyone can install, monitoring is easy to set up, no contract, you pay for your equipment that costs one third or less of what the big boys charge and you can use your system with or without monitoring, should you choose monitoring you're not locked into a contract, just cancel anytime. It states the motion detectors will not pick up a pet under 30 pounds, however I have a dog that likes to lay on the back of the couch, she weighs 15 pounds and tripped the alarm, granted she was directly in front of the motion detector. In checking video the police arrived on scene within 2 minutes so very good response time by both monitoring station and police. Moved motion detector and corrected problem. I HIGHLY recommend this system.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad system
Reviews.Author: K. Ali
Reviews.Content: Equipment slightly cheap construction, especially the key pad. Not illuminated so hard to key in code in the dark!?The door sensors are huge and looks ugly on my wooden front door. Not happy with that.Like the wireless part.No extended hours for customer service and emergency dispatch have no clue.I've had it for 2 weeks so we shall see if it was worth switching from ADT

Reviews.Title: Completely satisfied & no contract
Reviews.Author: GolfKen
Reviews.Content: A simple wireless system that has no contract attached, low cost monitoring & text messaging when alarm is armed, disarmed or set off is available for $5/month. (Great way to know when your kids are coming & going if your out of town)Designed to avoid pets setting off system. Monitoring team very prompt and customer service very helpful. Why pay more for the same or less.

Reviews.Title: Cellular home security system that works
Reviews.Author: patrick g collins
Reviews.Content: I have a three family house that is unoccupied and being renovated.  At the start of the project there were numerous break-ins and material theft.  I have had no problems since I installed this system.  Every status change to the system is texted and emailed to me (alarm turned off by key pad, alarm turned off via internet, motion sensor activated, etc.) so no matter who is touching the system, I know it almost instantly (about a 15 second lag).  When a contractor shows up and I am not there, they call me and I disarm the system from my cell phone.  When they leave, they call me and I reset it.  If the system is tripped I get a call right away asking if police should be dispatched to the house.  I did have a faulty motion sensor that was giving annoying false alarms that caused me to rush to the house, meet the police, only to find no sign of break in.  The company mailed me a replacement device.  I don't think any of this type of alarm system is trouble free.  This one is very manageable.  The dashboard feature on their website is good and shows other capabilities I have not used (temperature indicator / freeze sensor, moisture sensor, smoke, etc.

Reviews.Title: Very good but one major problem
Reviews.Author: Molon Labe
Reviews.Content: No hyperbole in saying this is an industry changer.  For too long we've had no choice in alarm systems but to go with lengthy expensive contracts and wired systems that required an "alarm company" to install and maintain.  No more.  Simplisafe is a do-it-yourself system that literally can be set up in 30 minutes and offers MORE features than the others.  No contracts, and an intelligently thought out product.I'd be very satisfied except for their very weak link:  their monitoring.  Apparently they partner with local alarm monitoring centers (probably based on price) and some leave quite a bit to be desired.In the very first week I got a one ring hang-up on my primary phone number while I was out of the house and the system was armed.  No message was left.  I didn't recognize the phone number so I didn't think anything of it.  A few minutes later I got a call from a family member (on my call list) who said they got a message from an alarm company saying that there was an intrusion at my home and that the police were dispatched.  I then called the number that had called me earlier and found that it was the alarm company.  I asked why they only let it ring once before hanging up and they had no reasonable answer.I then called Simplisafe and thy apologized and said it was human error on the alarm company's part.  After I asked they said they'd be responsible if there were a fine assessed due to the false alarm.  They did the right thing but it doesn't inspire confidence in a critical link in the whole system.There is also other room for improvement.  A (red) flashing strobe option should be offered to visually identify the address that is having the alarm event to help first responders.  And their phone app (excellent product) only works if you go with their highest priced ($25/month) monitoring plan.  No reason I shouldn't be able to arm/disarm my system and get alerts as to what's going on with it without paying for central station monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Okay system if you can use it
Reviews.Author: D. Jones
Reviews.Content: I have to say, when I was considering a wireless home security system I purchased this one first.  Its hard not to with all of the advertisements on the internet, and endorsements from the whose who list of famous people.  I called and talked with the folks at simplisafe before my purchase and purchased the system on the guarantee of 60 days full money back return.  My experiences were less than satisfactory however, and quite disappointing.My problems began just 12 hours after installing the system.  I had purchased the interactive level of monitoring because it was important to me to be able to turn the system on and off from my cell phone if I had forgotten to do so before leaving home.  Twelve hours after installing, just the next morning, I started playing with the app and interactive services and the first time I used the app, I was told I had no connections to the server.  I kept playing with it, trying to get connectivity and in short, I was able to use these services only several times in a month trial.  Most times I could just not depend on it working period.  Now, do not get me wrong, it appeared that monitoring was working.....most times, however, in that month trial I did lose my link to dispatcher several times, so even that was troubling.I finally used the "placement feature" provided with the system to make sure the base station was sitting in the best spot and to my surprise, no where in my house was a "best spot".  The signal was intermittent at best and kept dropping out altogether.  Eventually I found a spot that seemed the strongest signal placement but in 36 hours my entire system was DEAD.  No link to dispatcher, no interactive services no nothing.  I called Simplesafe again and was told to take the base station outside.  Once there, I was told my system came online immediately, so inside my home was not getting a signal and outside was. A more troubling look into the company was the tech I spoke to.  He actually told me he did not know what else to do other other than somehow mounting the base station on the roof and affixing an umbrella over it. They ONLY USE T-Moble so I had no choice but to return the system for a refund, which they did with no pressure to keep it. They do stand by their money back guarantee.Buyer beware, Simplisafe ONLY uses T-Mobile so if you are not sure about the signal strength of that carrier where you are, you may have problems.  Also, the more searches I did on the internet I began to realize all reviews form dozens of websites all said the same thing and looked exactly alike, using the same words, pictures etc.  In other words, you really never learn anything new no matter which review site you go to, they are all just placements by the company and NOT actual reviews from individuals who have actually used the system....and they number into the dozens all looking the same, spewing off the information from the company's own website.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME alarm system... Except for ONE CRITICAL FLAW which MUST be fixed
Reviews.Author: Roman M
Reviews.Content: I have had a passion for alarm systems for well over 20 years. This is the 5th home alarm system that I have used so far. I had the first four systems for at least 3-7 years each so I am familiar with what's out there. I discovered SimpliSafe last year. It actually came with my new condo and I was blown away by its simplicity and I love the fact that it is all wireless. My condo came with SimpliSafe 1 and this week I upgraded to SimpliSafe 2. The main reason for my upgrade was because SimpliSafe 2 allows you to set your sensors to INSTANT ON. This is a critical function in any alarm system. The way I have it set up is:1. There is a door sensor at the front entrance. If someone opens the door, they have 20 seconds to type in the PIN before the full blown alarm goes off and the alarm company gets notified.2. If an intruder breaks in through the front door (which is the only way my condo can be accessed, as it is pretty high up) and starts walking through the living room towards the base, the motion sensor will detect him/her. Since my motion sensor is set to INSTANT ON, the full blow alarm SHOULD go off at this point. However, it doesn't because, in the words of a SimpliSafe's rep, "the system respects the entry delay period". That makes absolutely no sense and is a CRITICAL FLAW in the system. No other alarm system that I've ever used had this problem.When I spoke with a customer service rep about this today, he right away agreed with me that this is a flaw and couldn't think of a single reason why it would have been programmed this way. He told me that he would send a message to their engineers to see if they can fix this.I also contacted SimpliSafe via email and one of their customer service reps, Greeny, wrote back: "I am sorry if this does not fit your desires exactly, but this is how the system is programmed."When you set a motion detector to "Instant On" it should go off instantly, per its description, otherwise you are leaving the base vulnerable. If someone breaks into your place, you want to give the system every chance of contacting the monitoring company. Any additional delays is time that the intruder can use to destroy the base. If you have a "SimpliSafe" sticker or sign posted in front of your house, any thief who is familiar with this system will look for the base in order to destroy it. (There are multiple videos on YouTube that clearly indicate that the base is the brains of the system)In addition, the base itself is hard to hide as: 1) it is fairly large, 2) it needs to be close enough to the keypad, otherwise you'll get an "Base out of reach" error message, 3) SimpliSafe recommends to put it by a window in order to get a clear signal. What that means is that the base is fairly difficult to hide and, therefore, vulnerable.Every alarm system in the world has one, or more, weaknesses. In the case of SimpliSafe, its weakness is the base. The base must be protected in order for this to work. Having a motion sensor pointed in the room where the base is located is the way to go, but it only works if INSTANT ON actually works the way it was designed.We need to pressure SimpliSafe to fix this via a firmware update. Once they do, I will update my review to 5 stars.Finally, it would be nice if customer service was available a little more than simply during EST business hours. Hopefully, as the company continues to grow they will hire more staff and increase their hours. For now, my main concern is to fix the INSTANT ON flaw.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service not helpful, system breaks frequently
Reviews.Author: Sonic
Reviews.Content: I've had Simplisafe for years.  Unfortunately, I am considering going back to ADT - something I never thought I'd consider - because the Simplisafe system is, simply, not reliable.  The components break frequently.  Calling customer service for troubleshooting help is impossible if you live on the West Coast.  They may be cheaper than other alarm companies, but folks, there's a reason for this.  If you have valuables to protect and people you want to keep safe, this is probably not the system for you if you're looking for consistency.

Reviews.Title: not to happy
Reviews.Author: tjking
Reviews.Content: bought 6 extra entry sensors, one extra key remote, one extra motion sensorone extra panic button, three entry sensor adhesive strips where dried out and will not stick they keep falling off and set off the alarm. one key remote has dead battery and one panic button will not work sets error message, says to place closer to base or replace battery neither of these solutions worked, spent 17.50 on replacement batterys. so far not to happy

Reviews.Title: MUCH Room for improvement.
Reviews.Author: Charis A.
Reviews.Content: I bought my system a while ago, and I'm just OK with it; It's better than nothing.Systems from other major brands offer system controls using your cell phone, and more than just motion and entry sensor alarms.While the SimpliSafe system is wireless, it hasn't reached that level yet. Upgrades are very slow, and there may be problems with sensor range and cell signal strength.So if you're looking for a basic, reasonably priced wireless system that you own (not rent), this may be a solution for you.---------------------------------------------Update: "New" product releases are way too slow, and by that time there isn't a new design or anything special about it, just bland and late. Other companies and some self-kits on Amazon offer newer features and sensors than SimpliSafe and have for years. So, because of the release timeline and features, I wouldn't recommend even a basic system to a friend .

Reviews.Title: Simpli Safe Home Alarm
Reviews.Author: Keith C. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Installation was easy. Some windows and doors in our home needed slightly different mounting due to size and depth of the trim. I like the text and email updates of the system status. I don't like the monitoring options. I bought this system based on the advertising of not being locked into a system and no hidden charges. However to get the full potential and options of the alarm you must pay the $24.99 per month fee. I paid almost $500 for a system that I own but I don't have access to all the features unless I pay them more money per month. For instance zone naming is not available unless you pay the extra fee. Really? What good is an alarm if you can't name the zones? How do you know which sensor is closed/open/tripped/malfunctioning? Even with the zone naming the keypad doesn't tell you which zone is open/tripped, you have to log into the main webpage to check which sensor is tripped. I have a real problem with paying full price for a system yet having features of my equipment not accessible to me (the owner) without paying extra fees. Especially bad when the company advertises no hidden fees and no games or sales tricks.

Reviews.Title: Yes - Professional Grade
Reviews.Author: T. Fleming "DIYalarms"
Reviews.Content: I've been in the home security business selling Ademco equipment for over 15 years now.  When my middle son moved to an apartment for college however, what did I buy?  SimpliSafe! This was the best option for professional grade equipment, and I get Ademco gear wholesale!  I have a full review of my experience at diyalarms.net if interested in knowing what should be considered before making the investment in a great home security system.

Reviews.Title: A MAJOR FLAW !!!
Reviews.Author: Santon H. Craig
Reviews.Content: I'm writing about the Simplisafe home system that I bought directly from the company.The problem I've encountered in the system is if a door or window is left open as you exit the house, and use i.e. the key fob OR the software app on your smart phone, there is no notification to you that there is a door or window open, letting you drive off in a state of bliss, unaware of a serious problem !!!!!!!I contacted the company and the representative indicated they know about the problem, but don't have a fix yet. Until a fix is available, consumers need to be alert to of this shortcoming.

Reviews.Title: You need more people in customer service!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: No one every picks up when you call customer service, you have to leave a message which caused me to make more trips to my dad's house.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: harvinder gujral
Reviews.Content: I bought the system for my rental single family homes.I have tried to set up the system.Had porblems.Tried calling customer service.After  holding for 15 minutes,left a message.But no response.They need to improve the customer service IF THEY WANT TO SELL.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: NickInSC
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Economy Package and added a few additional motion sensors.I live in a rural area where T-Mobile service is spotty at best so when I placed my order I specified the Verizon GSM option. Although I have Verizon mobile service, there are areas in my house where reception is very poor. One of the reasons that I chose SimpliSafe is because of the 60 day trial period. If the GSM connection didn't perform, I intended to return the system. I've had the system just under a month with no GSM issues.As almost everyone has stated, the setup / installation was quite easy and straightforward. As I wasn't sure about the GSM connection, I elected to install all the sensors with the adhesive tape on the back of the devices rather than the screws.My first complaint is trivial but one of those annoying items that could easily be remedied. The suggested and logical location for the motion sensors is in the corner. In fact the motion sensor housing is molded so that it can attach to the two walls. It can also be attached to a single wall using the flat surface on the back. The adhesive tape on the back of the motion sensor is positioned on this flat surface in the center, There is no adhesive tape on the molded areas that attach to the two walls when positioned in the corner. So the first thing I found myself doing was using the extra adhesive tape on the first couple of motion sensors and then  running down to the hardware store to purchase some double-sided adhesive to complete the installation of the remaining motion sensors.I was a bit worried about using just the adhesive to attach the sensors but didn't want screw holes in the walls and trim in case I ended up returning the system. Sure enough, one of the sensors fell off the wall and triggered an alarm while I was away. The dispatch service was unable to contact me so police where dispatched on a false alarm. The alarm that fell was the transmitter module of an entry alarm. The alarm was positioned about 6 feet above ground in a shed across the driveway. The good news is that the module still works. I re-attached it with the screws. When I tried to remove the corresponding magnetic module of the entry alarm I could not peel it from the door trim. I ended up removing the cover and screwing it in through the adhesive. Maybe it was a bad bit of adhesive or maybe it was because the shed is quite a bit colder and the adhesive didn't take as well. All the other components are firmly attached with adhesive only, but I will be adding screws as I've decided to keep the system.The component in the shed is the furthest from the base control and I am impressed that it is within range.I added the key chain remote to my key ring which I keep in my front pocket. While I was carrying some boxes into the garage, I must have pressed against a box, with the remote, because the alarm was enabled. The siren went off and I disabled the alarm at the keypad. This happened during the '3 day'learning period' so there was no dispatch. As a result, I've disabled the Panic Button on the remote. Also, I learned that the alarm siren is not very loud. It might be okay in an apartment building, but I live in a single family house and I doubt any of my neighbors would take notice. I will be adding the external siren component in the near future.I gave the system 4 stars rather than 5 because I don't like the fact that an alert is transmitted after the entry delay expires. Given that there are decals on the windows and a sign on the front lawn, it doesn't take much on-line research to determine what the base unit looks like and the shortcomings. If the software triggered an alert immediately and then cancelled the alert if the system was disarmed during the entry delay, I would have given the product 5 stars. The entry delay is however configurable and can be set at zero seconds which results in an immediate alert. I've set the entry delay on my system to 15 seconds which gives me time to fumble once and still disarm the alarm.Thus far the cat has not caused any of the 5 motion sensors in my configuration to trigger.Unless you have a real good memory or subscribe to the enhanced monitoring, I suggest you carry a small cheat sheet in your wallet with the component serial numbers. If a component does raise an alert, the only way to determine which component raised the alert is from the serial number. If you subscribe to the enhanced monitoring, the software allows you to 'name' each component.I would recommend this product to a friend or family.

Reviews.Title: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR.  BEWARE.
Reviews.Author: Lost in LA "Lost"
Reviews.Content: The system seemed to be the perfect security system after I researched it thoroughly.  After I set it up I learned the truth.  Immediately the keypad gave an error that it was out of range from the sensors (the door and window sensors are only three feet away and the master control is less than 10 feet away.  They advertise that it works way over 100 feet away!  Then when I called for help I got a RECORDING stating they were closed.  They are only open normal business hours and are closed on weekends!  I can't have a security system that only has support during business hours and no weekends!  It's also not working, and I can see it's very easy to trip and have false alarm after false alarm -- which means major fines from law enforcement.I'm packing this up and shipping it all back immediately.

Reviews.Title: DIYers rejoice, finally there is a middle class home alarm system that is actually pretty good.
Reviews.Author: KevT
Reviews.Content: Well, if you want to self install without dealing with wires and hard to understand instructions this kit is it.  I like the fact it offers pretty much everything you need in a simple keypad and not some over complicated ones.  Plus, it is expandable easily.In case of real emergency do people really know how to silently send an alarm for most keypads by the popular companies?One thing to know is that if you want remote monitoring by the company, you pay this low monthly fee however the hidden cost maybe $100-200 depending on your local county.  You need to file for your own home alarm system permit because it's a self-installed kit in order for monitoring to be established.

Reviews.Title: A good alarm compared to others
Reviews.Author: cat49
Reviews.Content: Pros: We decided to purchase SimpliSafe because no wires can be cut from the outside of the house (it is not connected to phone or electric) and the alarm will still work if the keypad is smashed, and there is no contract with the company. It has worked well since we bought it and we feel better living in a city with the alarm system. The system is modular to the user's needs.Cons: That being said, the monthly cost is certainly not low. You need to pay the highest price to use the mobile app and label the sensors ($25 per month.) You also will need to separately purchase more window/door sensors to secure your home. We found that our cat was setting off the motion detector even though he is 11 lbs.In general, alarm systems can be a huge rip off and I feel happy knowing we went with a better company. We researched many alarm companies and feel good about our decision.

Reviews.Title: great support, inferior product
Reviews.Author: Harvey Pashibin
Reviews.Content: I rated OK because the folks on tech side....those guys/gals that you call when issues arrive....were very supportive.  However, the product itself proved to be substandard.I purchased a different system....(GE product)... from a different vendor....the monitoring fees/month are higher....but I have more sensors...and no problem whatsoever with operation.I surmise the Simplisafe sensors/system is technically inferior to the GE system...and hence the problems.  Wish the Simplisafe site would address metal door/window frames beforehand.  These were the reasons this system requires "tinkering" by a DIY installation.I'm not one to "tinker"....my GE product had no such difficulties...while both products had essentially the exact installation procedures.Please remember, the Simplisafe tech's via phone...were supportive.  I just found their product inferior, something they obviously have no control over.

Reviews.Title: Great option for the home and business
Reviews.Author: Bocajay
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a good system for my home. I'm not in a high crime area but you never know and most break-in's happens during the day when most people are at work. Did not want a contract had it done it burned the T-shirt. Started my online due diligence and like what I learned about Simplisafe systems. I like the base station can be in another part of the home and the cellular technology since phone line can be cut. Read reviews checked out the company and made the decision to move ahead with there Simplisafe system II. Set up was easy. The fob did work correctly with my computer there customer service was excellent to walk me through and will replace the fob to correct the issue. We all hope we would never need a alarm but very satisfied with there excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent System For Those That Own A Medium-sized Home
Reviews.Author: Michael Pate "Aspiring Psych Grad Student"
Reviews.Content: We have used Simplisafe for two years. Simple system, excellent customer service, and a price point that is appropriate! Since there isn't a contract, Simplisafe keeps updating its services to maintain its customer base, which I really appreciate. Excellent return policy as well!

Reviews.Title: ease of use, great customer service
Reviews.Author: J. Bellizzi Jr. "Gonzo"
Reviews.Content: I dont know why their are negative reviews on this site about Simplisafe.  I had my issues with the company also, but their customer service department either replaced parts, or got me through any of my messes that I had.  Simply put, Simplisafe has the best, top notch customer service out their!!! Try ADT and see what kind of service you get their!! I mean you have to judge by response time, ability to solve the issue\issues, and friendliness of the representative!!  To me thats what sells a product.  The product performs great now, and am very happy!!

Reviews.Title: gman
Reviews.Author: gman
Reviews.Content: I love this system. It was easy to install and it works flawlessly. I've had mine on my rental home for over a year and have had no issues at all. I highly recommend this product. If people review this product saying the magnetic points don't stay on or whatever, then they didn't install them correctly. Plain and simple. Buy this alarm system if you want to avoid those big brand names with their huge monthly costs and their long term contracts. Look no further!

Reviews.Title: simpli safe
Reviews.Author: Michael Peter
Reviews.Content: Purchased their system after hearing their company being advertised on a national radio broadcast. Their video tutorial also seemed easy enough. BUT, after installation....nothing but problems. System never seems to work and for various reasons. Their phone support is non-existant. Prepare to be on hold for over half hour anytime you call...also be prepared to get different answers for why your system does not work properly. Don't say I didn't warn you. I have a like new simplisafe alarm system that I would like to sell! Please contact me if interested. I have since also purchased another brand name wireless alarm for my mothers residence and no comparison,,,,works flawlessly. There are other choices out there. Don't fall victim to simplisafe advertising.

Reviews.Title: Great product, easy to use, effective and neat
Reviews.Author: Douglas Bailey
Reviews.Content: Maybe the best part of this product is being able to kiss off ADT - or one of those other alarm monitoring companies - that was charging me $50.00 a month and then demanded another $600 when I wanted to quit. Apart from that, though, Simplisafe is what is promises, simple - as in incredibly easy to install and operate - and safe - offering as good if not better protection than the high-priced competitors. Like all great ideas, you have to think "why didn't someone think of this sooner?"  My one nitpick - a small one - that the cap on the keychain USB remote comes off easily and I've lost one already. That's a pretty small criticism.

Reviews.Title: Simple to setup and easy to use
Reviews.Author: neal hubbard
Reviews.Content: The products are great. Easy to use and setup. Had a little trouble getting the external sirent to sync, but found the information on the forums. Other than that very happy.

Reviews.Title: 15-Piece Master Package Home Security
Reviews.Author: Gary Blanchat
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for a easy to install home security system, that required no phone line for connection.I accidentally found Simplisafe2 on a web site I visit frequently, I knew immediately this was the system for useven though it was a bit more expensive.One of the key factors is the distance the "Door Sensors" would signal the base, 400ft. I have a 5th wheelRV that sits next to the house and also a detached garage. This system protects both of these areas withno problem.Another key to my decision was the "Customer Service" I received when I contacted Simplisafe before thepurchase. They are quick to respond to e-mail questions, with easy to understand answers. I couldn't be moresatisfied with the purchase of the "15-Piece Master Package"

Reviews.Title: A Great & Affordable System
Reviews.Author: Musicdragon
Reviews.Content: Super easy to install.Instructions were clear & any questions I had were quickly and completely answered by the folks at SimpliSafe.I added a smoke detector, which lowered my homeowners insurance 10%,so the monthly monitoring, in effect, costs only $5/month.

Reviews.Title: Easy and quick
Reviews.Author: Wayne Edwards
Reviews.Content: I looked at several systems that a home owner could install and a wireless system that worked like all of the expensive systems. I also was looking for a system that had a reasonable monthly fee and no contract. SimpliSafe met all my needs.  I was impressed with the help I received from the two calls I made to the help desk to reset the siren and base unit.  I would recommend SimpliSafe to anyone who is looking for a good alarm system.

Reviews.Title: Works just like advertised
Reviews.Author: charlie C.
Reviews.Content: I seen Simplisafe advertised on The Blaze TV and thought it would be great for me. I ordered it and installed it in about two and a half hours. Installed about fifteen sensors  on windows and doors. Just follow the instructions and you will be fine. Works fine and at fifteen dollars a month can't beat it. Only thing I will say is be careful opening or closing mini blinds so they don't knock off the sensor. It really is not a problem, just hold the blind so it don't hit. If it does come off it's simple to put back on. No wires to worry about or contracts.

Reviews.Title: Practicle Home Security System
Reviews.Author: Steven C. Sikora "Sikora"
Reviews.Content: We have had our unit for 2 months now and could not be happier with it.  Very easy and quick to install. We used the 3M tape and no issue thus far. We kept the screws incase we decide to secure them in the future.  Great alternative to home security.If you decide not to get yours monitored make sure you contact the company to get the download to eliminate error messages.  Monitoring appears to be comparable to other home monitoring systems.

Reviews.Title: What a Great Product!
Reviews.Author: DougF
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, EVERYTHING about this product works!  It arrived quickly, installed in less than a couple of hours (for the entire house), was simple to test, simple to activate - no complaints at all.  We added sensors for every window and door on the original order, and all of the sensors were already set up so the main unit recognized them - again, it just made it easy.  I would definitely recommend this product - and I already have!

Reviews.Title: Very simple to setup and overall a great value but could use a few improvements
Reviews.Author: travonius
Reviews.Content: I love how simple this system is to setup.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a "no commitment" alarm.  Using a web based system for configuring all the settings makes things extremely simple compared to the old system I had, which I never could actually figure out how to use.  There are many different settings you can customize to make the alarm work exactly how you like.I would recommend a couple enhancements to SimpliSafe:1. The keypad should have back-lit keys so that you can see them in the dark without turning on a light.2. Make the keypad tell you when the alarm is armed or turned off, etc. Having it done via the base station is sub-par because often times the base station is in another room so you can't hear what it says.3. Make the magnets that go on Windows and doors a thinner profile.  It is awkward to fit them onto my windows because they are so wide. I imagine many people have this issue.  The picture they show of the entry sensor being placed on a window shows all flat window trim, my house has no flat window trim and I bet this is the case for many folks.

Reviews.Title: Fast, convenient installation. "Easy Setup Wizard" is helpful.
Reviews.Author: Asya Olshan
Reviews.Content: The online description of the system that you ordered is exactly what you receive. It comes in a very secure packaging with clear explanation on each box regarding what is included in it,  plus some helpful advice for installation.  Nothing is missing, The installation guide in printed booklet "Owner's Manual", and on computer screen in "Setup Wizard" is clear and right to the point. The support group of "Simplisafe" is there for you by phone, and if you choose to leave a request to call you back, they do call back in a reasonable time frame. I found that people in support know system very well and also patient. Very comforting to know that if you have a question along the way, there are people ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: Great System
Reviews.Author: RDW
Reviews.Content: Ordered SimpliSafe system and we are impressed with how easy it was to install and how sophisticated the system is.  Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Wish I had bought it sooner!
Reviews.Author: P. Douglas Miller
Reviews.Content: I kept saying we need an alarm system, & then our house got broke in to (waited too long). Purchased the Simplisafe system, installed in about 30 min. I don't worry about our stuff anymore. Works great!  Thinking about cameras now.

Reviews.Title: Great Service
Reviews.Author: K. Pataria "Karen"
Reviews.Content: simple and safe to use the system.  I m loving it. I would recommend to anytime to use their product.  Thank you,

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Wolfe
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  For a little over $500 I have security and fire alarms in my house.  I am a 54 year old woman and I installed the system myself.  It was pretty easy.  The whole set up is easy; my 15 year old daughter can use it as well as my 81 year old mother.  I will probably add some more entry components for the windows as time goes on.The only problem I am having is I think my dog may be setting off one of the motion detectors, but from what i can tell I probably just need to raise the height where ti is mounted.  When my alarm went off, the folks at the monitoring center were very attentive and helpful.One thing that would be great is if they carried cameras too.  I want a couple of cameras for a few problem areas around my home, and it would be wonderful if they were integrated into the security system.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend
Reviews.Author: nd and bu mom
Reviews.Content: The Simplisafe system was mailed promptly.  The instructions were very clear and concise.  It was so easy to install. The company was in contact (via email) making sure any questions I may have had were answered. What I really love about Simplisafe2 is that we will be able to take the system to our next home, there was no contract for monitoring service to sign and the monitoring monthly fee is less than half of what I previously paid with ADT.

Reviews.Title: Works just like you hope it would
Reviews.Author: Pete R
Reviews.Content: The system is very simple to set up, particularly because whatever sensors you ordered are preprogrammed into the system. As soon as you pull the battery tab on, say, an entry sensor, it connects to the base station and registers. Looking at the keypad, I noticed it was telling me that it couldn't connect to certain sensors. At first I thought they might be out of range, but then I realized I just hadn't unpacked them from the box yet! I had no issues getting the sensors to work regardless of where I put them (even in the garage or the most distant corner of the house).One issue I did have is with cell reception, but that's not SimpliSafe's fault. I don't get T-Mobile reception at my house, and in the past I had to have a booster before I finally switched to Verizon. In my part of the country, SimpliSafe uses T-Mobile by default. It *might* be good if they asked when you order what cell carrier you'd prefer, since people tend to know what carrier has the best reception for them. Perhaps there's a reason why they don't, but in any case I called customer support and they shipped out a new cell card free of charge, and I swapped out the card in the base station.One very minor nit is that the system comes with additional 3M Command adhesive strips (located on the back of the lid that contains the remote), but if you buy a bunch of extra sensors like I did, you don't get enough extra strips per sensor for corner mounting. The motion sensors have a 90-degree field of view, so typically you'd want to put them in a corner of the room. However the sensors come with a single adhesive strip directly in back of them. There are placeholders for additional strips to allow attaching to the corner of a room, but you need to put those strips in. Long story short, I ordered some more strips:  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0014CQGW4/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i01?ie=UTF8&psc;=1Other than that, the system is very state-of-the-art and user friendly. Even with the basic monitoring package, I can go on the web site and see a log of when the system was activated and deactivated, which remote did it, etc. When I ran a test, I got an immediate call from the dispatch service. Customer support is good and responsive.The main issue with any alarm system is false alarms, because in most cities you'll get a certain number of false alarm allowances, and then the city will charge you for more. I haven't had any false alarms yet; so far so good. I made sure to place the motion sensors so that they aren't pointing at exterior windows or hit by sunlight, so barring sensor failure I hope to have no issues in that department. You have 60 days to return the system, so that should be plenty of time to see if false alarms are an issue and attempt to mitigate them.SimpliSafe also notifies you if your city requires an alarm permit. It turns out mine does, much to my annoyance -- but while I'm annoyed with the city (if they already charge in the event of false alarms, why should I pay them extra just to own an alarm?), I appreciate SimpliSafe doing that homework for me.All-in-all, with the price, features, simplicity, good customer support, and 60-day return policy, plus the ability to easily move with the system, this is a no-brainer slam-dunk for an alarm system.

Reviews.Title: Great system, Great Pricing, Easy setup
Reviews.Author: Joshua Anders
Reviews.Content: I got simplisafe because it came highly recommended by someone I respect incredibly. Everything has worked like a charm. The only think I would suggest is that they come up with a better process regarding the permit issue. I received a letter stating that they had no info on alarm permits in my area and would welcome my assistance and even warned me of fines if I wasn't registered with my local emergency services. The problem is the process in which it takes can be complicated and some people just don't understand what you are asking for. It has been a very confusing process which none of my friends with other alarm companies even had to fool with. I am still uncertain as to what I should have right now or not. So, as I said, the system itself works like a charm but the permit thing could definitely use some refining.

Reviews.Title: It's been in practice mode for 1 day - too soon to tell
Reviews.Author: George L. Payne
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Easy installation, easy set up, $14.99/month monitoring(was paying $58/month for ADT/w cellular backup)Cons:  Key pad does not have lighted keys - you may get false alarms in the dark, no provision for mounting sensor on garage door

Reviews.Title: Sleeping better at night
Reviews.Author: George W. Plesa
Reviews.Content: The price was fair, the customer service is excellent, the system is easy to install and set up, and it is easy to use. I did quite a bit of planning so I ordered numerous extra sensors. I would advise doing that and get the additional Rush discount that is available only on the initial purchase. It shaved $60.00 off the cost. I live in a nearly crime free walled community but there is an occasional burglary. We have no shortage of glass in our home so the glass break sensors are quite useful. My homeowners insurance will drop $5.00 to $15.00 a year after I install the smoke detector. Nothing to get excited about. Overall I am pleased with the system and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Easy Peasey
Reviews.Author: denis wier
Reviews.Content: This was as easy to set up as shown in the video The inspector for the city was very impressed and might order one for his house

Reviews.Title: It doesn't get any easier!
Reviews.Author: EO
Reviews.Content: Why spend hundreds or maybe even thousands on an alarm system that comes with strings attached? Say NO to the never ending contract and the high priced alarm systems.We are elated with our new Simply Safe system. The installation was very easy, installing 2 motion sensors, 2 broken glass sensors, 13 entry/window sensors, a keypad and the base, took about an hour. Yes, that's it, one hour! The website and the mobile application are very intuitive. This system is the best out there! We are very happy we found Simply Safe!

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe2 Home System
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Walsh
Reviews.Content: I bought and installed a high end package and added a glass break sensor to the kits entry sensors, freeze sensor, water sensor, motion detectors, etc.  Installation was simple and the most difficult part was mounting the smoke detector and carbon monoxide detector to the ceiling,  Just had to use a ladder and use the provided expansion anchors.  In my area, I need a police permit.  Simplisafe support provided the form partially completed for me to sent to the police (with a check of course).

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe - Excellent experience in every way
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey T. Higgins
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased the system I emailed Simplisafe with a question. I had a thorough answer within 24 hours. Ordering on-line was easy and the prices are reasonable. Delivery was on time. Installation and setup are easy and take little time. Configuration of the system using the keychain remote or using the website is very easy. I have ordered additional sensors and they are very easy to add to the system. Practice mode worked for three days as promised, and the live monitoring began when expected. I was able to print the security certificate and submit it to my insurance agent for a discount on my homeowner's insurance. I am very pleased with the system.

Reviews.Title: simplisafe
Reviews.Author: nancy uhl
Reviews.Content: too soon to write a review just yet, but so far everything is good. will let you know how it go's

Reviews.Title: Great system -- blows away ADT
Reviews.Author: buckeye14
Reviews.Content: I love this security system -- so much better than the ADT system I had in my old house, and the monthly monitoring is much cheaper too ($25/month with full smartphone control and alerts, vs. ~$40/month for old system w/o any smartphone controls or alerts).  I had to install it myself, but they made it really easy, and I got to avoid the high-pressure sales tactics from traditional alarm companies.  I love the customization you can do with this, and how much control you have with their website and smartphone app.  We can remotely check whether the system is on or off, and change settings remotely.  I think I'll be ordering one of their smoke alarms and carbon monoxide detectors soon too.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Brian Franklin
Reviews.Content: I installed my system last week.  It was easy to setup and configure.Non-techies or those otherwise intimidated by technology may need a little help but it is very doable.i love the Mobile app and Web portal.i recommend this system for anyone looking for an extra layer of security for their home or business.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with Simplisafe Home Security System
Reviews.Author: Bill SanGiacomo
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the ease with which the system can be set up. I like the attractiveness of the base station and the accompanying materials. The directions were easy to follow and the follow-up emails asking about support help, etc. were greatly appreciated. I would recommend the system to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great product and simple installation
Reviews.Author: richard moore
Reviews.Content: No regrets about this purchase!  SimpliSafe Wireless Home Security System lives up to it's claim for simple installation and attentive monitoring.  i'm very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Super easy install and a great product
Reviews.Author: jeanette
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed with the ease of set up and install. Had it all hooked up within 2 hours. That included naming all my stations, assigning the family with individual pass codes and setting up the smartphone app.

Reviews.Title: Best security system ever!
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: We've had several different security systems in the past and this by far is the best.  I shopped around quite a bit before deciding on this system and became frustrated with all of the "add-on" costs of other systems as well as their lengthy and expensive contracts.  I love the ability to customize my system, not only with the number and placement of sensors but the online functionality.  I would recommend this system to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Installation was fast and easy. Being able to control the system from the phone is great. I'm telling everyone to switch to Simplisafe

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: R. Packham
Reviews.Content: I Purchased it two weeks ago.  Install and setup was quite easy, and operation is simple.I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Product and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Laarmstrong
Reviews.Content: Really enjoy the piece of mind Simplisafe gives us. Their customer support is very helpful and courteous. They forgot to send the extra 105db siren with my original kit and I called that night and left a voice mail. Simplisafe called me the next morning and apologized and sent the siren out the next day no questions asked. Love the text message alerts and being able to control everything from my phone.

Reviews.Title: Great System and Support
Reviews.Author: Sheila Capitosti
Reviews.Content: Saved half the money on getting this system and have twice the protection . Set up in no time at all. I had trouble with 1 key chain remote and they sent a new one out the same day . Everyone should have this system.

Reviews.Title: Initial reaction pretty good
Reviews.Author: Suzanne "Suzanne"
Reviews.Content: Probably should wait a while to write this review but they ask me so here it is.  So far very easy to install and seems to work fine.  I wanted to try it first without the dispatch service so I need to figure out how to get the base station to quit saying thats not working.  I dont want it to work right now.  Also I have a lot of sliding glass doors so I am trying to figure out should I use the entry sensors or the breaking glass ones with that.  Certainly A LOT cheaper than the other companies that come and install and I have heard horror stories of the installers actually being the ones who break in!  So with SIMPLIsafe you have control over your own house which I like.Also like that you can try things and move them around your self like motion sensors, I am still working on the best places for that.  You can also order additional parts pretty inexpensively.  It will be interesting to see how long the batteries work on the individual sensors but the keypad will let you know that.  You can also order fire detectors and connect them, which I think I will do because then the keypad would let me know when I need to replace the batteries.  For someone who likes control and being able to tweak their own system this is the system for you.

Reviews.Title: I dig this security system.
Reviews.Author: twitter.com/Bo_Matthews
Reviews.Content: Hi.  I very rarely write reviews.  I just moved from a home in the suburbs to a condo in a metropolitan area.  In our previous home, we had a monitored security system that was installed professionally, cell hookup, all that.  It was a nice system, but sure- I had a hefty monthly fee.When we moved to the condo- we had no system, and I don't know how long we will be here (renting).  After doing much research (google) I decided to go with this system to secure my home.  After ordering, it arrived a few days later- and it seriously took me 20 minutes to install.  As a techy, I actually thought setting it up was fun.  It looks just as durable as my old system.  I ran into ZERO issues with the setup.  I set the base station fairly close to the front door - so we could easily hear the chimes and announcement when the door opens.  I love the online interface, and also the app for iphone.  Seriously think that this thing is better and more intuitive than my previous system.  It's great.  I DID buy the extra alarm/speaker because I read some reviews saying that the base station wasn't loud enough.  (I haven't tested how loud it is yet-  but I can see how it would be needed..)  I highly recommend this product.  It's professional grade stuff-  with a great price.Oh-  My wife- totally impressed that I installed it, and she likes it more than our previous system.

Reviews.Title: I love this security system!
Reviews.Author: Curley Q
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed installing it myself! It was easy after watching the installation video! And I especially enjoy saving so much money on the monthly monitering fees! The system works wonderfully and I feel much more secure and safe. I highly recommend SimpliSafe to anyone who wants a home security system.

Reviews.Title: So Far, it's good
Reviews.Author: J. Wilkonski
Reviews.Content: The system that I have seems to be working fine for me, to date. In my county I need a permit for a security system and that has been applied for, that is why the four star rating. Once I receive the permit and am actually able to use the 24/7 monitoring system the star rating may change. My hope is that it will go to a five star.

Reviews.Title: Use w a barn
Reviews.Author: James W. Dewberry
Reviews.Content: Used in an open barn with equipment on a farm.  Works great.  Motion sensors with siren produces quite a racket. Recommend

Reviews.Title: Simpl Safe system exceeds my expectations
Reviews.Author: Stupp
Reviews.Content: I had a few glitches/ false alarms right after installation, but with helpful assistance from Simpli Safe staff on the telephone, I was able to straighten out these minor problems.While my family was away, I was very pleased with the coverage and protection afforded to our house via Simpli Safe.  A nearby friend became the emergency contact for the alarm system, and there were no issues whatsoever.- Herb Stupp

Reviews.Title: Easy to install home security system
Reviews.Author: Monte R. Mineard Sr
Reviews.Content: An easy self-install, quality components, easy to follow setup guide, great price!  Plan to install in my other home too.

Reviews.Title: So Simple
Reviews.Author: PLK
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this purchase.  It was a breeze to install and I love that I can take it with me wherever I go.  Very smart system with the brains taken out of the control panel, the duress code, the safe word, the key chain remote with panic button, etc.  If you are in an older home and don't want to spend money/hassle on wiring, this is the system for you.  The adhesive works well.  I did have to move one that I didn't place well the first time.  I followed the instructions to remove and replace the adhesive and it worked just fine - no damage to surface.  Best of all the cost for monthly monitoring is about half of everyone else and no contract.  Love not having a contract. Really nothing negative I can say about this system.

Reviews.Title: I've owned many security systems and SimpliSafe offers the best, in my opinion.
Reviews.Author: Gary Crane
Reviews.Content: The SimpliSafe security system was a snap to install and setup. Within two hours I had every component installed and had all parameters tested.  Even had our smartphones controlling the system remotely. I am very pleased with this well-thought-out product. And I am sure I saved a ton of money over other systems.

Reviews.Title: Simpli Easy to Install
Reviews.Author: RS
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install. Seems to work just as advertised. Good solution for a small space. I feel much better now when I'm out of town for business.

Reviews.Title: Excellent protection with no Contract
Reviews.Author: Mary Gasaway
Reviews.Content: After looking at several home security systems we settled on Simplisafe. It took about 30 minutes to set up. It is very easy to use. The hours that customer service is available are rather inconvenient. If you want to get questions answered you need to call during Mon-Fri.Great security system and easy to use. We are happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: I would highly recommend it to anyone.
Reviews.Author: Mary Minnich
Reviews.Content: This was a very easy system to install and it works wonderful for me.  Couldn't haveselected a better system.

Reviews.Title: A very good experience
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: I wondered if it was a bunch of advertising hype about setting up the system in 5 minutes. They weren't kidding. It really is that simple. I think I spent more time thinking through my options and placement, than I did in the actual set up. I set up the keypad, 2 motion sensors, entry alarm and base station in 2250 sq foot Man Cave. I have recommended it to my kids.

Reviews.Title: an amazing and inavative system
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Patton
Reviews.Content: It was easy to install and it works well. I have recommended it to my friends. I tested it and the service called immediately.

Reviews.Title: Great technology, great price, easy to install, foolproof protection
Reviews.Author: Glynn Brooks
Reviews.Content: This is the package of features, security and convenience that we have been waiting for. We have often talked about protecting our home with an alarm system for over 25 years, but the packages available from national services have long commitments and high monthly fees. But SimpliSafe is different.We have never seen an alarm system + monitoring service that was so technically advanced, reasonably priced, easy to install, portable to a new location, and simple to use. It provides us peace of mind every time we leave the house. It works when the lights go out, and requires no telephone line since it has built-in cellular phone service. We feel like this is one of the best investments we've ever made!

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe2 Wireless Home Security System
Reviews.Author: Eileendresser
Reviews.Content: I have had this system for 2 weeks now. So easy to install and use compared to others. I feel safe with it.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money.
Reviews.Author: Lowen C Crusan
Reviews.Content: Have my system operational for 2 weeks. So far, zero problems. Had to call support and they took care of my issue quickly.Wish they had a better iPhone app and could integrate video.

Reviews.Title: Great system for the money and easy to install.
Reviews.Author: Joseph K. Cyr
Reviews.Content: System worked as advertised. I had no issues with installation or system testing. Base system worked well enough for me to purchase additional sensors. I added a smoke detector, another motion sensor for downstairs and another entry sensor for my tool shed, which is about 60 feet from the base station in the house. Add-ons were easily installed and checked out. Customer support was great in answering my questions and the alarm monitoring company was very prompt to call when I went live and tested the system.I have another alarm system in our vacation home which costs a lot more money and is much more difficult to install, as it is a wired system. They both do the same job and I feel just as confident with the SimpliSafe system as the other more expensive system.I submitted my SimpliSafe monitored certificate to my insurance company, to apply for a premium reduction. The agent said that I should get a small reduction... time will tell.Overall, I'm very satisfied with the system and feel it would be difficult to find another system as well designed and easy to install as this one for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  How Easy was this?
Reviews.Author: M. Heath "Escapes with Books"
Reviews.Content: I had heard Simplisafe advertised on the radio and decided to investigate.  While we don't really live in a high crime area, the world is getting crazier by the minute, and felt it was time.  We not only researched security systems on the web, but we also asked friends and family about their systems. The responses were interesting to say the least.  High monitoring fees and non-functioning systems were just some of the responses we got.  We ordered the Simplisafe package which arrived in 5 days, and Saturday morning of Memorial day weekend we set it up.  It took approximately 45 minutes (until WE were satisfied).  Once done, we connected with the monitoring service where we then received 72 hours to become familiar with the system before we went "live".  We tweaked motion detectors, set off the panic button (EXTREMELY LOUD) and did everything possible to learn the system.  I was grateful for the 72 hours!  Tuesday morning we received an e-mail stating we were now "live".  I feel protected and secure, and know should I have any questions or concerns, it's just an e-mail away.  I will now recommend this Simplisafe to anyone and everyone who is exploring the idea of a home security system.

Reviews.Title: I love simplisafe!!
Reviews.Author: Kec Do
Reviews.Content: I love simplisafe!!Get itworth the moneyProtect your family and your hard earned valuableAnd its easy to install.....

Reviews.Title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
Reviews.Author: Zoo Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a great system. It works flawlessly.  It does require a bit of a learning curve to access all of it's features, but this is testimony to its versatility. I am practicing how to make best use of it's features and have set up monitoring (essential for security). I already feel more secure.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use system
Reviews.Author: Katie Brandon
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up and nice having control of features. You can't beat the price for components or monitoring. Key chain remote is annoying, large and cap always falls off.

Reviews.Title: Easy and Fast Installation
Reviews.Author: Mike Green
Reviews.Content: Great system.  Very easy instructions allowed setup to be done in less than 30 minutes in 5 br / 2 story house.

Reviews.Title: MUST HAVE Security System!
Reviews.Author: dpr1961
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I forked out the $600 for the SimpliSafe Security System.  My old Alarm company only gave me 1 motion sensor & 2 door sensors & a keypad, while charging me $99 up front and locking me in a 3 year contract.  Note: if you don't cancel contract with other companies the month contract expires, they automatically renew your contract for another 3 years.  With SimpliSafe, you can stop mointering services if you need & start it up later.  NO MORE CONTRACTS!  My kit had 4 door sensors, 1 room temp sensor, 1 water sensor, external siren, CO detector, smoke detector, 2 motion sensors, 2 key chain Fobs, 2 keypads.  What's GREAT, I can, will, order more motion sensors & glass break sensors & 1 more keypad for one more entry door.  I hated my previous company because they would charge me $40 for extra remote fob & $75 for tech to come out and program fob.  With SimpliSafe, I order what sensor I need & I, repeat (I), program it to my system.  I like this because when someone else comes to program your system, they know where sensors are placed & how to get around system.  Now, if SimpliSafe would sell security Cameras, system will be complete.  This is the BEST INVESTMENT I have made for my home safety.

Reviews.Title: So happy with it.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Affordable, easy to install and makes me feel secure. Highly recommend the system. I especially like the remote.  Great idea.

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: MARCO CALDERON
Reviews.Content: The system is very east install thru out the house. The only disappointing thing with this system is that you cannot monitor your system via your smartphone. You have to sign up for monitoring service do have that feature. The system does not have a wi-fi a option that should be put into the main tower. I hope they read this & maybe they can offer that in the future. With wifi then we can monitor our system via smartphones without the service.Overall....I am happy so far...

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: James L. Tabor
Reviews.Content: This is the most innovative product I have seen in a long time. Works like magic and seamlessly installs. Kudos to the creator and can't wait for the IPO. This will be serious competition for the big names in the industry. You will soon see their version of this product.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend!
Reviews.Author: Joseph M. DeSimone
Reviews.Content: Easy install-  Got what I thought it is!  Professional approach.  I would recommend. Just follow the written instructions and you are installed.

Reviews.Title: Here's what I think about SimpliSafe
Reviews.Author: WHJ
Reviews.Content: Good system. Reasonable! Please keep it that way. Base station and extra siren could be a little louder. I used one of the entry sensors on an outbuilding which is in my back yard about 75 feet from the base station...works fine!

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe is Simplieasy to install.
Reviews.Author: Luke A Huntley
Reviews.Content: 5 of 5 stars because of the ease of installation and ease of operation. It should be called Simpli-easy.This system is better and more cost effective than ADT or Brinks.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to install
Reviews.Author: Ruth Lowery
Reviews.Content: Had a little trouble getting the base station to make its first test. Corey at customer service was very helpful and got the problem taken care of.  No problems using the system at all.  Super happy.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Walt
Reviews.Content: I have had this system for almost a year and just am so happy with it! Very easy to use and setup and the peace of mind I have from it makes it priceless!

Reviews.Title: Great Self Installed System
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Scrogham
Reviews.Content: we were in a rental home with this system and love it.  So when we built our home, we looked it up and went with this system.  I like that I can choose to monitor the home with their service or leave it "deactivated" right from the get go.  It allows us to know if the doors open and audible alarm when the doors are open with the "home" feature at night.

Reviews.Title: Very simple to install
Reviews.Author: Sue E. Brozovsky
Reviews.Content: Directions were clear and the system was easy to install.  We have no cell service in our area and we needed a little extra help from customer service.  Our rep was helpful and courteous in helping me get the system up and running.

Reviews.Title: Works great!  Highly recommend
Reviews.Author: bossome
Reviews.Content: I've had two previous homes with alarm systems, so this is not my first.  This is by far the easiest to live with, and installation was literally done in less than 15 minutes.  Great execution and I love the iPhone app and web interface to operate remotely.

Reviews.Title: Perfect system
Reviews.Author: George Wettstaedt
Reviews.Content: Product arrived as schduled.  Installation took only about 20 minutes.  System was up and running correctly except for one door sensor which was located inside a steel sided building on a steel door about 150 ft from the base.  Moved the sensor to the outside of the door and everything was working fine.  Ordered additional 3 sensors and installed and programmed them into the system in 10 minutes.  Great system.

Reviews.Title: Excellent security system
Reviews.Author: dorethea hairston
Reviews.Content: I would surely recomend this system to my family and friends.Very easy to setup and it's a good quality security system i especially like that fact that you can add on to your system and i can secure my home for about 15.00 dollars a month.Five star!!!

Reviews.Title: Easy to install, very good alarm system.  Excellent support.
Reviews.Author: R. Clodfelter
Reviews.Content: So far the system was easy to install, and seems to work well. I had one problem with the smoke detector beeping but I think it has been corrected.  The customer support so far has been very good.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe is the Best
Reviews.Author: bobs
Reviews.Content: Monthly paid service, cancel or start service at any time !!Installation takes about 1/2 hour and saves you a bunch of cash !Simplisafe is a No Brainer !! - get it !

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe Security Sys.
Reviews.Author: Charles S. Steffey
Reviews.Content: The order arrived quickly and was easily installed with no problems. We are pleased with the ease of set up and operation. I recommend it to anyone needing a home security system.

Reviews.Title: Great System
Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: It is easy to set up and use. Everything comes pre-programmed and is ready to go right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Simplisafe is SimpliEasy to install
Reviews.Author: Fred W. Patterson "DrArt"
Reviews.Content: The system arrived in a timely manner and was easy to install.  Following the directions included, I was able to install all the sensors in just a few minutes.  After a few tries, I was able to activate the system and it is working well (no triggered alarms yet, but the testing went well).  It appears to be a good value for the money spent and the monthly monitoring fee is the smallest I have found.

Reviews.Title: Simple and easy setup.
Reviews.Author: Mara Reaves
Reviews.Content: The system was the easiest to setup.  I had it online within 30 minutes.  I love how easy it is to add additional monitoring points.  I recommend this system.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with our purchase
Reviews.Author: Happy Grandma "Julie U"
Reviews.Content: We purchased our system after our home was broken into. We checked ADT and then our son reminded us that Dave Ramsey indorsed SImlipsafe. We purchased the system online. Delivery was quick. We installed the system ourselves. We had a few questions so we called the customer service line. Their representative was helpful and knowledgeable. He helped solve our issues within minutes. We tested our system and they were quick to call. Monthly charges fit the budget. Happy so far!

Reviews.Title: Easy setup/install
Reviews.Author: J. Munson
Reviews.Content: I really like how easy it was to set up.  I had a small issue and called support and was helped very quickly.  Activation was simple and straightforward.  The app works fine to check on events for the $19.99 level.

Reviews.Title: SimpliSafe  - Simply Meets our Needs
Reviews.Author: Tom Forse
Reviews.Content: We heard SimpliSave advertised on national radio shows of people we trust.  The hardware package is a little pricey, but considering the low cost of monthly monitoring and the ability to easily modify the system added to its portability, it has been the right choice for us.It was easy to self install and bring on line. We have multiple choices for alarm notifications that can be set up on line by the user.  We're happy with the product.Tom

Reviews.Title: A very good system
Reviews.Author: Ryszard
Reviews.Content: Simple to install. Easy to operate. Extra components are a little pricey, so buy everything in one of the packages if you can.

Reviews.Title: It's what I want for an Alarm System
Reviews.Author: John D. Townsend "johnnytucf"
Reviews.Content: I actually bought mine through Angie's List.  My system came with the base station, 2 keypads, 4 entry sensors (magnetic door sensors), and 1 motion sensor.  The only thing that was kind of annoying to install was the motion sensor, it has a test mode that allows you to see if it's picking up motion where you want it to, but I had to use the sticky tape to set it up and then it took off some paint from the wall when I had to move it and use a new piece of sticky tape.I love the subscription though.  Just $20 month to month.  You can pay more per month, which just allows you to access and change more options on your online "dashboard" but you really don't need to, because it's just as easy to change via telephone or in a different place on the site.  So $20 a month and your house is monitored and we saved like $4 per month on our home-owners insurance.

Reviews.Title: Great System
Reviews.Author: Richard Ingram
Reviews.Content: Had it for a week now and it's been working fine.  One minor problem was that the back garage door sensor ( detached garage) was working intermittently. However after a few minutes with support on the phone is was determined that it was my wireless tv transmitter  in the kitchen was interfering with the signal.  We only use it with the treadmill so no big deal.  Support is fast & great.  Took every bit of 20 minutes to hook up.  Like the Iphone App.  And NO contracts.  The freeze sensor is a huge plus when you are out of town in the winter.  We have a 200 lb English Mastiff and have no problems with the motion detectors.  Mounted upside down about 5 feet from the floor.  Picks us up but not the dog.

Reviews.Title: Simple enough
Reviews.Author: Juan Oscar Velez
Reviews.Content: Good pricing, scalable, no long contracts or commitment and system work perfectly for Home, Office, RV's and Campers. . .

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with my purchase
Reviews.Author: William Pate
Reviews.Content: The installation was very easy.  Wished  the package came with the flood monitor rather than the freeze monitor though.  In my area a freeze monitor will not get used often.  Wished the system would also let you assign a name to all the monitors to make finding the cause of an alarm activation easier.

Reviews.Title: Good product, great terms
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: I like the variety of products, and how packages are customizable.  Also, I think it's great that there is no 2-3 year contract.  I did have some trouble adding additional codes to the system after installation, but not much.

Reviews.Title: Great service
Reviews.Author: Naomi Alvarado
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and affordable  any one could do it great service  got it on Angie's list for a great price

Reviews.Title: Nicely engineered home security system
Reviews.Author: Olivine phenocryst "vertagus"
Reviews.Content: This is well thought out and extremely well integrated security system.  All of the components are well made and initial set up was easy.  It took about 30 minutes to install the master unit,  two wall keyboard units, 4 door alarms, and a motion sensor (also a key fob controller. Setup is done on a computer by inserting the key fob into the usb port (yes the key fob is also a flash drive with all of the necessary software installed---but no software is installed on your computer).  You set up your PIN number and decide on the type of monitoring (not necessary but a wise thing to do). You can also configure each of the components through this program.  After configuring, just plug the key fob into the top of the master unit and all of the configuration parameters are transferred to the unit.  Turning on the alarm is as simple as pushing a button on the keyboard unit or on the key fob.  There is both a home and away mode.There is also a website where you can change, add, and configure pretty much any part of the system.I also downloaded the Android App, which allows me to control certain aspects of the system (like turning it on and off and looking at an event log).  My only complaint is with the motion detector alerts.  A safe alert (just to you and not to the monitoring service) is recorded every time the motion sensor is triggered whether the alarm is on or off.  There should be an option to only receive safe alerts when the alarm in on.  This is a minor point and in no way distracts from the usefulness of this system.  In short, I highly recommend this system as an excellent alternative to an expensive alarm service.  It is easy to set up and works beautifully.

Reviews.Title: A great solution
Reviews.Author: M. Sidden
Reviews.Content: First, I purchased this directly from SimpliSafe, but it was the same system as listed on Amazon.Second, this is truly the simplest system to install I have experienced.  It took literally 20 minutes to install the entire system.  Configuration took a little longer, but was still very simple and quick and within an hour I had a working Security System with monitoring.  The only cumbersome process was pairing the external siren, but that was fairly straightforward as well compared to many systems.SimpliSafe has done a great job of bringing home security systems into the modern age eliminating all wires except for the power on the base station and creating an automation solution that is both easy and powerful.  The Web Interface and Android Apps are simple to use and cover all of the basics, but are a little rough around the edges.  I wish the temperature was automatically updated in the App and the base station didn't announce sync events when using the App to check the house, but minor issue.The only other thing I wish is that they were a little more straightforward on the pricing for monitoring.  They constantly talk to the Base Pricing and you have to dig a little to realize that the interactive pieces are $10 more a month which is still cheaper than the competition, but would have preferred them to be a little more transparent.They are missing a video solution at this time and when that is available, I think they will have the best solution period.

Reviews.Title: Great System
Reviews.Author: G. Reese
Reviews.Content: Easy to install, seamless hook up and protection with cellular alarm system.Reasonable cost based on my experience with older systems.

Reviews.Title: Great Security System
Reviews.Author: Mark Anderson
Reviews.Content: 1st time home buyer & was looking for the added peace of mind of having a home security system. I heard about Simplisafe on the radio & when I looked into their products & pricing, they were significantly less expensive than other providers (ADT, CPI, etc.). Once I ordered, the shipment came within a few days and setup of a key pad, siren, the base station, half a dozen entry sensors, & a handful of motion sensors took less than an hour. That included reading the instructions, mounting, & configuring.  Since I activated the system I have had no issues & everything is working great!

Reviews.Title: Survey Response
Reviews.Author: Louis J. Kerdock
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with security system. Easy to order and installing devices, as well as using system. The no-contract and low monthly monitor cost were the deciding factors choosing Simplisafe. I tell all my family and friends about Simplisafe.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy With The System
Reviews.Author: J. Hu
Reviews.Content: After with ADT for 3 years and paying high monthly fee, I finally decided to switch to SimpliSafe after some of investigation. So far I am very happy with my decision. I ordered the device directly from SimpliSafe because I needed to a few extra components.Pro:(1) Easy to install the system and the designs of components and test process are very thoughtful.(2) The wireless remote distance of door entry sensor is impressive.(3) I can check the status from my Windows phone with SimpliSafe app after paying just $15 a month.Con:(1) The buttons on keypad is small and no glowing light as ADS control panel does. When in dark, you cannot see buttons clearly unless you turn lights first after entering home.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Wayne D Arena
Reviews.Content: I received my system two weeks ago and, so far, it's been everything Simplisafe claimed it would be.  The high points:Ease of Installation. - The sensors can be installed on windows and doors with many different configurations so, regardless of your window/ door style, these will work.  The motion sensors are also designed to work attached to a flat surface or in a corner.The customer support is easy to connect with (no long wait times!) and they were able to answer all of my questions.  Excellent service.  They also were always willing to share tips to maximize the performance.I know it's still quite early but it feels like a quality product from a quality provider.

Reviews.Title: The best security system I've ever had
Reviews.Author: Railroad
Reviews.Content: This system was extremely easy to set up.
